story:
When I wrote Eve's Garden, I hoped that it would remind readers of times when they have felt like outsiders. I hoped it would provide some insights into growing up female, particularly in places and at times when girls and women have had fewer options. And I hoped that it would give readers a better view of Romani people than one can get by watching the extreme "Gypsy" stereotypes one sees on reality TV. You know the ones: child brides in dresses too wide to fit through the door, brawling men, and scam artists. 

Eve's Garden is the story of a Romani-American girl discovering her identity in a North Georgia mill town. Through her journey into the family's past, Eve also learns about the journey of the Romani people from India to spread across the world, and how her own family came to America as slaves and survived to found a vibrant community. It's an uplifting and very intimate story of a Romani family, their devotion to one another, their determination to retain their identity, and the network of friends who support them. I'm grateful that it has been well-received by audiences and critics. (You can find some of the reviews and comments here.)

I have had so many invitations to read from the book and to speak on Romani history and culture, that I have put together a Powerpoint presentation that I have used at Trine University and will use again at Wake Forest University and NYU in New York City. We have further invitations from colleges and universities in New Jersey and California, as well as bookstores and community centers.

In order to introduce future audiences to further stories about the Roma, our history, and current issues, I have invited as collaborator my friend, Vadim Kolpakov, one of our most well-known Romani musicians, who is also an educator, and with whom I've completed projects in the past. (The book's trailer includes music by Vadim's ensemble, Via Romen. You can see the trailer by clicking on the photo at the top of this page.) His music adds immeasurably to the program and his knowledge of Romani culture as an immigrant complements my experience growing up in the United States. 

Vadim and I will combine readings from Eve's Garden with varied styles of Romani music and take the resulting performance on tour to places where readings have not yet occurred, particularly to California and New York City in the summer of 2015. For our audiences, we will provide more information through the slide presentation about the Romani people, including music, art, and history, so that participants will leave with a clear understanding of past and present realities of the Romani experience. These will be readings, concerts, and parties combined, and I guarantee people will leave not only better informed, but also entertained!

We hope to perform the enhanced readings in at least three to five bookstores, plus community centers and other venues on the West Coast and in New York, where we will be heard by a wide cross-section of the public. We will expand our tour to other regions as funds are available.

Read more about Eve's Garden, including reviews and testimonials. 

What We Need & What You Get

My frequent flier miles are gone!

Success has brought a dilemma: Although we have many invitations to speak and perform, we cannot easily get to all the spots, and the organizers of most venues are unable to offer travel expenses. Some offer a small stipend, but none has been able to pay the full cost of offering the program.

Unfortunately, accessible places where the performances can have the most impact, like bookstores and libraries, can't provide fees to help us get there or to pay other expenses on the way, and neither can the small press that published the novel. 

We ask our friends, therefore, to donate to our project, in return for generous rewards, including books, CDs, workshops, and private performances that we hope will add to your own entertainment and knowledge. 

You'll be contributing to a worthwhile cause, that of spreading information about Europe's largest and the U.S.'s least understood minority. You'll be supporting Romani literature and art, and you'll help us begin a tour that we have confidence will pick up speed and backing as we proceed.

What do you get in return? At right we've listed some incentives just for you.

If we don't reach our entire goal of $4500 for the tour, we will do performances at venues closer to home in North Carolina and other nearby Southern states. If we raise more than the required amount, we will extend the tour to the entire East Coast and Florida. 

The Impact

Glenda Bailey-Mershon is a writer with many publication credits, including two chapbooks and one nonfiction book, as well as short stories, essays, and poems, and the 2014 publication of her novel, Eve's Garden, by Twisted Road Publications (Visit Twisted Road Publications.) Also, she is well-known as the editor of four volumes of the Jane's Stories anthologies by women writers, and as an English/GED teacher and workshop instructor. Her dynamic performances often leave audiences on their feet, whether dancing or cheering. Eve's Garden has touched a wide range of people who understand what it means to be an outsider.

Two Powerpoint presentations that Glenda designed to share Romani history have been presented to audiences in North Carolina, Indiana, and Illinois. (See the longer version of that presentation here. ) With degrees in anthropology and graduate study in women's studies and American history, she loves speaking to groups about history, culture, and writing, and has long had involvement with community history projects and artistic collaborations, including several grant projects through both the Illinois and Florida Humanities Councils.

Vadim Kolpakov is one of the most prominent and renowned Russian Romani (Gypsy) 7-string guitarists in the world. He was a lead musician of the Moscow Roma (Gypsy) Theatre Romen, where he performed as a guitarist, composer, vocalist, dancer and dramatic actor. To this day, his original guitar compositions are performed in many prominent plays at the theatre as part of the vibrant oral tradition of the Russian Romani culture. Vadim studied guitar with his uncle, Alexander Kolpakov, the virtuoso Russian 7-string guitarist who served as the musical director of the Romen Gypsy Theatre for over a quarter of a century. 

In 2008, as a member of the Kolpakov Trio, Vadim went on the world tour "Sticky & Sweet" with Madonna. They performed in venues such as Wembley stadium in London, Madison Square Garden in NYC, and Maracana stadium in Rio de Janeiro.

Vadim has given concerts in Carnegie Hall (New York City), as well as in the Kremlin (Moscow) for the Russian president Putin, to Kazakhstan President Nazarbaev, and for both the Finnish and Portuguese presidents and parliaments. 

Well versed in many styles of Romani "Gypsy" music, and in world music, as well, Vadim is the perfect collaborator for a story set in the 1950s-60s in a Southern mill town, among a Romani family struggling to fit in.

Risks & Challenges

These performances entail much more than a reading interspersed with music. They require considerable planning and practice as we merge prose with music.

Because of the uniqueness of our program, and given the enthusiastic questioning from audiences at readings already completed, we have experienced considerable demand, most requests coming from areas far away from our homes, bringing about higher travel expenses.

The logistic issues that such a project has to overcome are finding suitable venues for a combined literary and musical event;  and promoting the performances to the public. We will develop a tour poster and launch a new press kit to publicize events.

To overcome these issues, we have enlisted the help of friends to find venues and lodging. The planning aspect of the project is going well, and there are numerous opportunities for bookings. However, many of those will be in bookstores or schools that cannot afford to pay our expenses; thus, the need to raise funds in order to bring the program to a wider audience. 

We will first plan local programs in the Carolinas that allow us to experiment with formats and performance pieces, before we begin the traveling portion of our tour. We offer you, our past and new supporters, significant rewards for your help and backing. We will also be seeking grants for further program support, and hope to extend our program beyond California to the East Coast, Florida, and the Midwest.

We are so excited about sharing our book, music, history, and arts with the public, and we believe all these obstacles can be overcome! Our extensive network of friends and family will be invaluable to the success of this venture.

                                                                                 ~ Glenda Bailey-Mershon

Other Ways You Can Help

Tapped out? We understand. Please join our campaign by getting the word out to your friends, and please use the Indiegogo share tools to send word through all your social media contacts!

story:
To our fans, family and friends. We're here to ask for your help in funding our upcoming 3rd album. For those who never heard of us before: we are modern death metal band from Lithuanian/Holland - AWAKENING SUN. In Our music we combine elements of modern death metal/hardcore and even rock music. We already released two albums and now it's time to finish our 3rd album called "INTO THE LIGHT".

Fans of: Lamb Of God, Gojira, Whitechapel, The Black Dahlia Murder, Architects should really like our upcoming new album.

Help us collect the money for the release of "INTO THE LIGHT" album.

*FIRST 150 CONTRIBUTORS WILL RECEIVE THEIR CD SIGNED BY THE BAND*


  • Please make sure you PAY SPECIFIED SHIPPING on orders OUTSIDE OF EU, also don't forget to write the size (s, m, l, xl, xxl) and which design you want. 
  • Write down shipping address, full name and e-mail address so we can contact you regarding shirt size.
  • If you pay via PayPal just write down the size and name of T-shirt you want (in case if you choose ,,Package No.15).


IN CASE IF YOU FORGOTTEN SOMETHING YOU CAN GET IN TOUCH WITH US BY E-MAIL: AWAKENINGSUNGOGO@GMAIL.COM

There is no official album release date yet, we're planning to release it in the end of July, when we will come back from our European tour.

You will get your orders as soon as we will get all the merch boxes, around June-July.

Where will the money go?

  • Studio renting
  • Recording
  • Mixing&Mastering
  • Designs
  • Merch items/print
  • Promotion

You can also help us if you will:

  • Share this campaign with your friends
  • On Facebook, twitter or any other social media

story:
This biennial, non-competitive Festival is intended to provide visiting choirs with a memorable experience of Saint John and the Fundy Region.  It is also intended to provide visiting choirs and the local community with amazing choral performances, and to provide an enriching, developmental and educational experience for all singers.

The festival will be open to choirs from around the world. Initially it will be open to mixed voice choirs, and/or senior groups of homogeneous voices, e.g. SSA,TTBB. Children’s choirs will be not included, but the festival will be open to high school aged and adult groups.

Each choir will perform several times at venues in and around Saint John, e.g. churches , outdoor venues, public spaces, etc. which will provide a rich and diverse performance experience. Performances will take place at various times throughout the day, namely lunchtime, mid-afternoon, or evening, depending on the venue. Choirs will perform in a showcase format, i.e. 2-4 choirs, depending on various factors, including venue, size of participating groups, time, etc. It may be possible for choirs to perform an entire program, but that will not be required of all choirs


But we need your help to make this festival a reality

story:
Two summers ago, I spent a week sleeping in a Romani Gypsy caravan at Samois sur Seine, France, and absorbing the chunk-chunk-chunk rhythmic guitar strokes laid out under the spider-like solos weaving together.

The trip to France included a stay at a Parisian artist colony, where I stayed up late night with a resident painter.  We sat in the candlelight making art, him sketching and me working out chords for the song Pulses (which will be on 'Grace').  I then went to London and I cycled around the city throughout the night with one of my collaborators on the album, the electronic producer SLSTCE, whom I had met at the Django Festival campground in France.  I stayed with a visual artist, who explained to me at her studio how she is hypersensitive to what she sees; in observing a blade of grass, for example, she sees various shapes and shades of green.  Her insight is the impetus behind the lyrics for 'Pulses':

I taught my eyes to love / I gave my heart / I carried what I saw / In my arms

Prior to this, I trained to be an opera singer in Canada, the US, Austria, and Italy.       I think of the rehearsal rooms with pianos inviting you to get lost in them;  I think of the iconic melody in 'Clair de lune' by Debussy and the German Lieder I sang by Schumann, Schubert, and Brahms...

One of those German Lieder has made its way to my new body of work.  Appearing in many composer's works as a muse, 'Mignon' is a character in a German romantic novel by Goethe.  She's a young girl singing about her exotic homeland, and I took a stab at an interpretation of her song:

Do you know that path on the high mountainside / Where warmer winds blow when mists divide? / A dragon rears its brood in the far ancient cave / And torrents flow over river rock //

Do you know that land? / Do you know that land? / Do you know that land? // There would I go with you!

During my opera studies, I'd go out to hear electronic, jazz, and world music.  I also worked with the digital composition studio at McGill University, feeling a strong desire to explore digital technology within music.  I needed to know how to combine my experiences.  I searched for this in Montreal and Berlin, and when I decided to move to New York City, I searched for it here, too. 

I became an apprentice audio engineer at a recording studio.  At about the same time, I discovered Gypsy jazz and started performing gig after gig.  I split this work many nights throughout the week, and weeks turned into years.  The trip to Samois and London happened as a consequence of this. 

In my new music, look for traditional Gypsy jazz guitar solos weaving through electronic beats.  Gypsy jazz guitar recordings are also chopped and layered to create percussive elements, taking the idea of the traditional rhythm guitar and using it as a modern music production rhythmic element.  Classical piano and violin are reinterpreted as synthesizer keyboard arrangements and sampled orchestrations.  Electronic beats provide textures and a groove. The pop music part points to the song structures. 

Music is a beautiful thing.  It opens doors and affords us the opportunity to know one another in a unique kind of way.  Music transcends in a world where everybody's looking for peace and everyone is longing for love.  Music in itself is a connection worth pursuing.

This idea flew out of my hands on the guitar to create my song 'Morning'.  Imagining the future lead to this certain sense of longing:

Morning, how long you've lived / Across my eyelids / All that I hoped to give / I lost in my blindness //

Such a beautiful morning / And the sand will only know / Until the rocks melt with the sun / What blooming hearts and hands will grow


Collaborators

I am very fortunate to be working with an incredible team of inspiring and talented musicians who have helped me make these albums:

  • Producer/recording engineer/co-songwriter: Justin Mathews
  • Producer/recording engineer/co-songwriter: Alex Dadras AKA DADRAS
  • Producer/recording engineer/co-songwriter: Sam Jacobs AKA SLSTCE
  • Mixing engineer: Doug Walters
  • Recording and mastering engineer: Mike Monseur at Bias Studios
  • Gypsy jazz guitar: Darius Scheider and Justin Mathews

  




Where will the money go?

Artist fees
Studio rental
Recording + editing + mixing
CD mastering at Bias Studios (sponsored)
Music video editing by Berger Video (sponsored)
USB flash drive and poster duplication at Oasis Disc Manufacturers (sponsored)
Artwork and packaging design
Videography
Photography
Promotion
Printing and shipping
Indiegogo fee + PayPal fee (10%)

*Sponsored elements are the result of winning the Washington Area Music Association's (WAMA) PASS Songwriting Competition.


Why a double EP release and not a full-length album?

The music industry is fast-paced.  Attention spans are shorter.  I would rather have an ongoing stream of releases than one big hunk 'o junk.  All contributors to this project will get a digital download of the second EP when it is ready.


What's in it for you?

I've designed special rewards for the backers of this project, including reusable USB thumb drives, on which you can access the music and album art and reuse the drives for your own purposes.  There are also Django Reinhardt practice rings / brass knuckles, Alarke tees printed on American Apparel shirts, music lessons, private dinners and concerts, and more. 

The title song off the first EP, 'Grace', is written for and dedicated to a special fan who has made all the difference in my life.

Won't you help contribute and perhaps name the second EP?


What will happen with the funds if I don't reach my goal?

If I reach my goal of $10,000, great!  If I don't reach my goal, my project will still receive the amount pledged. In either situation, both Indiegogo and PayPal will each take 5% of the amount raised.

Above: at the WAMMIES, winning New Artist of the Year and Best Debut Album (Midas).  My music has also won the Grand Prize in the WAMA's Professional Artist Support System Songwriting Competition ('Lionheart') and placed as a finalist in the Mid-Atlantic Songwriting Competition ('O, Be I Your Bluebird').


Risks & Challenges

As with any big project, there are a host of challenges and risks. While I’ve done my research, carefully planned the timeline, and secured quotes, roadblocks can happen.  Starting a project of this magnitude is a giant leap of faith.  I am so lucky to work with people who believe in this music and who generously give their time and love to make these recordings possible.

If it's a challenge to be a musician, it's also a necessity; I don't really have a choice.  Music is more than my job or my passion; this is the essence of my life.

By partnering with me in this Indiegogo campaign, you are personally adding your touch to this work.  I can't do it without you and I'm thankful that you're considering coming along with me on this journey.


Video courtesy of Elevtr Trax / Nadeem Salaam

This idea flew out of my hands on the guitar to create my song 'Morning'.  Imagining the future lead to this certain sense of longing:Morning, how long you've lived / Across my eyelids / All that I hoped to give / I lost in my blindness // Such a beautiful morning / And the sand will only know / Until the rocks melt with the sun / What blooming hearts and hands will growCollaborators
I am very fortunate to be working 
with an incredible team of inspiring and talented musicians who have 
helped me make these albums:

Producer/recording engineer/co-songwriter: Justin Mathews 


Producer/recording engineer/co-songwriter: Alex Dadras AKA DADRAS


Producer/recording engineer/co-songwriter: Sam Jacobs AKA SLSTCE

Mixing engineer: Doug Walters


Recording and mastering engineer: Mike Monseur at Bias Studios


Gypsy jazz guitar: Darius Scheider and Justin Mathews


     Where will the money go?
 






Artist feesStudio rentalRecording + editing + mixingCD mastering at Bias Studios (sponsored)Music video editing by Berger Video (sponsored)USB flash drive and poster duplication at Oasis Disc Manufacturers (sponsored)Artwork and packaging designVideographyPhotographyPromotionPrinting and shipping
Indiegogo fee + PayPal fee (10%)

*Sponsored elements are the result of winning the Washington Area Music Association's (WAMA) PASS Songwriting Competition.Why a double EP release and not a full-length album?
The music industry is fast-paced.  Attention spans are shorter.  I would rather have an ongoing stream of releases than one big hunk 'o junk.  All contributors to this project will 
get a digital download of the second EP when it is ready.What's in it for you?I've designed special rewards for the backers of this project, including reusable USB thumb drives, on which you can access the music and album art and reuse the drives for your own purposes.  There are also Django Reinhardt practice rings / brass knuckles, Alarke tees printed on American Apparel shirts, music lessons, private dinners and concerts, and more.  The title song off the first EP, 'Grace', is written for and dedicated to a special fan who has made all the difference in my life.Won't you help contribute and perhaps name the second EP?What will happen with the funds if I don't reach my goal?
If I reach my goal of $10,000, great!  If I don't reach my goal, my project will still receive the amount pledged. In either situation, both Indiegogo and PayPal will each take 5% of the amount raised. Above: at the WAMMIES, winning New Artist of the Year and Best Debut Album (Midas).  My music has also won the Grand Prize in the WAMA's Professional Artist Support System Songwriting Competition ('Lionheart') and placed as a finalist in the Mid-Atlantic Songwriting Competition ('O, Be I Your Bluebird'). Risks & Challenges As with any big project, there are a host of challenges and risks.  While I’ve done my research, carefully planned the timeline, and secured
 quotes, roadblocks can happen.  Starting a project of this magnitude is a giant leap of
 faith.  I am so lucky to work with people who believe in this music and who 
generously give their time and love to make these recordings possible. If it's a challenge to be a musician, it's also a necessity; I don't 
really have a choice.   Music is more than my job or my passion; this 
is the essence of my life.By
 partnering with me in this Indiegogo campaign, you are personally adding your 
touch to this work.  I can't do it
 without you and I'm thankful that you're considering coming along with 
me on this journey.Video courtesy of Elevtr Trax / Nadeem Salaam

story:
Update: Be sure to click n the "Updates" tab above to see and hear The Laughing Bird in rehearsal!

Two years ago, Piffaro presented four talented young Philadelphians in an informal salon concert. The singers called themselves The Laughing Bird, and they had determined to focus their considerable talents on the performance of Renaissance repertoire. Piffaro artistic directors Joan Kimball and Bob Weimken wanted to support their endeavor.

That night, as the standing-room-only crowd loudly applauded The Laughing Bird’s fine performance, Joan and Bob decided that they wanted to provide the quartet a chance to shine with Piffaro’s full ensemble on a main stage concert. What better opportunity than our May celebration of the 500th birthday of that consummate master of madrigals, Cipriano de Rore?

We ask you to help us give these four young singers their chance to shine with a tax-deductible contribution. We hope to raise $4,800 to pay The Laughing Bird for a week of rehearsals and three sure-to-be wonderful performances in Philadelphia and Wilmington, DE.

We know that all of our friends can’t make it to the Delaware Valley to enjoy the fruits of their patronage, and so we will share highlights from the concert recording with those of you who support this campaign.

We give our deepest thanks to you for your contribution. If you have any questions about the campaign or Piffaro in general, please contact us at info@piffaro.org.

story:
ABOUT THE HARMS


The Harms is: Chase Frank, Jennifer Monsees, Jessica Alexander.  I, Chase started The Harms in January 2012 at the suggestion of long-time friend Ikey Owens.   I was writing a bunch of new stuff that sounded different than anything I'd previously done.  Surfy 60's / 70's garage with some other influences that really had a specific energy.  Dark & poppy?  Yes!  Frenetic, driving & fun?  Yes.  This was very different than my solo work.

It was a "project" (complete with rotating memberships).  We dropped our first single ("Take The Elevator" / "House The Sun") in 2013, with help from Producer Ikey Owens.  Musically, it worked.  The analog recording captured  a 'harms energy'.  The momentum translated into another recording -- a 7 song EP with the addition of permanent member Jennifer Monsees in 2013. 
listen here http://theharms.bandcamp.com

When we met Jessica Alexander we knew we were locked, loaded and ready to take names.   The band became forged and solid.  We are now fully committed to creating a body of work that we hope will be worthy historically, in the mighty fabric of rock & roll.  Lofty goals, you might say?  Hell yeah. 


OUR 1st  & HOPEFULLY LAST

That's right, we NEVER want to have to ask you for money again.  That's how determined we are to book the right shows, plan properly, focus on great material and lean on licensing placements / publishing for income in the future.  That's how excited we are about these recordings.  We all work & support ourselves. We've already funded the harms to this point.  Sometimes you just need a little push....that little extra....umph.  That's where you come in, push our fannies up uP UP!!  to the next level.  We've already put out an EP, toured the Texas region and put out a digital single to boot.  The Harms is definitely in it for the long haul.

ABOUT THE SONGS

Graveyard Love is our first acoustic recording.  It's possibly our most requested song.  It's about a vampire suicide pact. It has a Nick Cave meets Jenny Lewis feel with the crystalline vocals of Jennifer Monsees.  Sound Dragons has a 70's psych feel -- fast, riff driven, crazy psych break, respectively.  It explores how melodies revisit us throughout time -- a magical subject for musicians.

"Graveyard Love" and "Sound Dragons" were slated to be recorded in Nashville late 2014 with Ikey Owens.  Sadly our friend and Producer, Ikey Owens suffered a fatal heart attack.  We pulled our thoughts together and re-grouped to make our goal happen.I was heartbroken; he was a friend for 17 years. I thought, we have to do these songs. Now it's also for Ikey.

We recorded the two songs in January 2014 at the The Recording Conservatory of Austin with producer Alec Esh & Engineer Jet Jaguar.  We had conversations with Ikey as a guide.  We knew we wanted to be in a quality studio with the right gear.  I knew we had to step up production sound and quality.

So, YES!  We've done possibly the hardest part.  The songs sound great.  Now we need your help to complete the process, mastering & vinyl reproduction.  With guests like Joseph Woullard & Claude 9  on "Sound Dragons", and the love and expertise of all the folks during the session, we know you'll be just as excited as we are about the tracks!

WHAT YOU ARE MAKING HAPPEN....

With your contribution to this campaign you're helping us join the 'vinyl revolution' and show that music isn't a throw away experience.  That color, art, and unmatched quality of sound cannot be replaced by digital.  We are excited to announce Long Beach artist Mattisse Ibarra is doing the cover art.  Vinyl is vital and it's back!!!  NOTHING sounds like a vinyl record and, after all, you can't smell an mp3.

BUDGET

$1,000 - Vinyl Pressing / Reproduction costs
$250 - Art costs (we're hand assembling to save $)
$500 - Mastering (for vinyl reproduction)
$900 - studio costs  - ALREADY PAID
_________________________________

TOTAL PRODUCTION COSTS -- $2,650

DUE NOW- $1,750

WE ARE ONLY ASKING FOR help with $1,300, about half the cost

Any additional money raised beyond the goal of this project will go to our "Half Nation Tour" May  & June of 2015.

CONTRIBUTION PERKS

The perks (on your right) include a private dinner prepared by our drummer and foodie -- Jessica Alexander-- & private acoustic concert!  Also --  a mix-tape, just for you, just for this campaign.

story:
Since I was a small kid playing piano at my parents house in Portsmouth Ohio, my dream has been to make my own original album. I learned to sing, perform, and act by gravitating to my old school heros like Dick Van Dyke, Tony Bennett, Jerry Lee Lewis and many others. 
...Because of your overwhelming support and generosity, my dream of creating an album of all original work can become a reality. Musicians give back with their music and I want nothing more than to give back to my fans!  Unfortunately I just can't pull this off alone.  Please help in supporting my very first album!  Any donation is greatly appreciated and if you cannot donate, please share this with friends and family. 

From the bottom of heart, Thank You for your kind words, your friendship and most importantly, your belief in me! 

COST BREAKDOWN

Production - 15%

Studio Time - 10%

Musicians - 10%

Song Writing - 10%

Mixing - 10%

Mastering - 10%

CD/Album duplication/Artwork - 10%

Promotion - 25%

story:
#openShabbat is coming back to Austin on Friday, March 13 for SXSW 2015 and we're ready to create the ultimate un-networking event for members of the tribe.

This year we're partnering with JNFuture to make #openShabbat better than ever.

In addition to our yearly Shabbat meal at the Hilton, we'll be featuring a kosher Latin food truck, with celebrity chef Deborah Benaim, seen last year on NBC's Food Fighters!

 

In order to make all of this happen, we're turning to you.

Your partnership with #openShabbat will help create innovative and exciting Jewish programming in the heart of SXSW.


This year we have an anonymous donor willing to match the first $1800 we raise, dollar for dollar! 


We're featuring a number of amazing perks this year - including an all new Tech Tribe "Yechezkel 25:17" t-shirt and the return of our popular whiskey tasting with the spirit-masters from The Jewish Whisky Company!

Our Epic Whisky Tasting at Mason + Mug

story:
WHO WE ARE

The Resonant Grounds Initiative (RGI) is an educational project dedicated to fostering creativity and collaboration through the performance and practice of contemporary classical music. The founders, bassoonist David A. Nagy and pianist Robert Fleitz, believe that integrating the study and frequent performance of new works of classical music into musical training not only expands and enhances the knowledge of young musicians, but also has the capacity to encourage new connections between performers and  audiences, while deepening the ones that already exist. 

RGI's mission is to educate and set a living example for young musicians, advance contemporary classical music by commissioning new works by exciting living composers, and to introduce audiences of multiple backgrounds to new music through engaging interactive concerts.


THE FIRST RESIDENCY = A "RESONANCY"

For the location of our inaugural week-long "resonancy," we chose the Kodály High School of Music in Debrecen, Hungary. This 150-year-old institution is David's alma mater, and has been a leader in Hungarian classical music education. The project's name, "Resonant Grounds" comes from the mission statement that Hungarian composer Zoltán Kodály wrote for the school at the naming ceremony in 1965. In it he states that the school should “set an example by…creating a strong influence on the surrounding community,” bringing “resonant life to the mute grounds around”.

Our "resonancy" in Debrecen will open with a concert of newly commissioned works, followed by a week of individual coachings on contemporary repertoire and new music techniques for approximately 30-45 students from the Kodály School and the University of Debrecen (Faculty of Music). With the help of our composer-in-resonance Molly Joyce, we will also lead a workshop designed to introduce works written by students in the school's composition program to their instrumentalist colleagues, thus encouraging young performers to start working closely with composers on expanding their repertoire. The resonancy will end with an interactive concert open to all members of the community and featuring performances from students in the workshop, with the goal of expanding the relationship between the students' intense work with contemporary music and the general public.

THE FUTURE

RGI plans to continue to expand and improve its offerings to multiple communities around the world. Our future programs, including interactive performances, masterclasses, workshops, and residencies will always tailored to the needs of our upcoming hosts. We will continue to work closely with composers, instrumentalists and other prestigious figures in the new music community. 

WHY WE NEED YOUR HELP

We need your help to fund our initial project and start building a fund for future resonancies. As part of this campaign, your donation will go towards the price of two roundtrip tickets to Budapest, local transportation in Hungary, and our first two commissions by Molly Joyce and Louis Cruz. Please consider supporting our project and helping us bring resonant life to Debrecen, and to many other communities in the future!

story:
Meet Zedcon

Zedcon is the world´s smartest and most functional LED controller. It allows you to connect multiple LED strips and control them via your smartphone in an incredibly easy way.

Zedcon is the only controller that lets you address every LED individually and takes full advantage of the abilities of digital LED strips. This opens up an entire world of use cases, which make Zedcon much more than just a "LED controller".



Features


The Basics

RGB LEDs can shine in over 16 million different colors. LEDs have a very slim form-factor and consume far less energy than other lighting solutions which saves you money. Our free app allows you to dim them and of course to switch them on and off. Oh, and if you want to use a standard light switch - this works as well!



Moving Lights

Common LED strips can light up in every color of the rainbow — but only one color at a time. This is the principal difference to our digital LED strips, where every single LED can be lit up with its own color, while leaving the others unaffected. Zedcon takes full advantage of digital LED strips, by letting you address every single LED on an individual basis. This functionality is important for creating nuanced atmospheres and dynamic light conditions.



Use Cases



Set the Mood

While we may have some control over the intensity of light that surrounds us, we have next to no control over its color. Zedcon can not only to light up your room, but also to give it a certain atmosphere and ambience. The ability to impact your mood, as well as that of the people around you, is a very powerful one –whether you want to create an energetic mood to help you get your work done or relax at the end of a productive day.



Connect Sound to Light

Apart from light, music is the other major external stimulus that can make or break our mood. In fact it was our fascination with combining light and music that brought us into the world of LEDs in the first place. This is why we built a microphone, as well as a music-processing chip into the Zedcon. These components enable the Zedcon to analyse the music that’s being played and transform it into light patterns on the digital LED strips. Thanks to these features, being a light-jockey has never been easier.



Smart Timer

Set individual timer for each occasion. Use the Zedcon to develop healthy routines by configuring it to execute time-specific commands. Instead of waking up to the sound of the alarm clock, you can wake up to the soft glow of your bedroom light. At the appointed hour, your Zedcon can be set to mimic a slow, warm sunrise, regardless of how grey the weather actually is. It can also be set to dim the lights in your child’s room when bedtime draws near. The smart timer works for any other lightsignal stored in the cloud.



Create Event Notifications

Get a light alert as a reminder for an upcoming meeting or for a missed call. As soon as washing machines start connecting to the internet, the completion of a washing cycle can also be followed by a subtle light signal. As the IoT grows to encompass more and more devices, so will the value of Zedcon grow along with it.



Easy to use




Where is zedcon useful?


Home

Mood lighting is the most important usage scenario for the Zedcon. Use it to light up your living space according how you feel – or how you want to feel. Automate the Zedcon so you have specific light conditions for specific times of day.



Office

In addition to the huge energy savings Zedcon’s mood lighting features are very useful in conference rooms. Choose for example between a productive or a more creative lighting. Negotiations with clients, team meetings and feedback sessions can all be made much more pleasant if the right atmosphere is created. Use zedcon to visualize KPIs that matter for your business through light notifications.



Bars and Clubs

Creating just the right atmosphere has never been easier than with the Zedcon. In addition, Zedcon can be used to create impressive light shows in party locations.



How to place LEDs right?

You are still wondering where to place LED strips? We collected a few examples for you to stimulate your creativity. And remember, strips go where bulbs can´t!




Technology


The Advantages of the cloud

 

The first controller that stores its data in the cloud. This allows for limitless updates and therefore limitless lighting possibilities.

  

Networking

 

Connect multiple Zedcons to a network and name them to control them simultaneously or individually.

  

Internet of Things

 

The Internet of Things (or ‘IoT’ for short) allows standalone devices to interact with each other, as long as they can both connect to the Internet. Zedcon is the first LED Controller that takes advantage of the IoT movement. Due to the Internet connection Zedcon is able to interact with every other internet-connected device you own.

  


Tech specs




Timeline




Development




Our Team

Rene
Co-founder and CTO

Rene worked as an electronics engineer and machine designer. He`s into 3D modeling and cnc milling. Hey Ho Let´s Go.

@rene_lueneburg

Vadim
Co-founder and CEO

Vadim quit his job as a bank employee at the age of 23 to study communication management in cologne. He loves technology, sports and challenges.

@vadimtarek

Johannes
Creative Technologist

Johannes is a trained cabinet maker and interaction designer. He crafts user experiences in the daytime and builds music robots at night.

@nevvkid

Vinny
Hacking Architect

Started programming HP calculators at the age of 10, makes machines learn from data and loves PID-controlled coffee


Why we need you


We´ve come a long way. We worked on the Zedcon for almost two years now. The device got smaller and smarter with every step we took. Now we are ready for mass production but first we have to take the necessary steps that every hardware startup has to take. CE and FCC are standard certification procedures which certify that the product is safe to us. But they cost a lot of money. Not to mention the initial costs for injection molding. Therefore we want to use the power of the crowd to take advantage of volume discounts so that we are able to offer you the Zedcon for a reasonable price. You help small teams like us to build something which would otherwise be impossible to make. Let´s make this happen - together!



Selected Perks




Zedcon loves IoT




Back to top > Contribute now!

Imprint / Impressum

zedfy GmbH

Hangweg 4
Berlin, 13465 Germany
info@zedfy.com
www.zedfy.com

The ability to impact your mood, as well as that of the people around you, is a very powerful one –whether you want to create an energetic mood to help you get your work done or relax at the end of a productive day.





Connect Sound to Light
Apart from light, music is the other major external stimulus that can make or break our mood. In fact it was our fascination with combining light and music that brought us into the world of LEDs in the first place. This is why we built a microphone, as well as a music-processing chip into the Zedcon. These components enable the Zedcon to analyse the music that’s being played and transform it into light patterns on the digital LED strips. Thanks to these features, being a light-jockey has never been easier.






Smart Timer
Set individual timer for each occasion. Use the Zedcon to develop healthy routines by configuring it to execute time-specific commands. Instead of waking up to the sound of the alarm clock, you can wake up to the soft glow of your bedroom light. At the appointed hour, your Zedcon can be set to mimic a slow, warm sunrise, regardless of how grey the weather actually is. It can also be set to dim the lights in your child’s room when bedtime draws near. The smart timer works for any other lightsignal stored in the cloud.





Create Event Notifications
Get a light alert as a reminder for an upcoming meeting or for a missed call. As soon as washing machines start connecting to the internet, the completion of a washing cycle can also be followed by a subtle light signal. As the IoT grows to encompass more and more devices, so will the value of Zedcon grow along with it.




Easy to use





Where is zedcon useful?


Home
Mood lighting is the most important usage scenario for the Zedcon. Use it to light up your living space according how you feel – or how you want to feel. Automate the Zedcon so you have specific light conditions for specific times of day.




Office
In addition to the huge energy savings Zedcon’s mood lighting features are very useful in conference rooms. Choose for example between a productive or a more creative lighting. Negotiations with clients, team meetings and feedback sessions can all be made much more pleasant if the right atmosphere is created. Use zedcon to visualize KPIs that matter for your business through light notifications.




Bars and Clubs
Creating just the right atmosphere has never been easier than with the Zedcon. In addition, Zedcon can be used to create impressive light shows in party locations.



How to place LEDs right?
You are still wondering where to place LED strips? We collected a few examples for you to stimulate your creativity. And remember, strips go where bulbs can´t!





Technology


The Advantages of the cloud



 
The first controller that stores its data in the cloud. This allows for limitless updates and therefore limitless lighting possibilities.
 





Networking



 
Connect multiple Zedcons to a network and name them to control them simultaneously or individually.
 





Internet of Things



 
The Internet of Things (or ‘IoT’ for short) allows standalone devices to interact with each other, as long as they can both connect to the Internet. Zedcon is the first LED Controller that takes advantage of the IoT movement. Due to the Internet connection Zedcon is able to interact with every other internet-connected device you own.
 






Tech specs






Timeline





Development






Our Team









ReneCo-founder and CTO
Rene worked as an electronics engineer and machine designer. He`s into 3D modeling and cnc milling. Hey Ho Let´s Go.
@rene_lueneburg







VadimCo-founder and CEO
Vadim quit his job as a bank employee at the age of 23 to study communication management in cologne. He loves technology, sports and challenges.
@vadimtarek







JohannesCreative Technologist
Johannes is a trained cabinet maker and interaction designer. He crafts user experiences in the daytime and builds music robots at night.
@nevvkid







VinnyHacking Architect
Started programming HP calculators at the age of 10, makes machines learn from data and loves PID-controlled coffee







Why we need you


We´ve come a long way. We worked on the Zedcon for almost two years now. The device got smaller and smarter with every step we took. Now we are ready for mass production but first we have to take the necessary steps that every hardware startup has to take. CE and FCC are standard certification procedures which certify that the product is safe to us. But they cost a lot of money. Not to mention the initial costs for injection molding. Therefore we want to use the power of the crowd to take advantage of volume discounts so that we are able to offer you the Zedcon for a reasonable price. You help small teams like us to build something which would otherwise be impossible to make. Let´s make this happen - together!



Selected Perks





Zedcon loves IoT




Back to top > Contribute now!




Imprint / Impressum

zedfy GmbH

Hangweg 4
Berlin,
      13465
Germany

info@zedfy.com
www.zedfy.com

story:
A Dream Deferred... Until Now.

I'm Juan. A lifelong musician, singer-songwriter, multi-instrumentalist, and recording engineer/producer. I've been making music my whole life, but have never released a proper FULL LENGTH album of my own. As a solo artist, I've never had the resources to be able to... until now! And with your help, I can make it happen in the best way possible.

I've been working on this album for the last few years of my life, and the hard part is mainly over: I have nearly finished recording it! Sadly, that's not where the work or cost ends, and I need help with the audio mastering and physical printing costs. I put a lot of work, money, blood, sweat, and tears into this album (those must be metaphorical... right?) and I want to release it properly by not only printing CDs, but also a TWELVE INCH VINYL RECORD! YEAH!!!

This is a long time dream of mine, and I'm ready to work even harder to make that a reality.  I'm a very independent DIY musician that does most of the songwriting, recording, and producing by myself but rest assured, I cannot do this alone.
LET'S DO THIS TOGETHER!

What I Need & What You Get

Even though the cost of recording has gotten lighter over the years, the cost of mastering and printing physical goods has largely stayed the same. Here's why I need your help:

• Mastering a full-length album: $2,000 (CD/digital & vinyl mastering have separate costs due to the physical limitations of vinyl. What is mastering anyway?)
• Vinyl LP printing: $3,000
• CD Printing: $1,000
► Total: $6,000

If you choose to contribute, get ready for some awesome perks. I've put a lot of thought into these and came up with some really worthwhile, fun, and ridiculous things for you to enjoy. Such as:

• CD/Vinyl packages
• Pin-back buttons
• Haiku!
• Sheet music to all of the songs on the album!
• Music lessons!
• Swing dance lessons! (Bet you didn't see THAT coming!)
• Your choice of video cover song
• Your very own minstrel for a day!
• ANYTHING YOU WANT!!!

I can't describe them all here, you're gonna have to move your eyes slightly to the right to take in all of the goodness. DO IT NOW! LOOK OVER THERE --------->

But Why Should I Care?

I feel that the long-playing album is a dying art. All of my favorite artists make records that have a landscape of ups and downs, and take you on a journey throughout the entire course of the album. I want to put something good into the world that touches people, just like those records have touched me. Something that was meant to be listened to as a whole. Not just a collection of songs, but an entire experience that begins when you set the needle onto that first groove.

I've had some decent reviews with my music in the past, and this album will be the best thing I have ever done in my lifetime. It's my life's work. It will be a culmination of all of the skills I have acquired in my lifetime as a guitarist, pianist, vocalist, bassist, trumpet player, audio engineer, producer, songwriter, and... musician. (Music is a small passion of mine to say the least.)

YOU DON'T HAVE TO SPEND MONEY TO HELP ME!

If you cannot give dollars (something I can relate to) there are still tons of ways you can help me! All I need is your voice to help me spread the word. Anything helps, and I honestly thank you from the bottom of my heart. Here are some things you can do:

• Tell a friend about what I'm doing
• Write about it on Twitter
• Share my link to your pals on Facebook
• Write to your Senator and tell him/her how much you love Sofa City Sweetheart
• Give me ideas to help my campaign (info@sofacitysweetheart.com)
• Share my posts when you see them
• Punch a random stranger, then tell them about Sofa City Sweetheart while you have their attention
• Like my YouTube videos (thumbs up!)
• Follow Sofa City Sweetheart on Spotify/Pandora
• Shave my website address into your dog's fur
• Use the hand-dandy sharing tools on the top left of this page!

THANK YOU EVERYBODY! SOFA CITY SWEETHEART LOVES YOU!

story:
The Mission

We are Denver-based power folk duo Whitherward - Ash on the left, Ed on the right - and we have a mission this summer.  A full-fledged, multi-city, two and a half month tour across (some) of the United States of America.  This is a mammoth undertaking for us, and we've already started the ball rolling with a fantastic booking campaign.

Here's Where We Stand

The tour is shaping up to be a wonderful jaunt through most of the American West, Midwest, and some of the South.  Some information:

  • 31 shows booked so far July - mid September
  • States booked: Colorado, Arizona, California, Oregon, Washington, Montana, Illinois, Tennessee
  • States we're working on: South Dakota, Minnesota, Missouri, Georgia, Texas, New Mexico
The main purpose of the tour is to further grow our fanbase and kick off our full-time music career.  For reals, this time.  And we need your help to get off the launchpad successfully.

What We Need & What You Get

Touring full-time takes a lot of stamina, fortitude, and determination.  As it happens, it also needs money.  A number of our shows pay us money, and we'll make some extra through tips and merchandise sales, but it still may not be enough.  According to our estimates, it will take about $10,000 to account for the following items:

  • Vehicle costs
  • Vehicle maintenance
  • Fuel costs
  • Food & lodging
  • Bills
  • Tour promotion
We'll use the funds as needed, based on what we get in money from shows along the way, but your contribution will be what puts us over the top and ensures the tour's success.

The Roles We Take

Whitherward is many things - acoustic duo, business, brand, philosophy - and we do everything ourselves. Running a band as a business is a full-time job for us and, as such, we've forgone our day jobs in order to focus on this job. A lot of work goes into what we do, and we take on a number of roles ourselves that most businesses have entire teams for:

  • Ash acts as the primary booking agent for our performances, with Ed helping from time to time. She also maintains contact with fans and business associates alike through social media and traditional contact methods.
  • Ed handles a number of backend technical jobs as well as working on recordings and video production.
  • Both of us handle financial planning and management, promotion, R&D, and, of course, the musical aspect of the duo.
As you can see, we juggle a lot of jobs between us. Being self-employed brings freedom and tremendous challenge, and we love having the option of blazing our own path in the ever-changing music industry.

Risks & Challenges

The reality on the road is, anything can happen.  Vehicles break down, gigs are double-booked or outright cancelled, sleep is in short supply due to travel deadlines, and any number of things outside of our control can affect our ability to perform.

However, our resolve is bolstered from your support; we love our fans, and we appreciate seeing them smile, mouthing the words of our songs as we sing, and chatting with them to the wee hours. This is why we assume great risk in touring full time, and we wouldn't have it any other way.  It's a grueling life, but for us, it's the only life. And now, you can have a part in helping us realize our dream.

Other Ways You Can Help

Spreading the word is the biggest help to our campaign possible. Tell your friends, send emails to your co-workers, and post this campaign link on all of your social media pages so that as many people as possible can learn about us and what we want to do!

Thank you for your support, and we'll see you on the road!

story:
The purpose of this campaign is to raise money that will cover all production costs incurred to record and release The Ethnos Project: Vol. 2. The proceeds from volume one has already afforded us the opportunity of jumpstarting Vol. 2 and putting us well on our way toward completing this second album.  In fact, we have already completed about half of the work that needs to be done in production.  However, the money from the proceeds of the first project will soon run out and we are hoping we can get this project finished sooner than later.  Funding these aspects is monumental in the overall impact of the cause – because it means individual lives will continue to be inspired, uplifted, encouraged, and challenged to live out God's greatness in their lives through the power of multiethnic music.  Any funds raised beyond our goal will go directly to cover additional production costs, promote the project and fund future related endeavors.

__________

The idea of starting The Ethnos Project recording series two years ago was inspired by the vision of Ethnos Community Church based in San Diego, California.  Ethnos believes that the next great movement of Jesus is the creation of transformational, multiethnic communities in global university towns.

In the same way, the producers of The Ethnos Project music series believe that the creation of multiethnic songs of devotion should inspire listeners to do the following:

1.  Connect with God in a more meaningful, purposeful way,

2.  Connect with one another in a way that celebrates & appreciates how God chooses to express Himself through us (spiritually, culturally, ethnically),

3.  Connect with/engage in active involvement in a Christ-centered faith community from right where you are in the world.

__________

Please continue to share the details of this project with your friends, family, church and especially social media. In addition, please help us bring more attention to this project by hash tagging #TheEthnosProject2 with each post.  We cannot express our gratitude enough for your support and we look forward to sharing this music with you and the rest of the world.

story:
Short Summary

The music scene in Texarkana and the surrounding areas is an ever-growing source of creativity. Brandon Rushing and Jase Bryant wish to capture this creativity in its most raw and tangible form. The landscape of studio recording has shifted such that just about anyone can record their first full-length record sitting in their underwear in their bedroom. Our designs on this as-of-yet unnamed studio are such that we will capture bands and artists in a "live" setting, like the rock 'n' roll days of old. We also seek to have a mobile recording set-up in order to actually come to your venue and record your performance, audience and all!

What We Need & What You Get

We have already had overwhelming help from our many friends and hope that this can continue through the help of monetary donations. Whether your donation is great or small, any and every penny helps. We would like the studio to become the place to hang out, listen and experience great music. For those that donate:
  • If you donate 100 dollars or more you will receive a half day (4 hours) of free recording time.
  • 50 dollars or more you will receive 2 hours of free recording time
Your contributions will go towards the purchase of much needed equipment and the building of miscellaneous studio panels, rugs, and other accessories needed to make the studio feel like a second home to incoming musicians.

Other Ways You Can Help

We know that money can get tight and we totally understand. So, if you can't donate that absolutely fine, but please spread the word about this project. This studio is something that could be very beneficial to the growth of musical creativity within Texarkana and surrounding areas.

story:
After the pressing of our debut album "Revel in the Chaos" was successfully crowdfunded, we realized what kind of pull our fans have on our ability to continue to make music. 

Some of you guys may or may not know this, but we are a very independent band. We do our own booking, designing, photography, production etc. when we can. We have recently signed with a new indie record label "Dead Industry Records" to help with  airplay,  online distribution as well as promotional material. We are big fans of the underground rock scene and it is very exciting to work with someone in the business that feels the same as we do.  

We have created this new campaign in hopes of funding the recording side of our new material. We are pushing over 20+ songs that we want to get to you. Within the year we want to release 2 more EPs as well as a full length record. Studio time is rather costly sometimes, so we have put together some perks for our fans that will help us to record new material.

Donations are welcome as well but we want to offer some items and opportunities that aren't entirely typical of bands. A big thank you to everyone that has supported the band over the years.

Heavy riffs, powerful choruses, and frenetic live performances –that’s what The Everyday Losers are all about. 
The Everyday Losers are a hard rock band from southern Indiana consisting of brothers Dylan and Tyler Seidel, Danny Norton, and Damian Baker.
They have recorded with Phil Taylor of Future Leaders of the World in New Orleans at Revolver Studio and John Lecompt of Evanescence and We Are the Fallen in Arkansas at The Red Room.
Combining their love for heavy hard rock and 90’s alternative, the band began writing original music and independently released their debut EP “Songs for Us All” in 
June 2011 and their second EP “Social Paradise” in January 2012.
The band released their debut album "Revel in the Chaos" in June 2014 with 2 singles released so far. The band has released two official music videos for the songs “You've got War" and "Outta My Head.”
 A third single for “Scream” will be released in 2015. 
The Everyday Losers have toured nationally with Saliva and Future Leaders of the World towards the end of the year in 2014.
They have also shared the stage with Jackyl, Smile Empty Soul, and Black Stone Cherry and performed at Rockapalooza with national acts Puddle of Mudd, Saliva, and Red Jumpsuit Apparatus.
In 2015 alone, the band has received airplay on over 20 stations in the US, Brazil, Spain, Germany, and the UK. The band has also been featured on blogs, zines, and major music website Alternative Nation. 
The Everyday Losers currently have sponsorships and endorsements with InTune guitar picks, SIT Strings, Clayton Custom Guitar Picks, Dirtbag Clothing, and 
Coldcock Whiskey.

Studio time is rather costly sometimes, so we have put together some perks for our fans that will help us to record new material.Donations are welcome as well but we want to offer some items and opportunities that aren't entirely typical of bands. A big thank you to everyone that has supported the band over the years.Heavy riffs, powerful choruses, and frenetic live performances –that’s what The Everyday Losers are all about. The Everyday Losers are a hard rock band from southern Indiana consisting of brothers Dylan and Tyler Seidel, Danny Norton, and Damian Baker.
They have recorded with Phil Taylor of Future Leaders of the World in New Orleans at Revolver Studio and John Lecompt of Evanescence and We Are the Fallen in Arkansas at The Red Room.Combining their love for heavy hard rock and 90’s alternative, the band began writing original music and independently released their debut EP “Songs for Us All” in June 2011 and their second EP “Social Paradise” in January 2012.The band released their debut album "Revel in the Chaos" in June 2014 with 2 singles released so far. The band has released two official music videos for the songs “You've got War" and "Outta My Head.” A third single for “Scream” will be released in 2015. The Everyday Losers have toured nationally with Saliva and Future Leaders of the World towards the end of the year in 2014.They have also shared the stage with Jackyl, Smile Empty Soul, and Black Stone Cherry and performed at Rockapalooza with national acts Puddle of Mudd, Saliva, and Red Jumpsuit Apparatus.In 2015 alone, the band has received airplay on over 20 stations in the US, Brazil, Spain, Germany, and the UK. The band has also been featured on blogs, zines, and major music website Alternative Nation. The Everyday Losers currently have sponsorships and endorsements with InTune guitar picks, SIT Strings, Clayton Custom Guitar Picks, Dirtbag Clothing, and Coldcock Whiskey.

story:
Flint, Michigan and East St. Louis, Illinois are two of the most dangerous cities in the United States.  Murder, drugs, rape, assault, and gang violence dominate the environment. Due to the bleak circumstances most kids see no way of survival thus finding solace in gangs and crime as a means to an end.  Defying odds and overcoming societal and environmental obstacles Willie Mack, III and Christian Heavens have developed an uncanny passion and ability in golf that inspires the masses.

Willie Mack III, one of the most decorated golfers at the mini-tour level, has dominated every stage of the game.  Proved himself as one of the best junior players in the country on numerous occasions, including a win on the American Junior Golf Association (AJGA) tour.  Before turning professional, Mack led the Bethune Cookman Wildcats with over 11 individual victories. While at Bethune he stamped his mark in Michigan golf history by winning the Michigan State Amateur Championship.  Getting off to a strong professional start, Willie has won 13 tournaments and it is becoming more and more usual to see his name on leaderboards. 

Christian Heavens’ story is just as unique. Having been recently introduced to the world as a competitor on Golf Channel’s Big Break Myrtle Beach, Heavens has built a career of strong play and because of Christian’s motivation to become successful and be a role model to kids in his community, he captured the hearts of America.  Heavens has been highly competitive at every level.  In college, Christian received All-American honors by breaking almost every record the Georgetown College Men's golf team.  As a professional Christian has been highly competitive, winning five times and top 3's in numerous professional events.  The Swingthought.com Tour highlighted Heavens as one of the "players to watch"   this 2015 season amongst their leaderboards this year. 

These two friends motivate and push each other to persevere to achieve success.  Overcoming their environment has taken nothing short of passion, hard work, vision, and determination.  But, getting to the tour requires opportunities and finances to gain experience to compete at the highest levels.  In a sport where blacks with talent where held from the game by rules of the tour and country club; now we find that many people with talent are slowed down by the extreme costs of traveling and competing.  These two men have everything it takes minus the opportunity to play.  They just want to play!

story:
Music is the thing that makes the most sense in my life.  

Welcome to my Love.  LOVE IN ALL ASPECTS.

I'm Siobhan Heard! I am a DIY soul singer from Los Angeles by way of Houston! 

Why?

When I was a kid, we listened to James Brown on long car trips and cleaned to Stevie Wonder's Songs in the Key of Life. My mother and father would dance around the kitchen while  the house was teeming with rhythms, deep grooves, and percussion.  Music felt like love.

I always knew I was meant for singing but was too shy to share.  But after my father finally heard me sing for the first time, he asked me to solo, and I've been the soloist at the church he pastors EVERY SUNDAY EVER SINCE!  Music felt like passion.  

My parents provided me with the education necessary so I could study what made me happy.  From middle school through college, I studied everything from musical theatre to opera, and jazz.  Music felt like commitment.

The whole time my ear was tuned to 90's Neo-Soul, R&B, Hip-Hop, as well as Funk, Jazz, and Blues.  The best records remained on repeat: Jill Scott, India.Arie, Lauryn Hill, and Erykah Badu.  Music felt like life.

So yeah, I've been singing all my life with all my heart and I've almost finished my first album. And it's a little scary but I'm so enthused to share with you this expression of love, because now music feels like me.


Love In All Aspects


I've been slaving over a hot stove in this studio to fix y'all some of this feel-good music.  You can feel it in your gut and it sticks to your ribs.  The vocals are succulent, the grooves are sweet, and the drops are spicy.  It's musical nutrition for my soul, and it's a meal I'd love to share.

You're going to love it too, because it's kinda a love letter to you: its listeners and the people who inspired it. 

I've worked with a group of very talented creators and friends, including Nyaze Vincent, Alwayz Prolific, Samantha Purple, Jevon Reynolds, Aaron White, and Andre Leneal to perfect a recipe that expresses to you a bit of who I am and what I love.  It's made more decadent by it's contrasting flavors:  It is soul.  It is hip-hop.  It vibes. It rocks. And it's 100% SIOBHAN!

I'm so excited about this music because it sounds like the music I hear in my head.  When I listen to it, I can't help but snap my fingers, nod my head to the beat, sway, close my eyes, and sing along.  

You?

You deserve to sing along as well.  So I've put together this Indiegogo campaign so that I can get y'all involved.  

Major Labels and Record Companies spend hundreds of thousands of dollars to contract producers, studios, engineers, songwriters, arrangers, instrumentalists, background singers, photographers, distributors, marketers, public relations, A&R, street teams, editors, videographers, and practice spaces.  

As I said earlier, I am a DIY artist, and while I have a few unwavering financial and creative backers, I need your help.  

Currently, I've invested around $3,500 to this project.  That's a lot coming out of pocket for a DIY artist.  But it's significantly less than what it takes to release a project AND compete with the Major System.  My budget, ultimately, is smaller than a major label release, but there are still criteria that need to be met for global release.


I have opted out of physical copies of my record in favor of digital, because I wanted something more cost-effective, and today many use digital media as their preferred musical medium.  However, I will still need help for the the independent production and promotion of this project which will jumpstart my career.

So I'm coming to you!  Future listeners of Love In All Aspects!  Yes, you CAN use this as a pre-order for my album, which will be released in October.  

But... we can also use this as an opportunity to bridge the gap between the artist (myself) and the audience (that's you, boo!).  I'm super excited about putting the music in your hands but I'm also excited about giving you the opportunity to get to know me better, the chance to get to know as many of you as I can!

I've come to Indiegogo to raise  $6,500 of the $10,000 that we need in order to do this music justice.  Sometimes the numbers look big (even to me) but every little bit helps and the more you contribute, the more you receive... literally.

My team and I have already paid for studio time at various studios in the LA area, half of the production fees, a preliminary photo shoot, a music video, digital artwork, and a website.


Your contributions will help bridge the gap and complete the process: They will help finish paying producers fees for the project, another music video, promotional visuals, mixing and mastering of the project, digital distribution of the the album upon it's release (i.e. iTunes, Amazon Music, Spotify, etc.), and the creation and licensing of digital album artwork.


Indiegogo

How does this work?  Well, I have this campaign set up on a site (this one indiegogo.com) where you can pledge money to my fundraiser.  Minus processing and credit card fees, I'm going to receive all the money; however, Indiegogo will claim less in processing fees if I achieve and/or exceed my goal.  

For investing financially in my success, you can opt to receive  some great perks that will help you to remember that you got in on the ground floor and invested in making both my project and my career a success.  Look to the right to view the perks.

My team and I have been really thoughtful about including perks that are appealing to many kinds supporters: friends and family, fans, and fellow musicians.

Call To Action!

So step on out and hook a sister up!  We need your help to put this music onto the internet and into your iPods, iPhones, MP3 Players, Sounds Systems, and Stuck in Your Head on Repeat!  

How can you help?

Like this!

  • Back this project!  Instructions on contribution show up when you click the perk that you want to receive at the level you want to give!  Let's put this lovely, lovely music on your hard drive and you can play it until the Play Button breaks! 
  • Back this project!  No really, back it!  At even $1, you can give to the campaign, support me as an artist, and receive a very cool perk in return.  
Share
  • Lastly, Share this!  There are buttons at the bottom of the page to help you blast this on your Social Media to share with your network!  
  • Talk to your friends about this campaign at the water cooler, send an email blast, call people on the telephone, text message.  It doesn't just have to be social media, but help me get the word out.


Thank you so much for reading to the end.

Thank you for being encouraging.

Thank you for your continued support.


With Love,

Siobhan Heard

Bobulele EP - Pre-sale production help

I'm just wrapping up production on my first Bobulele project. In order to help cover production costs I'm doing this as a pre-sale type underwriting, plain and simple.

There are a couple of other just-for-fun perks.

story:
Music Video, Photo Shoot - New Single Oh, My!

Hi Everyone! I have a few goals that I would like to achieve this summer

  • Pay the submission fee to submit to articles to 2015 NWPC Exceptional Merit in Media Awards. I was personally invited by the committee to submit my work
  • Create a music video for my single, "A Prayer for Black America"
  • Record a 2-3 Song single of all new material
  • Photo shoot to update my photos
  • I also need to buy a new guitar. I am borrowing one at the moment. My old guitar has just been on too many airplanes and needs to rest.

Timeline

I plan to have everything in post production by July/August of 2015. I would like to release the music video in July and release the single by September.

Art is Life

Anyone who knows me understands I give everything to what I do. I plan to work hard and release quality art. I would also love a chance to be honored with a 2015 NWPC Exceptional Merit in Media Award. The submission fee is over $100 and I would like to submit two articles.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot contribute financially. There a few skills and tools I could use that I would love for you to offer for free or trade:

  • Photographer
  • Stylist
  • Videographer
  • Editor
  • Studio space
  • Rehearsal Space
  • Art Studio space
  • A guitar

Thank you for reading <3

story:
C'est à partir du  18 mai prochain que vous pourrez vous procurer le nouvel album du Papet J aux couleurs résolument reggae. L'album s'intitule Raggamuffin Vagabond, il comporte 13 titres inédits composés et enregistrés avec le 149 Band dans leur studio, le 149 Band est un groupe de musiciens niçois que Papet J a rencontré au cours de ses tribulations dans le monde de la musique qu'il arpente depuis près de trente ans. Autrefois il fallait se rendre dans une boutique spécialisée pour trouver des disques de reggae, aujourd'hui c'est la musique qui vient à vous grâce à Internet et les initiatives telles qu'Indiegogo qui vous permettent de soutenir un artiste. C'est en le réservant ici sur Indiegogo  que vous pourrez vous procurer l'album Raggamuffin Vagabond sous toutes ses formes mais aussi le T-Shirt Papet J. Nous vous proposons différents packs parmi lesquels vous trouverez à coup sûr la formule qui vous convient. Papet J est un artiste indépendant qui a décidé pour cet album de passer outre les circuits de distribution classiques et vous le livre sans intermédiaires. Nous comptons sur votre soutien et nous vous remercions d’avance pour l’attention que vous portez à la musique en général et à notre action en particulier.
Merci et Aïoli sur vous !!!


Clip Si j'étais maire Marseille extrait de l'album.
