story:
We're CHARGAUX, known to friends as Charly and Margaux. We met five years ago in Boston and moved to New York to pursue our dreams. We now have an awesome resume as contemporary composers, string players, and visual artists. 

Every waking moment of our lives is dedicated to music! Over the years we have taught violin and viola to children in the Blue Mountains of Jamaica at Lil Raggamuffin Summer Camp, worked with young string players at the Noel Pointer Foundation,  and  visited middle schools in Brooklyn and The Bronx to perform for students and talk to the about the importance of the arts. Additionally, we've self funded and released our own music along the way, performed all over the city at everything from festivals to art exhibits, and have written original string arrangements for up and coming artists as well.

When we are not out and about we are still constantly creating. We have fun writing our own original music and arranging renditions our popular tunes as well! (hint hint Shake it Off ^^^^^)

For us, performing live is an incredibly gratifying experience because we always have amazing interactions with our audiences. Now it's time we go on our very first solo tour in order to bring our musical experience directly to our fans and supporters across the States! 

Together, we're raising $21,000 in order to fund the Magic Music Tour. Donations will cover the entire cost of traveling and tour production. The cities we plan to perform in are Los Angeles, Portland, Las Vegas, Seattle, San Francisco, Phoenix, San Diego, and of course New York City. If funds allow, we would absolutely love to add even more cities to the list. Our goal is to perform our musically diverse catalogue for locals, students, and art lovers. People really need to see Chargaux live so that we can spread the impact of our art beyond what we've accomplish thus far. 

We have chosen to devote our lives to compose, teach, and perform. Should you choose to support this worthy cause, our Magic Music Tour will be able to reach countless people who would appreciate some acoustic healing. 

What We Need & What You Get

Tour Costs.  Let's break it down! So touring is essentially one of the most expensive endeavors an indie artist can take on. We will be traveling along with an amazing documentarian/photographer Ant Blue Jr and Soft Glas (producer, multi-instrumentalist); therefore, the funds we will raise will cover food for the duration of the tour, housing, flights, and baggage fees for four folks to start off.  
We're starting our tour on the West Coast, flying into Seattle and driving down though California and Oregon. Funds will also cover rental car fees, gas, tolls, and parking for the duration of our planned 2200 mile journey. As we will be functioning as our own stage crew, having the right equipment is essential. Although we have always made sure to invest into our instruments, there are a few crucial pieces of gear we'll need to purchase to ensure that each show is sonically amazing. That includes a new interface for performance, amplifiers, and compressors for our instruments. 
Finally we want to make sure we get you all of your rewards! We'll need funds to press our T-shirts, print our stickers as well as our make our prints PLUS the cash to send it to wherever you are in the world.

If we don't meet our goal, WE GO INTO OUR OWN POCKETS. We are 100% committed to achieving this tour, so that's a scary thought, but that's the reality of the artist's journey! 

The Impact

Chargaux represents creativity, imagination, and bravery. Our lifelong goal is to remind everyone that playing an instrument is cool--we want our reality to inspire dreams in others.Your contribution to the Magic Music Tour will make an immense difference in our lives, and it will help us transform everyone we reach. Across all our social media platforms, our fans consistently express that we have inspired them to pick their musical instruments back up. We want to keep that energy going.

Risks & Challenges

We currently reside in Brooklyn and our greatest challenge is juggling the cost of our creative work and the unpredictable costs of living in the Big Apple. Our only job is working as artists. Our income from performing private functions is how we pay the bills. Addtionally, Many New Yorkers recognize us from playing in the subways during their early morning work commute, which is a resourceful way for us to assume responsibility for funding our endeavors: organizing art shows, recording EPs, paying our band, and maintaining/replenishing equipment. Between the two of us, everything is in-house. In order to create visibility without formal representation (i.e. a record label), we document our process and create all our own signature media using Photoshop and social platforms. We want to continue our hands-on approach during this tour, documenting and creating along our journey. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute at this time, you can still tell kids that playing an instrument is cool! Please help us spread the word :) 

Let's make this tour a reality. Thank you for your support!
story_txt: We're CHARGAUX, known to friends as Charly and Margaux. We met five years ago in Boston and moved to New York to pursue our dreams. We now have an awesome resume as contemporary composers, string players, and visual artists. Every waking moment of our lives is dedicated to music! Over the years we have taught violin and viola to children in the Blue Mountains of Jamaica at Lil Raggamuffin Summer Camp, worked with young string players at the Noel Pointer Foundation,  and  visited middle schools in Brooklyn and The Bronx to perform for students and talk to the about the importance of the arts. Additionally, we've self funded and released our own music along the way, performed all over the city at everything from festivals to art exhibits, and have written original string arrangements for up and coming artists as well.When we are not out and about we are still constantly creating. We have fun writing our own original music and arranging renditions our popular tunes as well! (hint hint Shake it Off ^^^^^)For us, performing live is an incredibly gratifying experience because we always have amazing interactions with our audiences. Now it's time we go on our very first solo tour in order to bring our musical experience directly to our fans and supporters across the States! Together, we're raising $21,000 in order to fund the Magic Music Tour. Donations will cover the entire cost of traveling and tour production. The cities we plan to perform in are Los Angeles, Portland, Las Vegas, Seattle, San Francisco, Phoenix, San Diego, and of course New York City. If funds allow, we would absolutely love to add even more cities to the list. Our goal is to perform our musically diverse catalogue for locals, students, and art lovers. People really need to see Chargaux live so that we can spread the impact of our art beyond what we've accomplish thus far. We have chosen to devote our lives to compose, teach, and perform. Should you choose to support this worthy cause, our Magic Music Tour will be able to reach countless people who would appreciate some acoustic healing. What We Need & What You GetTour Costs.  Let's break it down! So touring is essentially one of the most expensive endeavors an indie artist can take on. We will be traveling along with an amazing documentarian/photographer Ant Blue Jr and Soft Glas (producer, multi-instrumentalist); therefore, the funds we will raise will cover food for the duration of the tour, housing, flights, and baggage fees for four folks to start off.  We're starting our tour on the West Coast, flying into Seattle and driving down though California and Oregon. Funds will also cover rental car fees, gas, tolls, and parking for the duration of our planned 2200 mile journey. As we will be functioning as our own stage crew, having the right equipment is essential. Although we have always made sure to invest into our instruments, there are a few crucial pieces of gear we'll need to purchase to ensure that each show is sonically amazing. That includes a new interface for performance, amplifiers, and compressors for our instruments. Finally we want to make sure we get you all of your rewards! We'll need funds to press our T-shirts, print our stickers as well as our make our prints PLUS the cash to send it to wherever you are in the world.If we don't meet our goal, WE GO INTO OUR OWN POCKETS. We are 100% committed to achieving this tour, so that's a scary thought, but that's the reality of the artist's journey! The ImpactChargaux represents creativity, imagination, and bravery. Our lifelong goal is to remind everyone that playing an instrument is cool--we want our reality to inspire dreams in others.Your contribution to the Magic Music Tour will make an immense difference in our lives, and it will help us transform everyone we reach. Across all our social media platforms, our fans consistently express that we have inspired them to pick their musical instruments back up. We want to keep that energy going.Risks & ChallengesWe currently reside in Brooklyn and our greatest challenge is juggling the cost of our creative work and the unpredictable costs of living in the Big Apple. Our only job is working as artists. Our income from performing private functions is how we pay the bills. Addtionally, Many New Yorkers recognize us from playing in the subways during their early morning work commute, which is a resourceful way for us to assume responsibility for funding our endeavors: organizing art shows, recording EPs, paying our band, and maintaining/replenishing equipment. Between the two of us, everything is in-house. In order to create visibility without formal representation (i.e. a record label), we document our process and create all our own signature media using Photoshop and social platforms. We want to continue our hands-on approach during this tour, documenting and creating along our journey. Other Ways You Can HelpIf you are unable to contribute at this time, you can still tell kids that playing an instrument is cool! story:
Hi I'm 19 year old singer songwriter Autumn Sharif  based in London. I wish to make my first EP. I am presently working with 3 x Grammy award recipient Mack Woodward who's worked with the likes of Beyonce, Usher and Maroon 5. Mack has faith in me and is contributing his expertise along with other talented industry producers and professionals from the USA and UK. 

I have recently finished in the Quarter finals of the 2015 THE VOICE UK. Please see my online vids Official YOUTUBE Channel .  

The voice was an incredible experience. I learnt a lot about myself, my voice and the music business. 

I sing from the heart and write about my life experiences that reflect my feelings.

I know how tough this industry is and I truly cherish all the support from around the globe. Any contributions are greatly appreciated.

With Love,

Autumn x

story:
LAND (originally released 2014) is my second album although being 8 minutes shorter than the debut it's actually more of a mini-album - perfect for 10" vinyl. 


If you're not familiar with my work or the album, i recommend checking out my Soundcloud-page here. Fans of music in the vein of artists like Rufus Wainwright, Owen Pallett, Todd Rundgren, Prefab Sprout etc should find it worth the trouble.

I run my own independent label through which this record will be released in september, whether I reach the entire goal for the campaign or not. 

My friend Peder has designed a very tasteful cover(standard) including all credits



...and it is of course worth considering owning a copy for the superb sound unique to vinyl.

Here's a great review in norwegian by Dagens Næringsliv, screenshot from www.dn.no



If you're not into vinyl there are other perks to check out, or you could contribute by simply getting the word out!


And BTW, the release concert will take place at John Dee, Oslo, 16th september 2015. For those of you in the area selecting vinyl or CD without shipping- this could be a good time to pick it up.



Thank you for your time!

story:
Summary:

You have all been waiting patiently while Josh Makosky, Rich Staats, and Naomi Tatsuoka carefully and methodically planned this EP, and now the dream is finally ready to be realized. All we need is your help in two important ways:

  • Help us fund-raise the cash even if you only have the basic donation....every little bit helps
  • Tell your friends, family, coworkers, pets, barista, psychic dog walker, bartender, parole officer and plants about us and ask if they ALSO can spread the word and help us share our music

IF YOU THINK YOU CANT HELP YOU'RE WRONG

The second part (about spreading the word) is at least as important as your own donation. 

Sharing the link to this page is one of the biggest things you can do, especially if you don't have the $2 to give. 

Cost Breakdown and What's in it for you:

Here's the break-down for the money we're asking for:

  • 500 for Merch 
  • 500 for Tracking in the Studio
  • 500 for Duplicating the CDs and Shipping
If you make a donation, we'll give you Band Merchandise with our cool new logo on it! If you make a larger donation we might start taking it personally. The more you can give us the more we can give you in return.

Who We Are

Somehow managing to combine face-melting guitar licks, smooth blues-rooted style, and a voice that makes the ladies swoon, Josh Makosky’s passion for music earned him the West Side Blues Association Otis Spann Award for Best Male Vocalist of 2013 as well as various nominations for both electric and acoustic guitar. 

In 2007 Glendale Arena saw Richard Staats' machine gun speed and precision when he performed with No1Else of Zatu Records in Arizona, and their single "Chasing Victory" was featured in Rage Music Festival compilation album. A guitarist for almost 20 years, Rich's driving rock rhythm interwoven with explosive metal not-so undertones and style earned him a sponsorship from Modtone Pedals in 2013. 

American Idol 2015 Featured Artist Naomi Tatsuoka is unquestionably one of the Pacific Northwest’s most powerful vocalists, and she's not too bad on the bass, either. She touches everyone in her audience with Soulful R&B, Top 40, and her original album, Flight of the Dragon (available on iTunes and Spotify), debuted in California this March.

The Impact

Here's what getting this EP recorded will allow us to do:

  • Promote our original music to a larger audience including the unfathomable resources that are the internet
  • Have a quality product to not only give to people to listen to but also to put on our press kit so we can start booking tours 
  • Having something to sell at shows so the band can continue to print more CDs, get more studio time to make a Full length album and invest in better equipment (microphones, PA system, lights, etc.) which allows us to make our live show that much better for you, the fans

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand some of you just don't have a lot of time or money to contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help. Remember:

  • Share this page to every online social network you have
  • Share our visual content (SoundCloud, YouTube Videos, Band Photos)

That's all there is to it. We appreciate you taking the time to check us out here and hopefully can help us take our next big step. This is what we love to do and the fans make it not only worth it, but possible. 

Lots of love and Thanks, 

August In Blue

story:
THE PRESSURE IS ON!! 

Geoffrey a.k.a  YellowJacketAvenger, is reaching out to you, the fans ! ONLY HOURS LEFT!!  Your support will help release YJA's TWENTIETH album !!

The new record of twelve tracks is a funky odd narrative featuring Pye on Voice, Guitars, bass, drums, synth, stylophone,   drums,  bongos and so on ! Backed up again by the multi talented singer Tessa Kautzman, horn arrangements by Brian Sanderson (Esmerine,Silver Hearts) Gorgeous Pedal steel from Mike Feurestack (Luyas,Bell Orchestre) ,John Tielli on Theremin, Sexy saxes from Emily Bowmile and Dave Ewenson  and Viola from my man, the one, the only, Zephyr. 

Original photography supplied by Michael Fuller and layout by Peter Holt of Halifax N.S. 

THE BREAKDOWN (moneyyyzzz) !

1. Audio Mastering (final stage before record pressing!) $800 

2. (500)  High Quality (180 gram) vinyl produced here in Montreal with colour jacket and insert including  MP3 download ! $4200

THe Goal !!

1. to celebrate this new release in high class and hi-fidelity to be shared with loyal fans delivered by post to their door !

2. To distribute the remainder en masse to labels, bloggers and all music movers and shakers in hopes of pricking up their ears to this hidden Canuck gem and ordering a massssss production to share with the world and ignite this tiny flame !!!!!! yesssssss!!!!!! yes !!!! 

please share, donate and hang on for this rockin ride with Vinyl release party to be announced in Montreal !

MORE::

Geoffrey Pye (a.k.a. YellowJacketAvenger) has been writing, performing and recording since 1992. Born in Ottawa and having lived and contributed to multiple music scenes across Canada he is poised for his twentieth independent release with dreams of this record being the first to go to full length Vinyl production !

His story begins in Ottawa. At an early age (10,11) Pye began conducting audio experiments using cassette decks and reel to reel machines to pass time. There was a great love and appreciation of music and all things Art in his home and naturally Pye began to seek out the half broken guitars and organs lying about the house. While his peers were discovering the world of guitar legends and so on Pye initially focussed on recording sounds and less on the craft of song-writing. The song-writing began around twelve and thirteen and resulted in some ten cassettes of songs, sounds , shapes, stories and nonsense. In 1992 when his eyes were further opened in meeting folk among the flowering early nineties music scene, (in particular WoodenStars,Kepler) Pye took to more focussed writing and recording as much as intense study and practice of all things yielding musical joy.

He quickly grew a small but loyal fan base around eastern Ontario performing on his own or in various configurations, trying anything once resulting in a widening reputation as a gifted multi-talented musician worth seeking out. Over the years Y.J.A. has played and collaborated with countless respected Musicians such as members of Arcade Fire, Julie Doiron, Joel Plaskett,John Tielli, Mike Feurestack,  God Speed you Black Emperor!,HILOTRONS and more. The story has been the same for twenty plus years as Pye continues to churn out at least one record a year that span folk to prog,  disco to samba, and back again. Critical acclaim, rare performances and small revenues seem to be indeed the hallmark that come with the gifts and….er.. non-gifts, of being a largely reclusive independent musician. In love with life, partly through music, at our best when we are writing and sharing with the world. This being the ultimate goal.

In love with life, partly through music, at our best when we are writing and sharing with the world. This being the ultimate goal.

story:
Over the past two decades, the focus of my vocal career has been researching and performing classical vocal works by composers of color.  My desire to follow this path was influenced by the famous American lyric baritone, Thomas Hampson and his Song of America project.  I first saw his recital back in the 1980’s when I had just begun my vocal studies in earnest.  I still carry the memory of sitting in Kleinhans Music Hall reading his program notes and wondering why there was no mention of any Black-American composer or a spiritual on the program.  It was then the seed was planted in my heart.

  I find it disheartening that in today’s world of fingertip access to knowledge and the unknown that the contributions of Blacks in the world of classical music continues to be marginalized to that of a few symphonic works and the Negro Spiritual.  There is a plethora of vocal music, including opera that provides a colorful landscape beyond that of the majority.  Many of these works use the poems of writers of color and thereby presents the facets of life from a different lens, one that is no less important than that presented in the standard repertoire. 

  To provide a little background as to why I decided to record a CD.  There are certain pivotal moments in our lives that are forever ingrained in our memory.  One of these moments for me occurred on Sept. 15, 2013.  As I was working on my computer in preparation of an upcoming recital, the thought came to me, “Rae-Myra you should record a CD featuring the works you have been championing and to program those works to give a picturesque landscape of your life”.  The idea of a ‘scape’, a scene or a view resonated in my conscience.  Hence the title, Lifescapes: One Woman’s Journey. 

  As a Christian, I will always include sacred works and spirituals on any recital I program.  These proclamations of my faith and fears will begin and end the CD.  The works by H. Leslie Adams, Nightsongs, depicts life as a survivor of all things associated with the night and darkness and the beauty that comes out of that.  Beyond the Rim of Day is the story of one woman’s desperate life from birth to death.  The two works of Regina Harris Baiocchi are a dichotomy of Black artistic life.  One in which the artist doesn’t see her color within the confines of race and the other from the patrons’ view of lack of appreciation received.  The song cycle of Dr. Valerie Capers, Song of the Seasons, is picturesque journey through the seasons of life where death merely brings about new life.  The aria by William Grant Still from his opera Troubled Island, is the cry of the human spirit to be free from its imposed prison.

  The style of these compositions range from romantic, jazz, blues, gospel and atonal.  Just as Mr. Hampson promoted his findings through a recital tour, it is my mission to introduce these works to as many willing and accepting audiences as possible.  It is my plan to use the recording to market a recital tour to colleges and universities across the United States.  Whereas I am not the first to have done such a compilation – hats off to my influences:  Dr. Darryl Taylor, Dr. Louise Toppin, Dr. Robert Sims and Randye Jones - I am a part of a small community of artists.

  The songs I have chosen are a small sample of the works that have been introduced to and researched by me.  With the number of songs I have in my library still to learn and the number of songs on my wish list to purchase, my journey will be fruitful and, prayerfully, long.

story:
Alaskapella started July 2011 as a group of a cappella singers affiliated with the University of Alaska Southeast. The purpose was to bring more music to the University and the Juneau community. The group was open to both college students at the University and to non-student members of the local community. Over the years, Alaskapella has fluctuated between its starting point of four members and thirty-five members (with choristers coming and going  in the group as their schedule allowed). Today we stand at an anticipated traveling number of eighteen members. Over the four years that Alaskapella has been around, we have performed at at least two major concerts of our own per year, various short gigs for local organizations, performances with other singing groups in their concerts, and we have worked to promote music in the community and at the University. All of this hard work, practice, and love of music has brought us to a wonderful opportunity (see “Carnegie Hall”)! 

However, as Alaskapella is a group of both current college students with the University and non-student members (such as alumni and those taking time off from school due to various reasons), we cannot travel through the college (as the whole group) due to current University policy. Therefore, with the University’s blessing, we are attempting to travel as a group of individuals, hence the reason we are calling ourselves Alaskapellicans and not Alaskapella (the name owned by the University). Over the years, the pelican has become our mascot and our term to define individual group members, which seemed to fit with our current concept of a group of traveling individuals. We are currently a club under the University Foundation (a not-for-profit organization) and use all money earned through donations to represent the University and state of Alaska, provide our members with the best possible  experience (e.g. new uniforms, etc), and enlarge our music repertoire so we can bring a wider range of music to the community. 

Carnegie Hall in New York City!

Alaskapella has been invited by DCINY (Distinguished Concerts International New York) to go to New York City and perform in an a cappella chorus directed by Deke Sharon (Music Director/arranger of Pitch Perfect and producer/arranger/and vocal coach on the Sing Off) in an international program/performance experience called Total Vocal 2. We were discovered by one of the DCINY employees on YouTube and the organization extended an invitation to us to come to New York and join them for the event! This is quite the honor as only the best a cappella groups around the world are invited to join in this amazing experience. Alaskapella is going to great lengths to try and make sure we can attend this opportunity, as we are excited to represent Alaska, the Juneau community, and the University of Alaska (and hope to further our group’s musical prowess to become a better representative for all mentioned parties). The Juneau Arts and Humanities Council has graciously joined us to help reach this goal in our fundraising efforts. For this event, we would be traveling to New York City in March of 2016 from the 17th through the 21st (with the 17th and 21st being travel days). This is so that we can rehearse with the other groups and Deke Sharon to polish our sound and the group in time for the  main performance (on Sunday, the 20th of March). There will be about eighteen of us traveling and performing in this event, but there will also be some VIPs (people who wish to travel with us, but will not be performing with us, a.k.a parents :P) who will be paying for themselves. 

Alaskapella’s mission is to share our love and joy of music with the community and to represent Alaska (and especially the arts community of Southeast Alaska) to the world in the best possible manner. We would like to show the world what talents Southeast Alaska has to offer and share what we learn (and experience) with the community upon our return. 

Alaskapella is thrilled at this opportunity of a lifetime to represent its beloved state and community! It would be wonderful to reach New York, Carnegie Hall, Deke Sharon, and Total Vocal 2 so that we may come back and share our experience with the community.  Due to its known and extensive support of the arts in Juneau and Southeast Alaska, we are over joyed that the Juneau Arts and Humanities Council has agreed to help us fundraise for this venture. 

Thank you so much for your continued support and we look forward to representing our community and state with this wonderful opportunity!

Sincerely,

Alaskapella

alaskapellicans@gmail.com

www.facebook.com/alaskapella

President, Richard Ringle

Music Director, Patricia Gerdes

Vice President, Chris Pierce

Assistant Music Director, Kristina Paulick

PR and Social Chair, Marie Petersen

Attendance Officer, Andre Bunton

Alaskapella started July 2011 as a group of a cappella singers affiliated with the University of Alaska Southeast. The purpose was to bring more music to the University and the Juneau community. The group was open to both college students at the University and to non-student members of the local community. Over the years, Alaskapella has fluctuated between its starting point of four members and thirty-five members (with choristers coming and going  in the group as their schedule allowed). Today we stand at an anticipated traveling number of eighteen members. Over the four years that Alaskapella has been around, we have performed at at least two major concerts of our own per year, various short gigs for local organizations, performances with other singing groups in their concerts, and we have worked to promote music in the community and at the University. All of this hard work, practice, and love of music has brought us to a wonderful opportunity (see “Carnegie Hall”)!

story:
SPREAD  THE MANTRA OF LOVE

WHEN YOU DONATE - YOU RECEIVE A GIFT

(check the perks on the sidebar)

Original "Seed of Life" painting by Clair Oaks 

(see description of this perk on right)


My dream to bring peaceful music around the globe!

Hi everyone! 

A little presentation... Emy Berti, italian Singer-songwriter, I independently released two albums "Into the Open" 2011 and "The Change" 2014 and a children's book about Astrology, 2007. During my decade of Yoga teaching, I discovered KIRTAN!  I toured and played with a number of Kirtan Artists, like David Newman, Brenda Mc Morrow, Girish, Philippo Franchini, Dave Stringer.

Now  it's time to bring new music into the world!

Luscious, handmade gemstone/glass earrings by Emy

(see description of this perk on right)



What your donation will pay for  & what you will receive

Your support in making my 3rd album come to life, will allow me to cover recording studio costs, musicians fees, and the processes of mixing and mastering, which are the final stages needed to complete the album.

In addition, the funds we raise will pay for the album's cover artwork, as well as a portion of the promotion and marketing that will be needed. 
Nowadays the artist must be able to perform the functions of a record label, they must be good at multi-tasking!!!

Your contribution and your perks
By helping me complete this album, you allow my music to be shared at festivals, yoga classes, in healing and holistic environments--anywhere soothing sound is needed!
So there.. for your contribution you will allow me to deliver you, few perks like:
-An Astro song - writing your own personal song, based on your astrology (also for your child and partner)
-An Astrology consultation, based on your Personal Chart, or Soul Direction for this lifetime.
-A Dream Tarot Reading
-Handmade Crystal Earrings 
-Pass for Blissbeat 2016 Yoga & Music Festival in Sezzadio, Italy
and more... (see perks section on the right)

story:
"Without music, life would be a mistake."
-Friedrich Nietzsche

The Popravinas European Fiasco: Live 2017

The Popravinas are back to cure what ails you with the ale that cures you... New music!

We have been hard at work whipping up a batch of new ditties for our first full length album in 9 years!

Our first album, Everybody's Fault But Ours, put us on the map with strong sales, excellent reviews and a growing fan base well beyond our native and sublime Santa Monica.

So much so that we had many offers to play abroad including stops in Brazil, The United Kingdom, Ireland, France and especially Spain.  Unfortunately our budgets prevented us from accepting these offers.

But with your generous support, you can join us and help us spread our sounds overseas in 2017 supporting our new album, California Sonic! Basically we are "flyin' 'cross the land, tryin' to get a hand"!

"We make a living by what we get. We make a life by what we give,"
-Winston Churchill

Did you know that giving and generosity are proven to lower depression and stress, improve health and improve relationships (http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2013/12/01/generosity-health_n_4323727.html) ?
True story!

But even with all these benefits, we are thrilled to offer some exclusive items including our brand new album, California Sonic!  We have also cooked up a nice batch of new and exclusive T-shirts, stickers, beer coozies, unreleased tracks and live events as a huge thank you for joining us in making this tour a reality.


Traveling abroad can be an expensive endeavor regardless, but bringing our music and passion to fans overseas can really break the bank.  There are flights, hotels, baggage fees, transportation, gas and fuel, food, equipment rental, advertising, merchandise, currency exchange, insurance and of course everyone's favorite, taxes!  And this is assuming everything goes according to plan.

A lot of time, effort, and money has already gone into writing, rehearsing, recording, mixing, mastering, and producing our new album and merchandise.  We are hard at work raising the funds to fulfill our dates stateside.  Together, we can take it to the next level and bring "the party after the party" to Europe and possibly beyond!

Thank you for taking the time to hear our story. Even if you cannot join us with a donation at this time, please feel free to help spread the word and link (https://igg.me/at/thepopravinas)to this campaign wherever and whenever you can.

Cheers, and well see you at the bar!

The Popravinas

story:
Beloveds!

I am so happy and excited to finally bring this magic into life. 

My name is Laor.

In the past 12 years, I have been traveling, creating music, performing, guiding circles and individual inner journeys, researching the power of sound and the healing abilities of our voice and connecting with many people around the world with the purpose of finding a new path of togetherness and creation through music, singing, improvising and living the music of life. 

In these magical years, I have been so unbelievably fortunate to receive and be a channel of beautiful songs of love, healing and new dreams. 

Agradeco, Ana Elech, Barechu, Bapardes, Child of the sky, Hymn to the soul and more...

For so many years, many of you are asking me for these songs, for recordings, an album…Something you can listen and connect to the energy… 

Last year, I have recorded the beautiful Barechu song with the great producer Piloni.

 

 
Now it is time for more!!!
 
We have 52 days to make this magic happen!
The deadline for the campaign is April, 3rd! Let's make it happen!
 

Many of you have met me in special concerts, circles and magical journeys and I am very grateful and blessed that we shared so many beautiful moments. 

Some of you are singing my songs and we have never met.

And some of you are totally new to my music.

This Album is for all of you!

And for that magic to happen, I need your help and support!

In today's new world, music is becoming more and more "for the people" rather then mediated by Record Labels and more and more artists are choosing to communicate directly with their audiences, thus choosing crowd funding platforms such as Indiegogo.

So, to make it simple. 

The Agradeco Album is going to be recorded and made in Ibiza  - the magic island on which I live with my family and create music, this coming spring/summer 2017!

Special and talented musicians will come to create the magic together in the golden island. 

The goal is to raise 40,000 Dollars for the creation of the Agradeco Album.

And here is the Budget Breakdown:

  • 26,000 Dollars:  Music production, recordings, mixing and mastering, musician sessions and traveling costs to Ibiza. 
  • 2,000 Dollars:  A beautiful, professional, cutting edge Video Clip to raise vibration and spread the love. 
  • 3,000 Dollars: Indiegogo fees and comission
  • 3,000 Dollars:  Marketing and PR
  • 2,000 Dollars: Art work and Album design.
  • 3,000 Dollars: CD manufacturing
  • 1,000 Dollars: Perks shipment 

Any extra money raised above this goal will go towards more magical Video clips, marketing and PR.

If you wish to Pre-Order the Album, you are warmly invited to go to the right of the page and choose the amount and perk you wish from the list of perks. 

I would like to say thank you for all of you who I am blessed to walk this path of life with. 

 

Feel free to contact me for any information or further questions regarding the campaign: laoroman@gmail.com

Please help me to spread the word around and to get more and more people to hear about my project and music. 

 

 

If, for any reason, you cannot pre-order the Album or financially contribute to the project, there are other wonderful ways in which you can help spreading the magic of this creation.

  • Direct people to my IndieGogo page.
  • Share the campaign video on your FB page. There are some great sharing tools in the Indoegogo page.
  • Email your friends and family around the world.
  • Share with Music Magazines, websites and other music forums info about my Music InLove project and the upcoming Album.
  • Word to mouth and heart… Tell you friends, family and beloveds about the project. 
  • Sing the songs in your circles and concerts, pray, love, create and dream… Sing to the love a new song… Barechu!

Your help, support, contribution and magic doings are so important for the making of this Album!

Thank you!

 

And with this I want to send a blessing to all of us around the globe, to our hearts and minds and relations. To our families, children, friends and beloveds. May the music of our lives continue it's beautiful symphonies and may we always hear it...

Haleluya

Agradeco

Laor

story:
Support Austin's Newest, Most Vital Jazz & Experimental Music Festival

SONIC TRANSMISSIONS II

Sonic Transmissions is a three-day music festival featuring cutting-edge musicians from around the world representing a far-reaching spectrum of genres and aesthetics unlike any other festival in Austin, Texas. Curated by internationally renowned bassist Ingebrigt Håker Flaten (The Thing, Atomic), the festival broadens and blurs the edges of jazz, hip-hop, rock, grindcore, free improvisation, electronic music, and even opera.

Your support helps us bring together essential musics in a new sonic framework that drives home the festival’s primary goals: uniting musicians and audiences from different communities, breaking down expectations, and seamlessly creating exceptional, powerful experiences.

Our second and most ambitious festival presents more than 30 pioneering musicians, including: Rabit (Houston), Obnox (Cleveland), Chicago Underground Duo (Marfa/New York), Black Spirituals (Oakland), Shit and Shine (London), Suspirians (Austin), Bushman’s Revenge (Oslo), Hearts and Minds (Chicago), and USA/Mexico (Austin/London) - the new trio of drummer King Coffey from the Butthole Surfers. (Full line-up HERE)


New to this year's festival is the music commission Common Ground. The 90-minute piece, spear-headed by Houston trumpeter and rapper Jawwaad Taylor and festival organizer Ingebrigt Haker Flaten, ties together spirituals from the European & African American Diaspora. The commission is ambitious and costly - with 8 participating artists coming from across the US and Håker Flaten's home country of Norway. Your contributions help Taylor and Flaten actualize this most sincere, heart-felt endeavor.


What We Have, What We Need

With generous support from our awesome sponsors, individual backers and The City of Austin, Sonic Transmissions II is rolling full steam ahead - but we genuinely need your help to bring the full program to fruition!
  • We set the goal to raise at least $6,000 in the next 30 days.
  • 100% of the funds from this campaign will go to support artists featured in Sonic Transmissions II.
  • Our perks are plenty and one-of-a-kind and offer several ways to meet and engage the extraordinary artists coming to this year's festival.
  • You truly play an integral role in bringing groundbreaking artists from all over the world to Austin this September and we thank you!

COMMUNITY!

Sonic Transmissions II is significantly bolder and more adventurous than our successful inaugural edition. Presenting world-class artists from several genres mixing it up with Austin's own trailblazing musicians provides numerous challenges and untold risks - but that is a mission we take wholeheartedly! We aspire to push boundaries and challenge artists and audience alike to embrace the creativity that unites us. We are assembling a production team and building a community to foster such ambitious undertakings with the intention of continuing this festival in the years and decades to come! We hope you'll join us! There are several ways to get involved...

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand some people can't contribute financially, but that doesn't mean you can't help us make Sonic Transmissions II a success!

  • Volunteer for the festival (contact us HERE).
  • Help spread the word about this campaign by sharing links, messages, and good old-fashioned word-or-mouth.
  • Attend Sonic Transmissions II - while ticket sales always help, the most important outcome of the festival is that a diverse cross-section of music and arts appreciators feel welcome to meet, engage, and enjoy as much of this electrifying music as possible.

We are assembling a production team and building a community to foster such ambitious undertakings with the intention of continuing this festival in the years and decades to come! We hope you'll join us! There are several ways to get involved...

Other Ways You Can Help
We understand some people can't contribute financially, but that doesn't mean you can't help us make Sonic Transmissions II a success!

Volunteer for the festival (contact us HERE).
Help spread the word about this campaign by sharing links, messages, and good old-fashioned word-or-mouth.
Attend Sonic Transmissions II - while ticket sales always help, the most important outcome of the festival is that a diverse cross-section of music and arts appreciators feel welcome to meet, engage, and enjoy as much of this electrifying music as possible.

story:
Chers cinéphiles et amateurs d'art et de culture,

Le Festival des Films du Monde (FFM) vient de connaitre deux années critiques et il a besoin de notre soutien!  

Le FFM a subi d'importantes coupures budgétaires, de plusieurs acteurs du secteur public totalisant près de 700 000 $ par année. Lorsque nous faisons état de ces coupures, nous nous posons la question suivante: pourquoi? Les raisons sont malheureusement d'ordre politique, loin de la mission du FFM qui est noble et apolitique. 

À chaque année, le FFM enrichit la vie de milliers de Québécoises et Québécois en donnant accès à des films indépendants de qualité provenant des quatre coins du monde, tout en favorisant la diversité et l'innovation. Les films sont minutieusement sélectionnés dans le but de nous faire voyager, tout en découvrant de nouveaux talents d'ici et d'ailleurs. Lors du festival, l’auditoire a l’opportunité de découvrir des films non gérés ou contrôlés par les grosses maisons de production hollywoodiennes car le FFM n'est pas au service exclusif d'aucune cinématographie étrangère, ou nationale, de groupe de pression et de groupe d'intérêts économiques. Il poursuit inlassablement, et de façon indépendante, son travail de développement du cinéma de qualité et est d'ailleurs seul festival de catégorie A en Amérique du Nord accrédité et reconnu par la Fédération Internationale des Associations de Producteurs de Films (FIAPF) figurant auprès de prestigieux festivals tels que ceux de Cannes, Berlin et Venise. La qualité et la diversité de sa programmation en font un évènement culturel incontournable contribuant au rayonnement culturel de Montréal autant à l'échelle nationale qu'internationale.

Aujourd'hui, je lance un appel à toutes et tous! Le FFM a grandement besoin de notre soutien pour assurer sa pérennité. Je vous demande d'offrir un café au FFM et d'inviter deux de vos amies ou amis à en faire autant en partageant ce lien ou post-it sur les réseaux sociaux. Tous vos dons seront utilisés pour couvrir les frais associés à la tenue de l'édition 2016.

Il s'agit d'une première sur la scène culturelle québécoise. Ensemble, nous pouvons changer la façon de gérer et de promouvoir les évènements culturels en montrant au monde à quel point nous sommes unis derrière des causes nobles comme celle du FFM.

C’est avec beaucoup de gratitude que je vous remercie du fond du cœur.

Sincèrement,

Amine Smaoui

story:
Clare Sentience : A bit about me


I'm really passionate about meeting my edges, and so I'm putting a call out to the community to help me launch my debut album of soulful, sweet, powerful & beautiful in the spectacular fashion - through a crowd funding project AND a LIVE album launch celebration!


I'm a self funded, totally independent singer, songwriter, sound healer and teacher/facilitator of singing & self expression. I love to offer sound healing journeys, cacao ceremonies, singing workshops, courses and retreats, all with a focus on unlocking the voice, empowering visions, opening the heart and creating more freedom in the lives of individuals, in particular those who have experienced trauma, through singing. 


I have been singing my whole life! 

It's what I love to do! 

It's my purpose. 


I have sung in various choirs, groups & bands around the world over the past 20 years & supported many musicians with their musical projects, tours & albums.


I created the vast range of multi genre music for 'Soul Transmissions' in 2014/2015, recorded & produced it with Travis Jekks Taylor (ethnomusicologist) in May/June 2015 and am now 100% ready to launch this labour of love into the world in a BIG WAY on the 24th of September 2016. 


It's been a long time coming to get my own music birthed into the world, and as a solo artist & musician, I had a lot of work to do to get to this point in the journey but, now it's time to ask for help. 


What does this mean to me ?


This album means the world to me! It's very much a local made project & a labour of love - Recorded, Produced, Mixed, Mastered, Printed AND Launching in my home town of Melbourne!


I was born & raised here, although I spent my 20's living in the home of my ancestors - Ireland & the UK, while travelling the world singing & adventuring.


It feels very special to create something that really expresses my heart, soul & deep values, that honours my connection to this land, to nature and to my community, that is aligned with my deep core truth, my connection to Spirit and supports local artists & musicians in the process. 




Why support this project? 


By supporting this project, contributors will help me fully fund this production, the launch of the album, the printing of CD's and pay local artists for their contributions to the album and to the concert celebration extravaganza on the 24th of September 2016. 


My ultimate goal is to complete the journey I began in 2014 and launch this album while maintaining my freedom as an independent artist with a passionate drive to use Visionary Music for the Heart as a tool for spreading love, creating change, birthing inspiration, building community and offering celebration as a way of life.  

Also, I intend to perform in rural and culturally diverse areas and bring visionary music for he heart out of the city and to a farther reaching community. For this, I need equipment and this is all within the budget target.  


In order to accomplish this and continue to offer this album to the community that have grown this music from the very beginning, I am asking for your help in raising $8,000. 


This is the amount that is required for the basic costs putting on the event and also purchasing a good quality RODE head set microphone, mixing desk and speakers for ongoing performances around rural areas for the much wider community and keep spreading the LOVE far & wide!! 


I am really excited to engage with YOU through this platform to support the launch of Soul Transmissions and the greater vision of Visionary Music for the Heart in the public arena in a creative and sustainable way.



How does the funding break down? 


It has been a deeply humbling experience to do the numbers and see what it actually costs to bring this music into your hands and I am committed to offering art that will stand the test of time, be authentic to my voice and vision and to value the artists who support me. 


Your contribution covers recycled & local CD packaging, production, printing, and the cost of getting this music out into the world through graphic design, marketing, promotion and an updated website. 


The money I am asking for and open to receiving will also go directly towards paying for the venue, the sound technician, musicians, artists, costumes, catering, lighting & sound hire, printing, promotions, decor, food, rehearsal studio hire, as well as paying for the high quality microphone, mixing desk and speakers needed to continue to offer this music after the album is launched. 


In the joyful event that we far exceed our target, any funds raised over & above the $8,000 will go directly towards funding the second co creative album of Visionary Healing Music for the Heart "FOR KIDS" that is in the works & due to begin recording at the end of 2016...  OMG! YES!!!


So I have put together some super amazing prizes! 

There's so much on offer and truly something for everyone, whatever you're into! 

I'm really excited to share this music AND all the gifts on offer with YOU!!! 





Your support makes the difference! 


This project is a valuable contribution to the world & so are YOU!!! 

I can't do this without you! I need your help in making this happen and I'm grateful to those who have supported me in my journey to get here... 

In 2012 I successfully raised the funds (around $2000) with the help & support from my wider community to pay for a Boss Loop Station, Sennheiser microphone, a Roland Street Cube amp and a whole series of classical singing masterclasses with Italian opera singer & tutor, Tara Venditti.  

As prizes I offered Remedial & Relaxation Massage sessions, Sound Healing Meditation Sessions & One on One Healing Sessions. It was a great success!!!

These precious vocal lessons, the looper, the amp & mic changed my life! They have all been essential in my singing & performing journey with exploring and expressing my voice and especially, in offering my music to the world over the past 4 years. 


And I'm not done yet!!! 




Risks & Challenges


I'm taking a HUGE risk! 

Basically, it's a big gamble on art & love and a belief that Visionary Music for the Heart is important & valued! I've funded everything myself so far through my work as a facilitator and an artist and am proud to be able to remain independent and not have to take out a hefty loan to launch this album!


To be honest, one the biggest challenges in creating and launching this album has been letting go of all the blockages in the way of me actually manifesting the funds required to make this miracle a reality! More specifically, figuring out how to come up with the funds to create a super high quality recording AND a translate this into a spectacular live show with ongoing performances and of course, the large task of creating a successful campaign to support the launch. 


When people suggested I do a crowdfunding, I honestly thought I didn't need one, I thought I'd be able to pay for it all myself and maybe do a kick-ass raffle on the night of the concert!  But it took a couple of my closest friends sitting me down and convincing me to a crowd funding campaign to put the call out for HELP when I realised that this was actually a totally awesome idea! 


I beloved that people LOVE supporting people!!!  People are GOOD!!! And...

 I LOVE PEOPLE!!!!! 


But, This whole process really scared me. I am the type of person that tries to do everything herself, and all my work with  Elemental Voices workshops & courses has funded everything this far. I  really think I am blessed to be able to do what I love and pay for my rent, my food, my art and live in a safe and happy environment. I see my privilege in that there are so many people out there in the world in a much worst place, but I really do believe that this art has a purpose and is worth sharing with the world. 


The World Needs Visionary Music for the Heart!!! 


Music has the power to heal, to uplift, to transform, to reveal our true nature as beings of love and beauty and to inspire us in the most miraculous ways! 

Through the process of creating this campaign I have been deeply challenged to see the value of my own work in the world and stand with it. 


I feel so grateful for the all the hurdles, doubts & obstacles along the way up until now, as they have really forced me to look at some core beliefs within myself and to truly value the work I offer the world through my art & music. 


My goal is to create timeless Visionary Music for the Heart, and it's almost impossible to put a price tag on that! 

I am deeply committed to this music, this project, my community and the work I offer now more than ever and I am so grateful to my friends & allies & support team for constant encouragement, emails, phonecalls & guidance when needed during this period of epic growth & transformation. 


The work of bringing LOVE into the world is a full time job!!!




Other Ways You Can Help


I AM OPEN TO RECEIVING ABUNDANCE IN ALL WAYS, ALWAYS!!!


I totally understand that it's not in everyone's ability to support this project financially, but that doesn't mean you can't still help me achieve & fulfil this vision! 


It would be a massive support to me if you could spread the word to your friends & family by sharing this campaign on social media, promoting my 'Soul Transmissions' album launch event and my FB page ' Clare Sentience ' : using the Indigogo share tools (that’s the Facebook, Twitter & Email icons located next to the ' Back It ' button at the top of the campaign. 


This project is all about people helping people and I can't do it without you! 


Every little bit helps & thank you so much for helping me get the message out there and helping to make this dream of dreams come true! 


Thank you! Thank you! Thank you!!! 


Love Clare xXx  



PS. If you simply want to make a donation and don't want to claim a prize : please send via PAYPAL to  >>> claresentience@gmail.com <<<  or just go to the BACK IT button :)


Infinite Gratitude 



Website :  Facebook Event Link : Personal Facebook Page

story:
Short Summary

 

Hi Great-Live-Music-Lovers!

We are Anna.lee (singer/songwriter) & Nock (producer)!

Anna.lee was born in Venice (Italy), she started singing and playing in bands when she was a teenager and started her career in music in a punk band at the age of 18. ;-) She moved to Barcelona (Spain) some years later and became the lead singer of the alternative rock band A Little Boy Lost. After some time, she decided to start her own solo project, with the help and direction of Nock, a producer-composer based in Barcelona who really helped her in shaping her music around her voice and personality!

Nock has had a long career in Barcelona in music production as an independent producer and in big production companies. In these last years he has dedicated himself to promote and help new rising artists and to carry on his solo projects (www.nockmusic.com).

In 2016 they finished the first Anna.lee's solo album, Electro Renaissance. You can listen to the entire album online and it's already available for purchase on CdBaby!

In January 2017, after releasing 3 new singles, they have decided: IT'S TIME TO GO LIVE!!!

As you will hear, the songs are incredibly elaborated, innovative, they mix the old and the new in a mixture of acoustic & instruments + the magic of special electronics & programming.

In order to play this live for all of you guys, we need some help! 

There is nothing better than creating something amazing and then being able to give it as a gift to others! And that's what we miss right now, we have a wonderful baby and we want to present it to the world! But we need the proper "stroller" to carry the baby around :-)

We need YOU, in order to CREATE A WONDERFUL, INNOVATIVE, HYPNOTIZING, ETHNO-ELECTRO-POP-ROCK KICK-ASS GIG!

And then you'll be able to say... I was part of that! I actually made THAT show happen! WOW!

 

What We Need & What You Get

 

We have completely auto-funded the album and the new-singles, but we need extra help to bring it to a FULLY AMAZING LIVE DIMENSION!

In order to experience Anna.lee's Live Tour, we need:

- 3 musicians & a dancer (yes, a dancer!)

- renting the proper venue in Barcelona for the Premiere

- hire a visual artist for projections during the show

- hire a sound technician for the gig

- and, most important, the gear: 

https://www.thomann.de/es/boss_gt100.htm

https://www.thomann.de/es/roland_spdsx_sampling...

https://www.thomann.de/es/elektron_octatrack.htm

https://www.thomann.de/es/studiologic_acuna_73.htm

https://www.thomann.de/es/tc_helicon_voicelive_...

 

So, we are super-grateful for you contribution to cover the above costs and MAKE IT A-LIVE!

If we do not reach the goal...we will aim to prepare our gig anyway in a much simpler format and in August-September instead of May, but, we know you want to see it at full potential, so make it real with us! Make it spectacular and at the level of the music we are presenting!

 

The Impact

 

We call this project "Merging Arts". We live in the Global Village now where technologies and arts are mixing together every day more. We are part of this. We mix arts, cultures, histories, music styles, instruments & machines.

Contributing to our project, you will contribute to bringing on stage a new expanded vision of a live concert, of music genres and art in the Global Village. We want to bring on stage, and sing them out loud, the wonders of all that's been learnt by humanity through history. We will celebrate the Old and the New, Light and Dark, Femenine and Masculine, and above all, cultures of the world, humanity, nature, technology...!

Help us bringing this message around the world, help us break the ice and make this first amazing gig!

 

Risks & Challenges

 

The challenges are many: as you can hear, the music we do is very elaborated and bringing it to a live dimension is not easy. But Nock is really convinced that, with a little of your help, we will manage to create a wonderful gig with Anna.lee singing and three more multi-task musicians.

Wanna bet? :-)

 

Other Ways You Can Help

 

If you can contribute in any other way, it would be fantastic! Help us spread the word, share our music, post it in your social media, tell everybody how good it is!

But above all, listen ot it, feel it, let it move you, dance on it, make it part of the soundtrack of your life! THIS WILL BE THE GREATEST GIFT OF THEM ALL!

 

Listen to our music here:

https://soundcloud.com/anna-lee-music

and on Spotify, iTunes, Napster, etc...

 

Ciao!

And then you'll be able to say... I was part of that! I actually made THAT show happen! WOW!
 

What We Need & What You Get
 
We have completely auto-funded the album and the new-singles, but we need extra help to bring it to a FULLY AMAZING LIVE DIMENSION!
In order to experience Anna.lee's Live Tour, we need:
- 3 musicians & a dancer (yes, a dancer!)
- renting the proper venue in Barcelona for the Premiere
- hire a visual artist for projections during the show
- hire a sound technician for the gig
- and, most important, the gear: 
https://www.thomann.de/es/boss_gt100.htm
https://www.thomann.de/es/roland_spdsx_sampling...
https://www.thomann.de/es/elektron_octatrack.htm
https://www.thomann.de/es/studiologic_acuna_73.htm
https://www.thomann.de/es/tc_helicon_voicelive_...
 
So, we are super-grateful for you contribution to cover the above costs and MAKE IT A-LIVE!
If we do not reach the goal...we will aim to prepare our gig anyway in a much simpler format and in August-September instead of May, but, we know you want to see it at full potential, so make it real with us! Make it spectacular and at the level of the music we are presenting!
 

The Impact
 
We call this project "Merging Arts". We live in the Global Village now where technologies and arts are mixing together every day more. We are part of this. We mix arts, cultures, histories, music styles, instruments & machines.
Contributing to our project, you will contribute to bringing on stage a new expanded vision of a live concert, of music genres and art in the Global Village. We want to bring on stage, and sing them out loud, the wonders of all that's been learnt by humanity through history. We will celebrate the Old and the New, Light and Dark, Femenine and Masculine, and above all, cultures of the world, humanity, nature, technology...!
Help us bringing this message around the world, help us break the ice and make this first amazing gig!
 

Risks & Challenges
 
The challenges are many: as you can hear, the music we do is very elaborated and bringing it to a live dimension is not easy. But Nock is really convinced that, with a little of your help, we will manage to create a wonderful gig with Anna.lee singing and three more multi-task musicians.
Wanna bet? :-)
 

Other Ways You Can Help
 
If you can contribute in any other way, it would be fantastic! Help us spread the word, share our music, post it in your social media, tell everybody how good it is!
But above all, listen ot it, feel it, let it move you, dance on it, make it part of the soundtrack of your life! THIS WILL BE THE GREATEST GIFT OF THEM ALL!
 
Listen to our music here:https://soundcloud.com/anna-lee-musicand on Spotify, iTunes, Napster, etc... Ciao!

story:
Hello! We are "soul rock" outfit, Other Moons, hailing from Guelph, Ontario!  We are attempting to summon the necessary funds to help us complete our first full-length studio album! We self funded our first EP of original compositions; now we need your help to help us complete our first album!

We are setting a fundraising goal of $3,000, which would pay for studio costs (at our favourite spot, Turtleshell Studio), equipment rental as well as CD & Vinyl creation costs. Contributions of $20 or more will receive special album updates from the studio including videos and photos as well as song previews. Those who contribute $30 or more have pre-ordered a signed CD copy for themselves; while those who contribute $100 or more have pre-ordered a signed Vinyl copy of the album for themselves! Even if we do not reach our fundraising goal, all funds will go towards the creation of the album. We are currently booked in for our next session in mid-March, so the wheels are in motion.

Even if you're not able to contribute monetarily we would love if you could share this campaign online through your various social media outlets. We're trying to get the word out and involve as many people as possible to reach our goal! We thank you for your amazing support in advance, we couldn't do it without you! Of course you can follow our journey on Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram. Keep an ear to the ground for our posts!

We're trying to get the word out and involve as many people as possible to reach our goal! We thank you for your amazing support in advance, we couldn't do it without you! story:
Who we are

Ancient Agents is an instrumental quartet that combines grooves from north India and the Middle East with Afro beats and polyrhythms – ancient sounds telling a contemporary tale.

Reza Khota (guitar), Schalk Joubert (bass), Ronan Skillen (percussion) and Fredrik Gille (percussion) each bring a distinctive sound, a long performance history and international experience. As a collective, we have a common artistic vision: to present our music in an original, uncompromising way.

Why the campaign 

There are millions of great ideas that never get the chance to be considered, let alone be seen, experienced or heard. A good idea remains a good idea until you act on it; we're excited to share what we've created with the world – which is precisely the reason for this campaign.

As independent artists, we get very little support from the Department of Arts and Culture. With the help of Concerts SA and generous benefactors, we've managed to tour SA (with 10 sold-out shows) and record  these original compositions.

But we need a bit more support to complete the production of the album and officially launch it in Cape Town and Johannesburg in September this year.

                               For a sneak preview, listen here

How you can help  

The music has been mastered, the sleeve designed and the album is ready to be printed.  

But we have to pay back our debt and launch the album. And in order to officially release our debut offering, we need to fly out Fredrik, who lives in Stockholm, so that the complete quartet can be represented on stage. 

In return for helping us realise this goal, we guarantee you an album launch of the highest quality as well as an unforgettable recording, hot off the press or available as a digital download.

What next

If our campaign is successful and we're able to release this album, we can take the band further afield. The Cape Town International Jazz Festival has already shown interest, and there's a tour of the SADC region as well as Europe in the making for 2018.

Who knows where this will lead – we certainly intend on producing music with the best intentions and an honest approach. With your help, we will continue to be inspired. Thank you!

Email us directly here      To watch more videos of the band, click here

story:
Meet Raina

Hello, friend!  My name is Raina Maris.  I’m so glad you’re here!  I’m raising money to defer the costs of recording my debut EP ‘Rage to Master,’ get my music out into the world via the awesome community that is crowdfunding, and to keep recording!  As I figure, I have enough material this very moment for 33 more EPs (or 12 full-length albums), and I intend to keep going!

I want to make music that matters.  Music saved my life.  Without Nine Inch Nails, Tool, Alice in Chains, Black Sabbath, Bush, The Smashing Pumpkins, Fiona Apple and Garbage, I don’t know if I would’ve made it through my teenage years.  That music, dark as it is, was my light.  It got me through years of depression and angst from not fitting in.  It gave me a place to go, solace, and the feeling that I was understood.  It was my lifeline.  If my music can do that too - if I can be that voice for a little girl or boy who is struggling - my life will have been worth living.

I’ve been a musician since I was 4, when my parents enrolled me in piano lessons (THANK YOU, Mom and Dad!).  I always sang, and started vocal lessons when I was 11, about the same time I got my first electric guitar (Fender Squire, y’all!).  I’d always made little compositions or melodies, but I wrote my first real song about that time, too.  (I still remember it - it isn’t very good.)  Fast-forward over 20 years and I’m still playing, writing, practicing and recording.  To date, I have over 200 songs ready to be recorded!

You might wonder what’s taken me so long.  Well, I’ll tell you, because everyone likes the underdog!  I had a ton of people shut me down over the years and I didn’t have the confidence to release anything.  I had people tell me not to sing.  I had a long-term boyfriend who told me repeatedly that I (or any women) didn’t belong in rock music.  I had professors tell me I’d never have the ears to work in a studio.  I was told my music was ‘too strange.’  I couldn't seem to break into the ‘boys club’ musician groups of Nashville or LA, or when I did, it was because I was ‘the girlfriend’ that no one took seriously.  I was utterly defeated for a big chunk of the time I wanted to be recording and touring.  It took moving back home to WI for me to merge with the musicians, Will and Mike, who not only fervently believed in my talent, but also gave me their hands, hearts and sweat to make it happen.  (You two are my forever heroes!)

Why did I tell you that?  Easy.  I want you to know I’m never going to give up, and I’m never going to stop.  I will be a musician until the day I die and this is just the (new) beginning!  I hope you’ll journey with me!  With you by my side, I can keep making awesome music without having to sell plasma to pay for it.  

What I Need & What You Get

My goal for this campaign is $2000.  There’s so much that goes into releasing a record (huge amounts of detail below) and I’ve paid for it all out-of-pocket.  But, the river runneth dry.  So will you help me?  A contribution of $1 gets you a video shout-out, $5 dollars gets you a digital download of the EP.  $15 gets you a signed physical copy and a sticker.  For $35 you'll receive all that and a t-shirt!  Not to mention every time you share me with your network, my big kitten Jack gets a belly rub.  Would you deny Jack his belly rubs?

“Where Your Money Goes,” the novel:

I have paid $1150 towards outside recording.  I know that doesn’t sound like a lot, but I’ve spent over 5 years in pre-production for this EP.  (“Umm… what?”)  Everything you’ll hear - every piano part, every orchestral line, every background chorus - took many hours to write and record.  I do a huge of the recording myself, thus I was able to save a ton of money not paying others to do it.  Some of these songs have dozens of tracks; the record is This Ship is Sinking which had 97.  NINETY-SEVEN TRACKS.  I arrange full orchestras of synths and vocals.  I record the rhythm guitars, the piano, the background vocals, and the entire sound bed in my home studio.

So the $1000?  That was paid to my co-producer, Will Maravelas.  Will and I go way back, to when we were in rock bands playing together at the Warehouse in La Crosse, WI.  Will wanted to help me get the music out, and knew I was paying for 100% out of my own pocket.  It’s not often one gets a friend rate, but I’m eternally grateful.  Will runs 14:59 Studio in Minneapolis, MN, and there we tracked most of the lead vocals, the drums, and the guitar solo on Become My Bones.  He then mixed this beast into aural submission.  Some songs had up to 13 versions (hint: it was the one with 97 tracks)!  I wish I could’ve paid him 5 times what I did.  Maybe I still can, with your help!  

What about mastering?  Well, let me tell you about that.  A dear friend, and one-time bandmate of mine, runs a successful studio.  He’s much further along in his career, as in three Grammys further along, and he believes very much in me, and the mastering (and one lead vocal and one upright bass track) was a gift.  Mike, you have my eternal gratitude!  You’re my first major contributor!

I paid the other musicians on this record $150.  It’s not enough, but it’s all I could do at the time.

OK, Raina, we’ve covered $1150 here for recording, but you’re looking for $2000.  What else?

I’m glad you asked!

  • Printing 100 physical copies of the disc is $225.  
  • I want to pay the artist who did the mockups of my art for the printer.  I’d love to give him $200 at the very least for his time retouching the cover photo and making the .ai files.  He’s my cousin, but hey, he lives in NYC and I think that would buy him a beer or two, right?  
  • Printing stickers to send out with the disc is $50.
  • Website registration, maintenance and plug-ins is running me $200 and year, and it’s been 2 years so far I’ve been working on it.  (And y’all, I had to learn Wordpress and I run my own site.  Uhhhg.)
  • TuneCore membership and distribution ($50), ASCAP registration and membership ($225), incorporation fees for my publishing company ($130) and official copyright registration ($110) have me at $515 for legality alone.
  • Initial advertising just to get the word out on social media has been $500.
  • Label dues (I’m on a grassroots label) over the 4 years this has been incubating - $300.
  • Final Cut Pro, which I purchased and learned so I can create my own music videos - $300.
  • Logic Pro X, where I do all of my recording - $200.
  • My home studio … ooooph … I think I’ve put $10K at least into that over the years.  I recently had to replace my iMac (it was the second, and it died in a freak power surge), and the iMac before that, not to mention my interfaces, effects processors, guitars, amps, pedals, microphones, cables, monitors, soundproofing, my keyboard… it hurts to think about.  
  • Travel to and from Minneapolis for recording - $200.
  • Years and years of music lessons - $5000 is a very conservative figure (and THANK YOU, Mom and Dad!!!).
  • Lastly, I went to college for Recording Technology at Belmont University in Nashville, TN.  We’re not even going to look at that number… No need to cry today!

So what I’ve actually spent on my passion for making music and this EP (not including college tuition, working 5 music industry internships for ‘experience’ (read: free), my first industry job out of college paying a whopping $18K per year, and the 10s of thousands of hours I’ve spent over the last 24+ years working on music (the opportunity cost being not making money elsewhere) = $20,000 = just the tip of the iceberg.  

The Impact

Why am I passionate about making music?  First of all, it's who I am to the core.  But I want to give back!  I want to give back the way my favorite musicians gave to me.  Trent Reznor, this is for you:  The Downward Spiral single-handedly got me through adolescence.  That record was there for me when nothing else could get through to me.  The depression, the angst, the suckiness of being misunderstood and ostracized - YOU got me though that.  I want to be that for someone.  If I help even one kid through that horrible time with my music, my life will have been worth something.

I write about the hard parts of life — unrequited love, breakups, tragedy, war… Art is a coping mechanism.  Music is solace, refuge, a friend, and a light in the dark.  My lyrics are poems.  The music is melodic and haunting and sometimes very harsh.  I hope I can help you heal by giving your sorrow a voice.  

Risks & Challenges

The hardest part about being an independent artist is getting the word out.  I am signed with Zerobudget Records.  We are a small grass-roots collective.  We have - you guessed it - no budget.  All paid promotions come out of the artists’ pockets.  We don’t have teams of marketers or promotors.  We still walk around stapling fliers to light posts!   

Advertising costs a LOT.  The money you give will help me pay for Facebook ads, and ads on other social media sites.  Maybe I can pay someone to take over my website (Hallelujah!).  I want to buy a PR campaign.  I want to get this music in the ears of that little girl who is struggling.  

Other Ways You Can Help

There are ways to contribute even if you don’t have a few bucks to spare.  Will you help me? Please share this campaign with your social networks!  Send emails!  Use the Indiegogo share tools and plaster Facebook, Twitter, Tumblr and Reddit with this.  Instagram it!  Share my YouTube video!  Get me on a blog, or a vlog, or a even a log (flier and staple gun required).

THANK YOU!  Thank you for watching the video, thank you for reading this novella, thank you for contributing and sharing and just being a patron of the arts.  You get it, and you’re awesome!  Let's go be the light in the dark together, shall we?

Love,

Raina
