story:
THE TEN-YEAR TALE OF THE SHAZZBOTS

The Shazzbots were dreamed into existence 10 years ago by Ian Hummel. Seeing the abysmal state that children’s music was mired in, Ian set about doing his best to change all that. He wanted to make REAL music that REAL kids and their families could enjoy together. So, he assembled a super-team of musicians and writers and artists and creators to make this dream of his a reality. With their help, the music and the band and the universe of the Shazzbots were born! Now, with 2 full-length albums, 100’s of live performances and an Emmy-winning TV show under their jumpsuited belts, the past decade has seen the Shazzbots team work their hardest to realize Ian’s original goal... Changing family entertainment for the better.

To celebrate our 10-year anniversary, and the recording of our 1st new all original record in 5 years, we wanted to pull out all the stops! For our 3rd record, we are putting in the same countless hours in the studio, crafting amazing songs and stories for children of all ages to enjoy, that we have with the past two studio releases: Shazzbots GO! and Blast Off!. We are striving to create a sonic landscape with LIGHTSPEED! that pushes the boundaries of “kids music”. We strongly believe that children enjoy listening to the same breadth of musical stylings that adults do. Happy songs. Sad songs. Rockin’ songs. Funky songs. Slow songs. Kids are more mature in their listening preferences than most newer “kids bands” give them credit for. That's why The Shazzbots have always strived to harken back to the days of Jim Henson and Sesame Street, of Schoolhouse Rock, of Shel Silverstein. All music, poetry and art that still resonates with the adults of today.

But not only do we once again want to produce the best music for families to enjoy imaginable, we want to release this album in multiple formats, to really help the kiddos get excited about music and the listening experience! Of course we will be releasing LIGHTSPEED! on compact disc (for the cars) and digital (for the iPads) formats, but for the first time, we will also be putting out an exclusive vinyl version of the album! Again, we have seen that there are virtually no kids records being released in this format, and we have to wonder why?? Vinyl records are an important medium in the history of music, that has never been more popular. It’s long been the reigning champ of the format best designed for an immersive music listening experience. Full rich sound and large album art sleeves are why listeners have flocked to vinyl and made it the longest running music format that is still thriving to this day. So, why NOT make a vinyl record for KIDS to enjoy?? We can’t think of reason not to either. 

WHAT WE NEED & WHAT YOU'LL GET

We have launched this exclusive presale campaign to help us get firm numbers of products that our fans are interested in and to help allay some of the upfront costs of producing an album on multiple formats. As you have seen above, we are already hard at work at Vital Studios crafting the amazing music of LIGHTSPEED!. But the type of packaging and artwork we want to create can get pricey. For the vinyl version of the record, we want to create a super-deluxe gatefold package that is sure to blow the minds of both kids and parents alike! The Shazzbots’ Space Winnebago speeding at you on the front cover and rocketing away on the back will be the same as on the CD version (just way bigger!). But the interior gatefold will feature exclusive art created just for this vinyl release, showing an incredible cross-section of the ship and it’s endless amount of rooms! (Remember, much like Dr. Who’s Tardis, the Shazzbots’ Space Winnebago is waaay bigger inside than out, thanks to that localized worm-hole device that Professor Swiss Vanderburton installed.) Couple all that with an exclusively designed inner sleeve and labels, this album is chock full of not only music but ART too! And as you know, that is one of the hallmarks of the Shazzbots’ brand... Spreading the joys of music, art and creativity to all the children of the cosmos!

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

If you don’t have the funds to get on board now with this exclusive presale, don’t fret! This album in all its forms will be available on our website, at our shows and in all the finer music shops around Columbus, Ohio. But you can still help us raise some of the upfront capital needed to make this record happen even if you can’t contribute financially. Namely by helping us spread the word about this presale campaign! Help us make some noise about the need for REAL music for REAL kids (and REAL parents). Let all of your friends and family (with or without kids) know about The Shazzbots and what we are striving to do here. Indie Go Go has all kinds of tools that make sharing our project super easy, so please, use them! 

The entire Shazzbots team is so very thankful for every single one of our fans. Whether a youngster that was with us at the beginning who has now grown up and out of our age demographic; or a grandma that bought our music for her grandkids in another state; or the countless parents that have thanked us for making those long car rides more bearable... You all are the BEST! Thank you from the bottom of our hearts for showing up, for buying our merch, for helping us fund a TV show, for dancing and singing along, and for spreading the word low and high about The Shazzbots! LIGHTSPEED! is dedicated to YOU!

WE'RE THE SHAZZBOTS (AND WE LOVE YOU!):

Ian Hummel (Captain Captain) - creator/producer/songwriter/vocals 

Mike Heslop (Navigator Scopes) - bass/writer

Dianne Hummel (Luna Stardust) - percussion/financial officer 

Steve Frye (Watts Watson) - drums/electrician 

Josh Tully (Professor Swiss Vanderburton) - guitars/comic relief

Joel Jackson - art director/producer

Matt Hubbard - video producer/editor/director

Mitchell Rogers - cameraman/editor

Jordan Schmelzer - video producer

Fred Blitzer - music producer/engineer/mixer
story_txt: THE TEN-YEAR TALE OF THE SHAZZBOTSThe Shazzbots were dreamed into existence 10 years ago by Ian Hummel. Seeing the abysmal state that children’s music was mired in, Ian set about doing his best to change all that. He wanted to make REAL music that REAL kids and their families could enjoy together. So, he assembled a super-team of musicians and writers and artists and creators to make this dream of his a reality. story:
Short Summary

Danielle Hecht is a producer, director, performer and photographer originally from Massachusetts. Her educational background ranges from Music, Media Arts, Art History, Theater Arts, Production, Dance and Cinema in addition to working as a freelance corporate photographer in the New York area. As she takes her first step towards becoming a self produced musical artist, she aims to utilize all components of her creative background to manifest work that is thoughtful, progressive, multidimensional and genuine.  In doing so Danielle acknowledges that she cannot reach her goals alone and only with the help of her collaborators will she have the opportunity to achieve success.  It is of the utmost importance to Danielle that all her collaborators are shown the respect they deserve for the services they provide -- and that means fair monitory compensation. It is a daunting task to take on a leadership role in an industry that so often devalues an artists contribution in a collaborative setting -- thus, as Danielle continues to grow her business, she hopes to create a culture rooted in mutual respect, transparency and equanimity. 

What We Need & What You Get

Funds will be allocated as follows:

Arranger and Musical Director - $500

Musician Fees (8 Musicians / $200 each) - $1,600

Photographer - $200

Videographer - $200

Contingancy - $500

In the event that the full funds are not raised, I will fulfill my commitment to my collaborators and supplement their wages with any profits made from the production itself. 

The Impact

The goal is to be a game changer. Not just in the creative work that is produced but in the way that artists are treated.  The music industry is (in its current state) shady by nature.  The idea is to create a new standard and a new culture for music -- one founded on mutuality and respect.

Risks & Challenges

There are challenges that come with every kind of production - creative, financial, technical, logistical and otherwise.  The goal is to remain focused and fluid at the same time.  Stay the course but be prepaired to re-adjust at any moment as the process takes its natural course. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to make a monitory donation at this time, the next best thing you could do would be to buy a ticket and join us for our first show. Your support, your ear, your smile and your energy are what motive artists to keep moving forward -- and for that, we thank you.

story:
Our mission is to promote the performing arts and arts education by inspiring young audiences around the world. Trained at the Franklin School for the Performing Arts in Massachusetts, Electric Youth members are preparing for professional careers on stage.  EY shows feature an expansive repertoire of pop, classic rock, swing, country and contemporary Broadway music, fully choreographed, and backed by an eight-piece band of professional musicians. For more than 10 years, Electric Youth has toured all over the world recorded five albums, and given back by performing for our troops and their families at Aviano Air Force Base in Italy. Since 2003, our tours have taken us to the U.K., France, Italy, Austria, Slovenia, Wales, and even on board Royal Caribbean's Oasis of the Seas cruise ship. This summer, our three week concert tour will bring us back to the U.K., France, and Italy and for the first time, to Switzerland!

We need your help to reach our goal of $3500 with Indiegogo. To make possible our tours in 2017 and in the future, we need to pay for our new DB wireless microphone system being built for us in Italy.  Donating to our campaign will support our tours and help us further our mission as ambassadors of America’s youth, traveling and performing in Europe for years to come! 

What We Need 

To make this trip and future performances possible we need to purchase:

  • New wireless microphone system

What You Get

If you donate you receive one of the following:

  • Thank you shout-out
  • Post card from Europe
  • Name in our 2017 EY Playbill
  • Tour T-shirt
  • CD
  • FaceTime personal Thank you from Europe
  • YouTube cover song of your choice
  • Single Song Download from iTunes

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Share this fundraiser with friends, communities and on  social media pages. This helps us spread the word far and wide! Your help is more valuable than you know and we appreciate it!

story:
Kurzbeschreibung

 

Der spezielle innovative Klang unseres Chores bei größeren Konzerten entsteht durch ein sogenanntes Funk Headset Mikrofon für jeden Sänger als Grundausstattung.

Damit ist es uns auch auf großen Bühnen möglich jeden Sänger als Solist hervorzuheben und gleichzeitig haben wir die volle Bewegungsfreiheit um ausgefallene Choreografien auf der Bühne zu zeigen und sind nicht an Mikrofonständer und Kabel gebunden.

Dieses Funk Headset Mikrofon ist sozusagen unser „Instrument“, denn wir verstärken damit unser echtes Instrument, die menschliche Stimme.

 Allerdings ist es unüblich in der Chorbranche für einen einzelnen Sänger ca. 2.000€ aufzuwenden.

Wir haben uns diesen Sound und die technischen Möglichkeiten in den letzten 10 Jahren aufgebaut, durch die Frequenzvergabe der Rundfunkbehörde RTR wird ein Teil dieser Investition zunichte gemacht.

Deshalb sind wir zu Neuanschaffungen gezwungen, die uns momentan finanziell sehr fordern.

Etwa 12 unserer Funkstrecken, das sind ca. die Hälfte unseres Equipments, werden wir erneuern müssen. Einen Teil der Investition möchten wir mit dieser Kampagne lukrieren um weiterhin unseren Sound und Stil halten zu können.

www.chameleons.at

story:
Hello! My name is Peter Ciluzzi and I'm a guitarist from Massachusetts.
 


I've released two albums of original solo guitar music. My instrumental work has accumulated millions of views on Youtube and more than six million plays on Spotify. I've toured and performed around the US as part of multi-artist guitar-night showcases and now I'm raising money to help promote my debut solo east-coast tour this spring.

When and where am I performing?

4/21 Providence RI - Brooklyn Coffee & Tea House Music Room
4/23 Nashua NH - Riverwalk Cafe & Music Bar
4/28 New York City NY - Rockwood Music Hall
5/12 Charlotte NC - The Evening Muse
5/17 Atlanta GA - Smith's Olde Bar
6/4 Rochester NY - Nazareth College Arts Center
6/11 Alstead NH - Mole Hill Theater
6/17 Boston MA - Center for Arts at the Armory
6/22 Hanover MA - Skinny Pancake Music Venue
TBA Philadelphia, PA
TBA Washington DC
TBA Richmond, VA
TBA Asheville, NC

(As well as additional dates in September & Midwest concerts in October)

How will this money help?

I'm putting a lot of my own money up to cover travel expenses as well as other costs associated with planning a tour and putting on a series of concerts, and I risk losing a lot of time and money if they're not properly promoted and well-attended. I've found that if I can get the word out, my shows go well -- as they did during a series of solo concerts in New England that I booked, promoted, and performed in during the summer of 2016.

Every dollar I raise will go directly to promoting my shows by:

- Placing concert advertisements in newspapers, magazines, and radio
- Boosting the visibility and reach of online listings and event calendars
- The production and distribution of promotional materials
- Targeted promotional mailings
- Enabling the help of street team promotion and flyering locally

What do you get if you donate?

As extra incentive there are perks for those who contribute that are listed in the column to the right and include MP3 downloads and signed CD's, guitar lessons for my fellow guitarists out there, concerts in your home and even a one-nite stay in a waterfront accommodation on Cape Cod, MA.

How else can you help?

If you're not able to contribute directly to this effort there are other ways you can help -- namely by helping me get the word out either by sharing with your friends and telling them about my Indiegogo campaign -- or also by helping to promote my concerts if you're near one, by distributing flyers, hanging posters, or by spreading the word about my performances in whatever way possible! If you're interested in being part of a street team and distributing flyers locally near one of my shows please email me directly at peter@peterciluzzi.com. 

Thanks for reading!

story:
The video above is the first music video I ever released, and I hope to make a lot more quality songs and videos in the next few months!

My name is Shiv, I'm 18 years old, and I'm an independent artist currently based in Miami. Just 2 years ago I was sitting in my room listening to my favourite rapper J. Cole, hoping to become as great as he is and making music that positively influences a generation of youth. I never thought I'd have the courage to try anything like that until I stepped in the studio a year ago and recorded my first 5 professional tracks. The song you see in the video above is one of them. Over the past year, I've recorded over 50 tracks in my dorm room in college, and I truly believe that I've reached a stage where I'm ready to create a body of work that will connect with the souls of people and at the same time be enjoyable to fans of hip-hop. 

2 months ago I began recording rough mixes to a mini-album that resonates with my views on the world and truths that I've had to face as a teenager growing up in a cruel world. I've never worked harder on lyricism and I know that what I'm creating comes straight from the heart. The movement that I want to create in rap is one that is filled with positivity. I want kids to set aside their problems and distance themselves from negative energy so that they can chase their dreams. I've been through the lowest of lows with my family and I know what it feels like to set yourself on a downwards spiral that is difficult to get out of. The tracks in this album delve deep into the human consciousness and society, and really explore the many problems that the youth of my generation encounter on a daily basis. It's an eye-opening piece of work.

The budget for this project stems from the fact that I've assembled a talented team that will help me take this project to the next level. From my producer, to studio-time, to my videographer, to my editor, to my marketing team; everybody needs to be paid for their hard-work in helping this project reach the next level. I need this album to work because it's been my dream for a long time now. I've always wanted to create a project that has high-quality production and videos that tell stories. For this to happen, I need everyone in my team to be compensated so that we all can enjoy the fruits of this album.

I'm an independent artist so I need YOU to be my record label. Your support will not only help me achieve my dreams but also help me captivate the attention of the youth with the messages in my music. I will be creating a piece of art with my music and the videos that come along with them.

story:
Aloha Musical Compadres! 

My name is David Courtenay.  I'm a singer, composer and performer who lives to brighten the world with music and empower all people through the gift of song and uplifting lyrics. I've known this was my calling ever since I was four-years-old and first performed in front of a big audience at a talent show. By the end of my song, I had the whole crowd up on their feet, hootin' and hollering.  When I felt the joy and enthusiasm the music brought out of me, and the whole room full of people, I knew this was my path.  At the age of 17, I tested out of high school, formed a band and have been making music and playing professionally ever since. My music has taken me on tours up the West Coast, all over the Midwest and as far east as Pittsburgh, New York, Boston, and Miami. I've released four albums of original music along the way and have had the pleasure of making six music videos. The awakening power of music is the gift I wish to give the world  - and I live to share it in every possible way!

I recently took the next big step in my music career and hired a top-level producer (Jesse Siebenberg) to assist me in recording ten new songs (to be release as two, back-to-back "EP's"). We just recorded the foundational tracks of each song at the world-class, Grammy-award-winning Brotheryn Studios. Jesse brought in his all-star team of pro studio musicians to play on the record, and they have created the stellar sound and high-caliber production I've always dreamed of for my music. To get this project going, I invested all of my music savings into the first phase of recording, and now I need your assistance in funding the completion of the songs. Once the songs are mixed, mastered and ready for global distribution, the next step is to promote and market them through every possible medium: online social media marketing, new music videos, college and internet radio campaigns and the launching of an extensive U.S. tour. Reaching the right audience requires having the capital to get the music out there, and this is where I greatly need your help!

All funds raised from this campaign will go directly towards:

  • Recording Studio Costs (covers studio time, mixing & mastering, paying the studio musicians and the music producer)
  • Merchandise Artwork & Design, Pressing CD's & Digital Download Cards
  • Launching the next music tour (paying the supporting musicians, covering costs of transportation, food and lodging on the road)
  • Launching of a professional promotional campaign (including social media marketing, internet & college radio campaign,  and professional website design/maintenance)
  • Filming & editing of two new music videos with a professional film crew

Through your contributions, I'll be able to record the crucial, final parts of all my new songs. I'll be able to have them mixed and mastered by the best in the business, so they can be presented to the world in the greatest way possible and ready for global distribution. Your support will allow me to hire the team necessary to effectively promote and distribute the music - and I can't do it without you! Please be sure to check out ALL the unique and exclusive perks (to the right - scroll all the way down) offered as a "thank you" for your donations, including sailboat cruises, concerts on the water, private performances in your backyard or living room, personal Yoga & Music lessons, and incredible Yoga/Music retreats in the most beautiful natural settings!

The Impact

For me, the creation of these new songs is about helping others be more present and live in the moment. Positive music inspires us to release and relax, to dance and fully awaken ourselves. It contributes to our overall health, happiness, and peace. I create music to serve and enhance the world, one person at a time. My greatest intention is that this music will inspire and uplift YOU - and everyone who hears it! 

I truly appreciate your generosity and support in this crowd-funding campaign! If it weren't for all you wonderful fans, music aficionados and avid listeners, I would have no one to play to and no one to share my music with. We've come a long way together, and it's with great joy and gratitude that I invite you to join me on the next and greatest phase of this journey. Thank you with all my heart for helping me to fund the "take-off" of this new music!

Other Ways You Can Help 

The power of your word-of-mouth is one of the greatest ways you can help this campaign become a success! If you feel so inspired, please spread the word by sharing this page, using the Indiegogo "share tools." Thank you for your willingness to share! Let's make some waves! 

Risks & Challenges

Of course, with any great venture (like this crowd-funding campaign), there's always the risk of not reaching the specified goal amount. The great thing about this Indiegogo campaign is that it has "flexible-funding," meaning I'll still be able to use whatever amount I've raised to go toward the completion of this recording project. Any and every contribution you give will go directly to the cause, so thank you again for your part in bringing this new music to life!
With Love & Gratitude,
David Courtenay

story:
Hello, we are Maxwell Dulaney and Orlando Cela.  After collaborating for almost a decade writing, performing, and teaching, we feel the need to further encourage the development of truly innovative new music.  There are many composers out there not only writing music, but pushing the boundaries of instruments, perceptions, and structures, and we want to encourage an exchange of these ideas at a national level. 

For our first concert, we are bringing cello virtuoso and song-writer Meaghan Burke from New York City, as well as bringing Maxwell from New Orleans.  Both are artists who are actively experimenting with very innovative ways to use instruments and musical forms. Bringing them together is just the first step in this idea and arts exchange - Meaghan will be performing a solo cello work by Maxwell.  Local composer Derek Hurst is also working with Orlando on a new piece for flute, also to be heard at the concert.  Finally, a selection of other works by other cutting edge composers will complete the program. 

We also encourage the dialogue about what makes something new, and we expect you, the audience, to actively give us your input in what you hear, feel, or think.

For our first event, we need a mere $1500.00. This amount will go towards renting the space and equipment, paying the players, honoraria for the composers, and administrative costs. Any surplus will be directed towards the next event, which is planned for January 2016.

With just this little amount, we can produce a very necessary laboratory style experience for other performers and composers to learn, experiment, and create.  We have already successfully done exchanges like this in places as far as Ningbo, China and a few cities in the USA, using Maxwell’s music to train college students - and even high-schoolers! - in the production of some of the newest extended techniques for classical, and sometimes, folk instruments.

Thanks for helping in any way you can.  No matter how little you give, it will help us tremendously to reach our goal.  Also, share the project with your friends so that they may contribute.

We hope see you at HazMat!

story:
Beyond Imagination is a Swedish rock band whose music has it’s roots in the 70’s and 80’s American West Coast rock. Influences like Toto, Jay Graydon, Chicago and Al Jarreau has left it’s traces in the musics sound. In 2014 the band released their EP »Change The Way«, where the title track won The February 2016 Akademia Music Award for Best Pop/Rock Song – now they want to record their first full length album.

To record a full length album takes great effort. Everything from writing the songs to rehearsing them with the band, to recording, mixing and promoting the music - is an extensive and costly process. Now, all the music is already written and soon to be well rehearsed, but the recording session lies ahead. It will go down in august this year and that's where you come into the picture.

With your contribution we will reach the limit for our budget and make this project a dream come true for everyone involved. Your contributions will cover expenses for recording, mixing, mastering, album cover art AND – best of all – help us get a legendary American session veteran to make a guest appearance as a soloist for one of our songs!

We've put aside 3250$ of our own savings for this project so far, now we need to raise an estimate of 5000$ to make it all the way. No amount is too small so don't be late with your gift and grab your reward.

If we don't reach our full goal here on Indigogo, don't worry – the recording is going down anyway and the money will be spared until we reach our budget goal. Though there will be a delay of our release off course!

This record is a unique collaboration among enthusiastic up and coming Swedish musicians and a true American session veteran. We've prepared this recording for over 3 years now - writing numerous songs, played live gigs and rehearsing the music to a minimum. Our CD will deliver great quality musicianship with well written songs and transmit the beloved West Coast genre for new generations to come. It doesn't matter if you're already a West Coast fan or a uninitiated listener of the genre – we strongly believe you'll enjoy it.

Please join us on this journey and we'll make it happen - once and for all!

All the best,

Emanuel & Andreas, with Beyond Imagination

story:
“I WILL REMEMBER MY DREAMS AND FIGHT FOR THEM.”

It was a packed auditorium on that spring night at my high school. The whole community had turned out to support the high school band’s “Spring Fling” concert. My band director had asked me to perform two songs, Hard Hearted Hannah (The Vamp of Savannah) and Sweet Georgia Brown. We’d come to the place in the concert where it was my turn. Standing behind the microphone, looking up at three hundred plus people, I put everything I had into those two songs. The audience rewarded me with a standing ovation. At seventeen, at that moment, I realized what I was destined to do in my life: to sing, to entertain, and to create music. Why am I telling you this story? I am telling you this story, because the dreams of a seventeen year old girl continue to burn in my heart. Music is my dream, my passion, my heart, my soul, my craft, and my profession. I am making this album because I still believe in my dreams.

I NEED YOUR HELP

I am asking you to partner with me to make an exceptional album. The cost of writing, recording, mixing, mastering, manufacturing, promoting, and releasing an album, in this day and age, can add up. I am an independent artist. I don’t have the backing of a record company. I believe I have something far better. I have you in my corner. Because I believe in me, I have already invested my own money in the writing, recording, producing, mixing, and mastering of this album. I would not ask you to do for me what I am not willing to do for myself.

As many of you know, I was in Nashville, TN June 13- June 17. Under the leadership of executive producer, Gina Hughes (The Galaxie Agency), I recorded 12 songs. At the musical helm, guiding my ship was Grammy winning producer, Tom Hambridge. I co-wrote nine of the twelve songs with Tom and his writing partner, Richard Fleming. Tom assembled a lineup of world class musicians to perform on these songs: Tom Hambridge – drums, Reese Wynans – keyboards, Michael Rhodes – bass, Rob McNelley – guitar, Pat Buchanan – guitar. I can’t wait for you to hear this record! As Tom said, “It’s gonna be epic!”

The recording of this album has been completed largely in part to the generous donations of two “angels”. I still have expenses to conquer. Some of those expenses include, but are not limited to: publicity, graphic design, photography, advertising, manufacturing and replication of the album, legal fees (copyrighting, song licensing, contracts), office supplies (postage, packaging, hard copy promo), and touring to support the album.

Thank you for partnering with me. Thank you for believing in me.

story:
My Story

My name is Nicole Saphos. I grew up in the LA area, studied jazz at Temple University, and subsequently settled in Washington, D.C. Since moving to D.C in 2012, I’ve been consistently working as a freelance musician in a variety of musical contexts. Over the past few years, I’ve been performing with my own band more regularly, as well as composing and playing my original music. The music I've recorded for Tiptoe is the result of this journey and my collaboration with the talented musicians I’ve met along the way.

It is no secret that there are financial challenges associated with a career in music, which leads me to why I’m reaching out to you today. At this point, I have invested countless hours of planning, rehearsal, and studio time to complete the album, and while I’m thrilled with the end result, there are still many more costs to come. I hope you’ll consider supporting my Indiegogo campaign and become a part of this journey.

*Be sure to check out the list of perks!

 

Following The Money

Expenses already incurred:

  • Album Artwork: $550
  • Musicians (rehearsals +studio time): $900
  • Video editing: $150
  • Recording: (tracking, mixing, mastering): $2790

=$4,390

Expenses remaining:

  • Manufacturing (duplication): abt $2,000
  • Licensing Fees: $713
  • Publicity: $2500

=approx. $5,213

Total album expenses= approx. $9,603

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If donating is simply not in the cards for you at the moment here's what you can do to help spread the word:

  • Tell a music-loving friend about my campaign by emailing the campaign URL!
  • Share this campaign on social media

story:
Salutations to all!

We are Monarch Theatre and let's get right to it!

We are raising $5000 to record, mix, and master a 5 song EP. 

That's where you guys come in.

We are at the mercy of the generosity, kindness, and support of our friends, family, and even strangers who believe in a new musical revolution happening in the near future. We are just one of hundreds and thousands of bands trying to make a difference by sharing our music to the world...

First thing's first though. In order to share the music of Monarch Theatre, we will need to go to the studio. 

So with your generous donations, and every cent does indeed count, we will be much closer to achieving our goal of producing our very first professionally produced, in-studio EP! So dig deep, support our campaign, and donate! Your contributions will be greatly appreciated and maybe even rewarded. 

Thanks all! 

- Marc, Zach, Shaun, Alex

story:
Teresa de Roberto Biography

Having started classical singing at the age of 14, Teresa has entertained audiences with her big voice and even bigger personality around the UK, in Europe and in Africa, performing at weddings, parties, holiday resorts as well as military and corporate events.

Teresa started her professional training privately followed by a year’s intensive course at the Italia Conti Academy of theatre arts, where she was named Singer of the Year. During this time, she also competed around the UK bringing home many victories and gaining experience on stage. Her biggest achievement during this time was to perform at London’s O2 Arena.

Following this, Teresa performed regularly for charity, in particular the Royal British Legion, which has resulted in her performing at Yeovil Town FC on many occasions.

The highlights of Teresa’s career to date are:

  • 2012 performing with the renowned Opera Singer Dame Kiri Te Kanawa on BBC1
  • 2014 performing her Classical-Crossover show at the Sensatori resorts in Egypt, Crete and Tenerife
  • 2014 and 2015 performed at the prestigious Union Chapel in London as well as Wiltons Music Hall in London, with the rapper Chozen Offical combining Rap and Opera.

EP and Video Project

This September, Teresa plans to record a 5 track EP featuring some of her favourite tracks, 2 of which she will since in Italian, at Charborough Studios in Surrey.  The track listing for the EP is:

  • When I Fall In Love
  • Time To Say Goodbye
  • The Impossible Dream [TRACK DEDICATION TAKEN]
  • The Power Of Love [Gabrrielle Aplin Version]
  • Everything I Do I Do It For You

In addition, Teresa will be filming a video to one of these tracks [which one? Now that would be telling].

This crowdfunding campaign is designed to serve two purposes:

  • To help to cover the costs of recording the EP and filming the video
  • To allow people to pre-order signed copies of the EP which they will receive as soon as it is released.

In return for donations to support this project there are a number of amazing perks avaialble ranging from signed photos to your own private concert by Teresa either by Skype or at a veneue of your choice.

To help to cover the costs of recording the EP and filming the video
To allow people to pre-order signed copies of the EP which they will receive as soon as it is released.
In return for donations to support this project there are a number of amazing perks avaialble ranging from signed photos to your own private concert by Teresa either by Skype or at a veneue of your choice.

story:
Something Heavenly

Being captivated by beauty is one of the sweetest parts of the human experience. Beauty reveals purpose to us - in a manner that no other medium can convey. Such has been my personal experience, so profoundly so that I am passionate about understanding it, curating it, creating it, and sharing it.  

Something Heavenly is a journal of sorts – a diary of the beauty found in both the joys and pains of life. We cry out for beauty when we recognize its void, we feel it through intimacy with those we love, and we yearn to see it in ourselves.  

I am thrilled about this EP – in many ways it is the culmination of my development as an artist and the commencement of my career. I truly believe in these songs, and believe that they will become a worthy return on your investment many times over.

Thank you all, from the bottom of my heart, for your support and love.

Let’s do this.

 

EZ

 

What We Need & What You Get

In order to bring the highest listening experience to you all, I am committed to having some of the industry’s best creators involved in the production process of this EP. Because of this decision, costs are a little higher than an average EP. However, this is one of the primary reasons I am so excited about this project. The individuals involved are all at the top of their game within their craft, and are all committed to creating work at the best of their abilities. I am so thankful for their desire to participate, and a true way of showing this appreciation is to compensate them fittingly.

 

Thank you!

This project could not be fully realized without your ardent support and contributions. If you cannot give financially, that is ok! The generous giving of your time, interest, and shared enthusiasm is powerful. I am humbled just to know that you believe in this with me.

story:
中文

My name is Adina Tsai, and I'm the originator of the project "Florestan String Quartet's Journey -USA to Taiwan." I am a violinist from Taiwan, and I'm a currently violin fellow at  "The Orchestra Now" at Bard College, New York. I'm also one of the founders of Florestan String Quartet with four other colleagues (Michael, Chi, Lauren and Paul) from the orchestra, and we have collaborated with different organizations, such as museums and libraries, for community projects in the Hudson Valley, New York.

We need your support because this summer we are starting a project "Florestan String Quartet's Journey -USA to Taiwan."

Here's how the numbers game: 

  $900 - Adina's flights

  $900 - Michael's flights

  $900 - Chi's flights

  $900 - Lauren's flights

+$900 - Paul's flights

---------------------------------

= $4500 Grand total

Fundraising amount: $4500

(Fortunately, we found a sponsor for cello in Taiwan, and we are renting a bass domestically!) 

 

Now, you might be thinking about "why should I support a random string quartet for their performances? " Well, this project is not only a performance project. More importantly, it is a community project with education and love! 

What We Do in Taiwan:

  1. We will go to several elementary schools in Taiwan, and work with kids through free workshops and interactive lecture recitals. The purpose of this is to connect kids and classical music without distance. Through the activities, the kids will learn the appreciation for music, art and beauty! The children will also learn about classical music, instruments and what do musicians do?
  2. There will be free concerts in different cities (Taichung City and Kaohsiung City.) We would like to spread classical music to the public by giving free concerts and encourage more people to join the world of classical music. 

(^Adina doing a lecture recital with her partner Wei-Shuan Yu in BeiShih Elementary School, Taichung, Taiwan, 2016)

Why We Want to Make it Happen:

We have two Taiwanese in our ensemble; I am one of them, and the violist Chi Lee is also from Taiwan. We are both foreign students in America. We spent so many years in America learning, performing and pursuing our profession to the top level. However, recently some questions came to our minds: What's the purpose of all this? If we can do community projects in America, why can't we show our love and perform for our community back in Taiwan? What can we do to make our musical career more meaningful?

This project is non-profitably organized. No one in this project will gain anything for their own benefits except the love and joy returned by the children and the Taiwanese society! 

(^The children from BeiShih Elementary School watching the lecture recital, 2016) 

Thank you so much for reading my story! If you like my idea or feel connected to my project, please give us some support! Every dollar and cent you donate means a lot to us! We hope to reach the fund by August 2017, and we appreciate any amount! Even a dollar makes us closer to achieve this project. Many thanks from all of us in Florestan String Quartet, and we will be sure to use your money meaningfully with appreciation!

story:
Meet Care:

Hey there! My name is Carolyn Bonini, you can call me Care. I am 22 years old, a college student, youngest of 6 in the Bonini clan, a resident of Bridgeport, CT, and a musician. I sing, play piano, guitar, ukulele, and most importantly, I write my own music. I've played at small gigs, with other bands, and at many many talent shows. I'm ready to take on a bigger stage.

Being famous is my dream come true. For those of you that know me, you know that I'm not going to be famous for the sake of fame and fortune. I'm on this planet to give back and put out music that is authentic and makes a difference in people's lives. I'm not going to stop until I make it on top, and I can't do it without the support of my community. The world needs trustworthy, influential people now more than ever. While performing, I perform music that is real and authentic. People who hear my music leave feeling moved, touched, and inspired. Now I'm ready to take this to a bigger crowd. 

 

What I'm gonna do when I'm famous, is set up community centers in communities all around the world. These centers are places where kids and teens can express themselves through the arts. The centers will offer affordable music lessons, art classes, theater classes, as well as opportunities to advance in media arts. There will be mentors on hand at all times: people there specifically for the children to be heard and listened to. Everyone deserves the opportunity to go after their dreams. 

Your support means the world to me. I've never been the type of person to ask for help, but I realize that I can't make this dream come true without you. Your love and belief in what I can do means everything to me, and I'll never ever forget the contribution that you have made.

 

What is the funding for? Good question! I've got answers!

All the donations toward this cause go directly into producing, putting on all the final touches, and making amazing music videos. I have already started the recording process, and have made a lot of progress with what funds I already have.

  • $2,200- producing, editing, recording ($40/hour)
  • $1,800- mixing & mastering the three songs (making the songs radio ready!)
  • $1,000- this & that (props for music videos, pay for musicians, extra cables for recording)      = $5,000 total

This money means that I get to be unstoppable! Once I have the funds, there is nothing holding me back from being on that big stage! If I don't meet my goal, I will still put any funds from this campaign straight into my music budget, and complete as much of my promises as monetarily possible.

Glittery Gifts Just for YOU!

I'm so super excited and grateful for any support you may give me! On the right side of this campaign you can pick a gift bundle to match your donation! Here are some examples of the sparkly things you may recieve: 

This 'Care Bonini Original' Tote Bag!

(Yes! That is a little me on the bag!)

Cool Stickers!

Handmade Watercolor Art

My own art, made with watercolor and my own song lyrics. The art comes framed and ready to hang on your wall. Each piece is different and unique!

The Impact

As a child, I always wanted to make it big . Around the age of 10, I made a dream book, and even today I still remember drawing myself on stage in front of a massive crowd. I always knew that I could do it, but I never knew when or how. It wasn't until this year that I realized what has been holding me back all this time. What has gotten in the way is that I've been trying to do this alone. I'm ready to let other people help me with this dream. 

This dream isn't just about me. It's about me becoming the type of person that can give back to the whole world. There is a lot to do on this planet. There are plenty of other children and adults who want to be heard and have something really important to say, but they just don't have the spotlight. My mission and commitment in life is that everyone has a voice, and everyone is free. 

Four years ago I did another Indiegogo campaign to get to Europe, and out of the support of my community I was able to have the most rewarding and adventurous year and a half abroad, and I'm so grateful to everyone who supported me. I have faith in my community and myself that this is going to be just as successful. Even if this campaign doesn't get me famous, I'm going to use this momentum to continue to share my music and live my life impacting the lives of other people, especially musicians and artists. 

What's at Stake

I realize that the path to fame isn't easy, and I can only assume that it's going to be harder than I could have imagined. People don't just become famous overnight. And then there are the celebrities that become depressed in the spot light and it becomes obvious that being famous takes an extreme toll on people and can be very stressful. Plus, there are millions of musicians putting themselves out there and reaching for the same dream as me! 

Believe me, I know all of this, and I still have faith. I am a strong believer in the universe, and I know that everything will be ok. I have an amazing community that will be with me through everything. I believe that anything truly is possible, so why can't I get famous?! Let's do this people!

How Can You Help?

For those of you that would like to donate, feel free to click the "Contribute Now" at the top right corner of this page.

And for those of you that just can't support right now, there are other ways that you can support me! There is so much power in sharing, and I would be so grateful if you let some people know about this campaign (There are social media sharing buttons on the page)! Also if you have any connections for me, or people who I should meet, please let me know! 

I just can't tell you enough how grateful I really am. I feel so loved and supported. Thank you for everything you do to make my dreams come true. I love you all, and I can't wait to be famous (and give you free tickets to my shows). Thank you thank you thank you!

story:
Our Story

Run The Willow formed as a band in the summer of 2014 in the small town of Gettysburg, PA. Our sound has evolved over the past few years from singer/songwriter to eclectic-folk-rock-goodness (thats our preferred genre title) and we are now a six piece band composed of: Vince Bruinsma (songwriter/vocals/guitar); Bekah Foster (vocals/drums); Chris Hartlaub (banjo); Aaron Susek (accordion); Taylor Greenholt (bass/violin); Ben Muller (viola).

The Project

"A Living Dichotomy" is our first full length album as a band. It tells the story of developing a home and explores the beautiful struggle of allowing roots to grow into a community. It is a collection of songs that have been written from a deeply personal space but can resonate with anyone who has experienced the joy/pain/beauty of love, not as a romantic relationship, but as a community. 

What We Need

We have already started the recording process for these songs, but we need to raise a little bit more funding to complete the album. For the sake of transparency, here are the bare minimum costs associated with completing the project:

  • Recording/Mixing $2500
  • Mastering $500
  • Printing of CD/Album $1200

So the total cost of the project is $4200. Using funds from our gigs, we have already paid $1400 of the recording costs, which leaves us with another $2800 to raise. The funds from your contribution will be directly applied to the costs shown above. We are also holding a benefit concert on October 20th at Waldo's and Company in Gettysburg, PA. The funds from this show will also go directly towards this project. 

If we happen to raise more than our goal, we would love to invest in some extra little tidbits:

  • Paying a local artist to design our album art - $250 over goal
  • Hiring a cello player to add parts to the album - $500 over goal
  • 12" Vinyl Pressing of Album -$1500 over goal

How You Can Help

The first way that you can help us is by giving us your money (duh), but actually you aren't just giving it away! By selecting any one of the products on the side, you will get a copy of the album once we have completed it (estimated February 2018). Consider it an investment in the future pleasure of your eardrums. 

Second, you can come to our fundraising show on October 20th at Waldo's and Company in Gettysburg. 

Third, you can share this project with as many people as you possibly can - social media, door-to-door, yelling at people out of your car window - these are all great ways to get the word out. 

We are sincerely grateful to you for your support and we would love for you to get involved with this project. Thank you!!

story:
ABOUT PHOENIX RISING ...

"Mystical, lyrical, dramatic at times and always thoughtful and emotionally compelling, the dual musical vision of composer Wendy Loomis (piano) and arranger Monica Williams (flute) drives a deep sense of transcendence and spirituality that can only be captured in metaphoric terms." ~Iguhuaran, MusicZeitgeist.com

Their last release of ‘Mystic Places’ in 2013 was a successful release receiving two nominations from the Hollywood Music and Media Awards. In addition, it can still be heard on hundreds of analog, satellite and cable radio stations nationally and internationally. 

CD CAMPAIGN PROJECT ...

‘Emerging Slowly’ is a CD that will combine acoustic piano, synthesizers, traditional and world flutes.  The CD will once again cross the genres of new age, classical, jazz, and world music making it universally appealing to many tasted.  The concept of this CD focuses on the mythological symbol of our namesake - the phoenix bird -  dying and regenerating itself over and over. Despite challenges and difficulties of this life, the phoenix always rises again … sometimes quickly and dramatically and sometimes emerging slowly.

This next CD will cost $8,500 for recording, mixing, manufacturing, and promotion.. We appreciate all levels of contribution and would love your support!

Breakdown on costs for 'Emerging Slowly':

$300 Artwork for CD

$300 Graphic design for CD 

$1,600 Recording of CD (20 hours @ $80 an hour)

$2,000 Mixing and  mastering

$3,000 Distribution and promotion

$1300 Manufacturing of 1000 CDs

Total $8,500

DETAILS ON PERKS ...

There are many unique perks for this campaign including a variety of Native American Flutes, Luxurious Flute Bags, Private Lessons, Workshops, CD packages, and House Concerts. The beauty of the Native American Flute is that anyone can play!  A sound is produced by blowing into the end (no embouchure needed).  It is based on a pentatonic scale, so any combination of notes creates a lovely sound!  These flutes are great additions for wind players who want to widen their color palates and they are equally great for folks who have never played a musical instrument before. All flutes are made by a high-quality Native American flute maker.

All purchases of flutes will include a workshop. This will be a one-and-a-half hour class where you will learn how to play the Native American Flute. Specific skills taught include how to use air support for great tone, vibrato to help vary it, articulation variations, different scales,  basic improvisation, and rhythmic patterns to play with drums. The workshops will conclude with a performance with Phoenix Rising. Workshops will take place in Walnut Creek and in San Francisco. Dates and times TBA. If you are not in the Bay Area, we will include a 20-minute Skype lesson with every flute purchase. 

All products (except the Emerging Slowly CD) will be delivered before the Holiday Season 2015 … excellent gift choices!  And by contributing to the campaign you are giving us at the wonderful present of being able to continue sharing our creations.  

Many of these flutes has been demonstrated in the video. If you would like to quickly hear a specific flute, the specific times are listed below.  We are happy to answer any question on these flutes, so please feel free to contact us. If you are in the Bay Area, we would be happy to let you try them so you can find the best fit!

Timings of demonstrations on video

3:48 General info about Native American Flutes

5:16 Pocket Flute in g minor

5:53 Sparrow Hawk flute in a minor

6:43 Double Sparrow Hawk flute in a

7:28 Golden Eagle flute in f #

7:47 Condor Bass Flute in e

8:20 Contra Bass Flute in a 

8:57 Spirt Flute- Egyptian

9:26 Spirit Flute- Japanese

10:07 Visual of Fluterscooter Bag

10:41 Native American Drums 

Giving Back.....

As educators both Wendy and Monica give extra time and energy to all students to make sure their musical journeys are positive. As performers they often play charities and events for little or no pay. Now is your chance to help them attain their goal of bringing 'Emerging Slowly' to life! This is the best present you could ever give!

If you cannot contribute financially at this time, you can still help.  Please spread the word about the campaign via IndieGogo's convenient share tools. 

Thank you!
story_txt: ABOUT PHOENIX RISING ..."Mystical, lyrical, dramatic at times and always thoughtful and emotionally compelling, the dual musical vision of composer Wendy Loomis (piano) and arranger Monica Williams (flute) drives a deep sense of transcendence and spirituality that can only be captured in metaphoric terms." ~Iguhuaran, MusicZeitgeist.comTheir last release of ‘Mystic Places’ in 2013 was a successful release receiving two nominations from the Hollywood Music and Media Awards. In addition, it can still be heard on hundreds of analog, satellite and cable radio stations nationally and internationally. CD CAMPAIGN PROJECT ...‘Emerging Slowly’ is a CD that will combine acoustic piano, synthesizers, traditional and world flutes.  The CD will once again cross the genres of new age, classical, jazz, and world music making it universally appealing to many tasted.  The concept of this CD focuses on the mythological symbol of our namesake - the phoenix bird -  dying and regenerating itself over and over. Despite challenges and difficulties of this life, the phoenix always rises again … sometimes quickly and dramatically and sometimes emerging slowly.This next CD will cost $8,500 for recording, mixing, manufacturing, and promotion.. We appreciate all levels of contribution and would love your support!Breakdown on costs for 'Emerging Slowly':$300 Artwork for CD$300 Graphic design for CD $1,600 Recording of CD (20 hours @ $80 an hour)$2,000 Mixing and  mastering$3,000 Distribution and promotion$1300 Manufacturing of 1000 CDsTotal $8,500DETAILS ON PERKS ...There are many unique perks for this campaign including a variety of Native American Flutes, Luxurious Flute Bags, Private Lessons, Workshops, CD packages, and House Concerts. The beauty of the Native American Flute is that anyone can play!  A sound is produced by blowing into the end (no embouchure needed).  It is based on a pentatonic scale, so any combination of notes creates a lovely sound!  These flutes are great additions for wind players who want to widen their color palates and they are equally great for folks who have never played a musical instrument before. All flutes are made by a high-quality Native American flute maker.All purchases of flutes will include a workshop. This will be a one-and-a-half hour class where you will learn how to play the Native American Flute. Specific skills taught include how to use air support for great tone, vibrato to help vary it, articulation variations, different scales,  basic improvisation, and rhythmic patterns to play with drums. The workshops will conclude with a performance with Phoenix Rising. Workshops will take place in Walnut Creek and in San Francisco. Dates and times TBA. If you are not in the Bay Area, we will include a 20-minute Skype lesson with every flute purchase. All products (except the Emerging Slowly CD) will be delivered before the Holiday Season 2015 … excellent gift choices!  And by contributing to the campaign you are giving us at the wonderful present of being able to continue sharing our creations.  Many of these flutes has been demonstrated in the video. If you would like to quickly hear a specific flute, the specific times are listed below.  We are happy to answer any question on these flutes, so please feel free to contact us. If you are in the Bay Area, we would be happy to let you try them so you can find the best fit!Timings of demonstrations on video3:48 General info about Native American Flutes5:16 Pocket Flute in g minor5:53 Sparrow Hawk flute in a minor6:43 Double Sparrow Hawk flute in a7:28 Golden Eagle flute in f #7:47 Condor Bass Flute in e8:20 Contra Bass Flute in a 8:57 Spirt Flute- Egyptian9:26 Spirit Flute- Japanese10:07 Visual of Fluterscooter Bag10:41 Native American Drums Giving Back.....As educators both Wendy and Monica give extra time and energy to all students to make sure their musical journeys are positive. As performers they often play charities and events for little or no pay. Now is your chance to help them attain their goal of bringing 'Emerging Slowly' to life! This is the best present you could ever give!If you cannot contribute financially at this time, you can still help.  Please spread the word about the campaign via IndieGogo's convenient share tools. Thank you!

story:
We’ve started our own concert promotions company but we aren’t your typical promoters.  We’re vivacious, energetic, confident, courageous and organized WOMEN!  We’ve decided to crawl into the Belly of the Beast and try our hands at bringing LIVE music back into the Roanoke Valley, like it should be.  Never heard of Roanoke Rapids, NC – Google It!  However, if you know anything about this area, you know the reputation it carries.  There’s been an amphitheater that didn’t succeed, a theatre that’s currently struggling, and tons of land that would be a developers dream, but it’s not going anywhere.  With your contribution, whether it’s a donation or a share, you will be helping us two mom’s blow up our dream business on top of breathing life back into our community.  You will also be helping us accomplish goals that aren’t typically completed by two women in a profession that men dominate.

We are ideally located off I-95 so convenience is on our side.  And every BarnBurner event will be based on items and services that are convenient to our ticket buyers.  Let’s start with purchasing tickets.  Customers will have the opportunity to purchase different levels of BarnBurner Memberships at very reasonable, annual prices which will offer perks like the option to buy tickets before they officially go on sale, Meet-n-Greet access, VIP bundles and reserved parking.  However, you don’t have to be a member in order to receive special offers and discounts.  We’re providing early bird ticket specials as well as 10 or more ticket bundle discounts to our regular ticket buyers. 

What's the most aggravating thing about a concert?  Concession lines!!  Our shows will be equipped with the latest technology such as credit card scanners that provide quick processing to cut down on time wasted standing in concession lines and ticket barcode scanners so our customers aren’t stuck at the door while usher’s view every ticket that’s been bought.  We’ve also came up with a system so that people spend more time enjoying the show than waiting for a beer.  There will also be waitresses to make the process a little smoother so you’re able to hold your table instead of recruiting others to hold it for you.  Yes, it requires a couple of extra employees that aren’t usually needed but it’s our mission to cater to our customers.

Whether we’re throwing a concert at a theatre or in a cotton field, you will receive the same experience you would if you were attending a well known amphitheater.  When you attend a BarnBurner event, you’ll be entertained from the time you walk through the doors until the time you exit the parking lot.  At EVERY show, there will be vendor booths so you can browse merchandise not related to the concert, acoustic artists performing in the lobby for pre-show entertainment, food trucks so you can grab a bite to eat and much, much more.  BarnBurner means an exciting event and that’s what we’re producing.

I know, I know!!  You're probably thinking, "What experience do these chicks actually have?".  Well, we met about 5 years ago when we worked a beer booth at Carolina Crossroads amphitheater.  2 years later, we both started working with the Royal Palace Theatre (which was actually the Roanoke Rapids Theatre but under different management).  Julie handled the Palace's advertising and marketing for a while before she left and took on greater opportunities for a couple of local business men running and managing several of their stores.  She manages several stores in several locations and runs their social media and advertising.  Allison worked at the Palace as their Production and Stage Manager.  She handled several tasks from the artist's backstage requirements to organizing the entire show.  Although the Palace shut down, she still dabbles in production management with a company out of Virginia while working in the Land Condemnation division at an attorney's office.

We have several contacts in our small town, as well as other contacts in different areas, and know the right people to get the job done.  Now you're thinking, "Then why do you need help from us?".  Well, although we have the contacts, moral support, experience and know how .. we don't have pockets that deep.  We'd love nothing more than to pull this off with our own cash that we were responsible for raising.  Which leads us to our next point ...

What We Need From You

There are a lot of people who do not understand the entire process of throwing a concert and how much work and costs are included.  Most of you probably think the most difficult part is booking a band and lining up the dates they’re available with the dates the venue is available.  Wrong!!  A decent sized concert costs $30,000-$50,000, on average.  And some of those costs that go un-noticed are advertisements like flyers, posters, radio and TV ads, catering and Green Room requirements for the bands when they’re backstage, employee salaries, purchasing your ticket sales website and many other small tasks that tend to add up.  Sometimes, you have to buy items to stock the artist’s buses if they’re on tour because they can’t stop at WalMart to pick those things up due to their strict schedule. 

As a promoter, you’re number one goal is to sell a show out and you have to go to great lengths in order to accomplish that.  If you’ve signed up to promote a show and you don’t take the time to do these small, but very important tasks, why promote at all?  That’s one major mistake we’ve witnessed other promoters make in this town.  If you’re not going to promote to the best of your ability, you’re doing yourself, the artist and most importantly, your business, a huge disservice.  We didn’t create this business to bullshit, we created this business to promote and prove to others that IT CAN BE DONE in a small town.

We’re asking for a total of $100,000.  That gives us enough money to book, promote and produce at least two concerts.  It also gives us a little extra cash to experiment with things like advertising in additional areas to figure out which communities purchase more tickets and for what type of shows so that we can lay out a successful plan for our future endeavors.  And we’re not just laying out a plan for ourselves; we’re going to help other promoters as well.

When you Google concert statistics in Roanoke Rapids, NC, you come up with nothing.  You can't even find statistics in surrounding areas.  So we’re going to change that.  Not only will our business put this area on the map, we’re in the process of creating a website just for promoters so they’ll be able to easily organize shows once they’re booked.  This website will include specific venue and production company info as well as calendars with notifications to keep them on track.  Don’t let this throw you off because in order to start a website, it costs around $60 a month.  We don’t have a lot of cash to throw into this thing but we’re going to slowly build it up.  Once we get our first two shows under our belt, we will be able to stand on our own two feet.  We’re two girls packed full of a million ideas.  We just don’t have the funds to act on them, at the moment.

If you’re interested in investing or just curious, shoot us an e-mail and we’ll be happy to send you a detailed list of charges and costs.  We’ll also include some of the quotes we’ve received along the way and explain our plan further.  We have nothing to hide.

In 2014, LiveNation made a whopping 4.73 BILLION DOLLARS in concert revenue.  Out of those Billions of dollars, $1,557,250 was earned in ticketing revenue.  Talk about goals!!  Are we insane for trying to pursue something that big?  Probably so!  But what type of business owner are you if you don’t set extreme goals?  We’re starting in our hometown to help revive this place but we’re not stopping there.  We’re going to excel in areas other female promoters haven’t and expand in no time.  We’re determined and it will happen, no matter what.

We completely understand that not everyone can make a donation and that’s cool.  However, if you think our campaign sounds legit and we’ve sparked your interest, please share it with EVERYONE you know.  Give us a shout out on Facebook.  Screenshot our campaign page and post it on Instagram.  Retweet us on Twitter.  Hell, tell the next bill collector that calls to look us up.  SHOW US SOME LOVE.  You can easily access the Indiegogo share tools and voila, we’ve received one more contribution because you were so awesome and supportive. 

Also, if you happen to be a seriously famous artist like Chris Brown, Garth Brooks, Justin Timberlake or Kandi Burruss and would be up for performing at a BarnBurner event for FREE so we can rake in the cash and give you a cut, do not hesitate to contact us ASAP.

Be sure to check out our perks before you make a contribution.  We’d hate for you to miss out on some sweet deals.  If you choose a perk with a t-shirt, don’t forget to send us your tee size and address.  The Discount Cups DO NOT include alcohol sales.  In order to receive your discount cup, send us an email so that we can forward you a ticket voucher.  Bring the ticket to your first BarnBurner event in order to redeem it.  The tickets do not expire so don’t worry if we book an artist you’re not interested in.  You’ll have plenty of opportunities in the future.  All emails for t-shirts and cups can be sent to info@barnburnerprmotions.com. 

We sincerely appreciate everyone who contributes, shares, mentions or even takes time out of their schedules to check out our campaign.  This won’t be possible without a little support of others.  If you have questions or ideas, or you just want to tell us how awesome we are, shoot us an email and we’ll respond ASAP.  Thanks again and we hope to see you at a BarnBurner event SOON!!

With tons of Love,
Allison & Julie

story:
What’s The Story?

Sugarplum Studio is the sugar baby of South Jersey pastry chef Sharon O’Connor Spatucci. Sharon has spent the past fifteen years covered in flour and sugar and is rarely seen without clogs on her feet, food dye on her hands, and her hair in a bun. She has lovingly spent countless hours transforming simple ingredients into edible masterpieces to the delight of her family, friends, and anyone else who’s tasted her works of art.

Although working professionally as a pastry chef has been great over the years, it doesn’t quite match the joy Sharon experiences when she is able to see her own creations through other people’s eyes. Hearing a child exclaim, “I love it!” or a bride express “The cake was exactly as I envisioned!” provides happiness that only a pastry chef would understand. 

Cake decorating has become an attainable hobby for the home baker, so Sharon is often asked for advice and assistance. One of the best ways Sharon has been able to expand upon her career skills is through teaching. She has conducted many workshops, parties, and private instruction sessions – from basic decorating for cakes and cookies, to building gingerbread houses, to more advanced techniques using rolled fondant and gum paste. Cake decorating can be a daunting activity for beginners to take on, but Sharon has always reassured her students that their skills will come with practice. Yet when it comes to the creative element, she teaches that there is no right or wrong in art – even when the medium is buttercream.

With that in mind, Sharon has dreamed of a place where both children and adults could go to learn and have fun. The idea of Sugarplum Studio was born.


What is Sugarplum Studio?

Sugarplum Studio will be an edible art studio where both children and adults can visit to custom decorate cakes, cupcakes, and cookies and express their creativity in edible form. You’ve seen “paint your own pottery” and “create your own canvas” – why not “decorate your own cake”?  Sugarplum Studio will provide all of the materials, tools, and step-by-step instructions from professional pastry chefs. You bring your creativity, take home your masterpiece, and leave the mess behind!

The Studio will be able to host parties, play dates, ladies nights out, scout troops, class trips – any occasion where a fun activity is in order. 

No party, no problem! The Studio will have Open Studio hours where you can come in and complete a themed, self-guided, edible decorating project. It’s the perfect diversion for kids, bored teenagers, or moms who just need to get out of the house for an hour. Plus, you get to eat your art!

Additionally, Sugarplum Studio will offer the custom-designed cakes, cookies, cupcakes, and desserts that Sharon has become known for. The facility will also have a pastry case where delicious gourmet cakes and desserts will be available for purchase.


Where do you come in?

Well, if Sharon had a dollar for every single time someone told her that she should have her own place to do this, there would be absolutely no need for a crowdfunding campaign! But unfortunately, New Jersey does not have a Cottage Food Law, so a studio like this requires a commercial kitchen to even get started. Commercial kitchens require lots of equipment, lots of insurance, and lots of expenses. For a pastry chef who just wants to spread a little sugar love, that’s a lot to take on. A little help from you would bring Sugarplum Studio to life.

Sharon has incorporated as an LLC, found the perfect space for the studio, and is working to raise the dough to make this happen. For the majority of the expenses, Sharon will secure a small business loan. Since it can be difficult for startups to borrow funding capital when they have no equity (especially in the food service industry), Sharon needs to raise some capital to get in the door first. Every single dollar of your donation will go toward getting Sugarplum Studio started with licenses, permits, inspections, signage, equipment, and additional expenses. 


How much money are we talking about?

Sharon is estimating that she'll need $65,000 to open Sugarplum Studio. This includes leasing the space, completing renovations to get it up to health department codes, purchasing a commercial mixer, commercial oven, and additional equipment necessary to get started. Food service operations are all or nothing propositions and she can't open without being fully funded. Most SBA micro loans will lend up to $50,000 and require some kind of collateral. By raising $25,000, Sharon will be in a position to secure other financing options beyond the SBA. 


What’s in it for you?

Okay, Sharon understands that sometimes “thank you” doesn’t quite suffice. With that in mind, Sugarplum Studio is offering various incentives for different levels of contribution. Check them out on the right!


How else can you help?

Can't help financially? That's ok, I understand!  Your support is still important to me. Spread the word, share the campaign and help me make Sugarplum Studio a reality!

Spread the word, share the campaign and help me make Sugarplum Studio a reality!

story:
The Palestine Youth Orchestra (PYO) and 2015 tour in France

The Palestine Youth Orchestra (PYO) was created in 2004 by the Edward Said National Conservatory of Music (ESNCM) with the vision of bringing together 80 young Palestinian musicians aged 13 to 26, from around the world in a high-quality orchestral ensemble.  The PYO aims to foster and strengthen the rich cultural and artistic diversity of the Palestinian people, whether living in Palestine or in the Diaspora, and to promote the recognition and to enhance the awareness of that diversity both at national and international level. Over the past 10 years, the PYO performed in Palestine, Germany, Jordan, Syria, Bahrain, Lebanon, Greece and Italy.  

The exchange programs and partnerships which the ESNCM has established with institutions in other countries, allow a number of young foreign musicians to join the tours of the Orchestra. Sharing their respective cultural richness often leads to long-lasting friendships amongst members of the orchestra. Such was the case in the 2012 PYO tour of Italy which saw the participation of 20 musicians from the conservatoires of Rome and Genoa. 



The 2015 tour in France will take place between the 16th - 30th of August and will see a close cooperation with conservatoires in Aix-en-Provence, Lyon, Aubervilliers - La Courneuve and Toulouse. During a one-week residency at the Grand Théâtre de Provence, the PYO will be in Aix-en-Provence alongside the Orchestre Français des Jeunes (OFJ – French Youth Orchestra).

The campaign: Where does your donation go? 

The total costs of the PYO 2014 tour in France will be over $250,000 to cover travel and accommodation expenses of 90 youth members and 20 teachers and conductors along with promotion and advertisement costs. ESNCM already counted the sponsorship and cooperation of local and international institutions, as well as private and individual donations, such as A. M. Qattan Foundation, SIDA, and Bank of Palestine.

This campaign comes from the urgent need to support the travel costs of 8 Palestinian musicians residing in Palestine and Egypt, who are eager to partake in this exciting journey. Your donation will be distributed as below: 

Name                        

Instrument    

Age    

Location

23

Beit Rima, Palestine

$ 860

Naseem H.

Violin

18

Beit Rima, Palestine

$ 860

Total

$5,000

What if we raise more or less money?
- If we recieve more than the $5000 pledged, we will use the funds to support additional members costs of the PYO 2015 tour in France. If double the amount pledged is raised, the funds will also support additional ESNCM activities, such as summer camps, other orchestras, and festivals.
- If we don't reach the overall pledged amount, the funds will still contribute to the costs of the members of PYO and the 2015 tour in France. 

Outcomes of the PYO 2015 in France

-  The participation of 80 young talented musicians: 65 Palestinian musicians from Palestine and the Diaspora and 15 from French conservatoires or youth orchestras, and two soloists.

-  The participation of an international artistic and educational team including a conductor, orchestral coaches from France, Norway and the UK.

-  An 8-day rehearsal residency for the PYO members and the artistic/educational team

-  A tour comprising three concerts (Aix-en-Provence, Paris and Lyon).

-  At least 40 media items released in radios, newspapers and satellite stations locally, regionally and internationally focusing on the main actors, donors and supporters.

-  The attendance of over 3,000 people for the concerts.

-  The establishment of new partnerships towards supporting the ESNCM’s orchestral and educational programs.
