story:
We Did A Thing! 

We've nearly finished off our latest EP, and it's been a really fun process! This is my 5th release, but it's the first time I've worked with a producer.  It's also the first time I've taken things a little bit slower in the studio and relaxed into the process.  

In the past I've generally rushed through recordings in a constantly panicked state, watching the clock tick while my internal dialogue gets dominated by arithmetic as I calculate how much money the last drum take just cost me.  (It always costs more than a drum machine would've {shakes fist at drummer})  I've never really enjoyed recording in the past, at least not in the same way I enjoy playing gigs.

Needless to say that this time around, as a result of taking our time and having a producer offer an extra set of ears and help steer the ship, we've been pulling much better sounds, making some magical moments, and having a lot of fun too!

I'm really very proud of what we've created so far, and I can't wait to shoot some clips, and hit the road to get it out to all of you.

The downside of this more relaxed approach and working with a producer is that the bills rack up, oh how they rack up! (2nd cocaine joke of the campaign.)


You Give Me Money - I Give You Stuff:

I've chipped in all the change I could find, but I'm still short around $3500 to finish off the mixing/mastering process and to print up a few discs and then have a wild 80's themed cocaine party.

Cocaine jokes aside (which I don't use and I'm really not sure why it's featuring so much in this campaign), it'd be incredibly helpful if you could pre-order the EP, or if you can, go a step further and buy all of my other CD's.  

If you want to, you can get me (and the band if you're rich) to play at your next house party/house concert/office party/office concert/birthday party/bar mitzvah/satanic coven/Dungeons and Dragons meeting/P & C meeting/weird furry orgy/company board meeting, or any other event that you think could be made more interesting with live music.  I'll work with you to make a date that fits into both our schedules and costs you the least amount of travel expenses.

On top of pre-orders, CD's and house concerts, I'm also offering up my baby as a sacrifice to the new EP.  If you're cashed up to the eyeballs you can take over ownership of my Seagull Grand (pictured below) that I've had for the last 10 years.  It's been a workhorse, I've played over 1000 gigs with it,  it's full of holes,  and it's a bit of a Frankenstein of electronics.  I bought it in Melbourne before I started playing music professionally, it's been all over Australia, and it's still such a great sounding guitar that it features on one of the tracks on this EP, the very EP that it's sale could save...that's karma (or something) for you.  Seriously though, I'll be sad to see this guitar go.  It's got three outputs, so you can run it's under saddle pick up, the P90 at the neck, and the bug pick up on the body all simultaneously through 3 channels to mix a really full live sound.  It's a pleasure to play, and I know it'll bring many more years of pleasure to whoever picks it up.

Instead of just accepting your blind charity, I'd much prefer that you got something worthwhile for your hard earned cash, so if you have a few extra bucks that you want to send my way but none of the rewards here are of any use to you, just get in touch and I'll gladly sort something out with you.  I'm open to (but not limited to) offering:

- A super awkward dinner with the band.

- A pointless 'Working B' where for a ridiculously exorbitant fee you can hire the band to do yard work or other manual labour that we're not qualified to do and are generally hopeless at.

- A 'meet and greet' ego trip for us where you can hang out with the band on tour and find out how bad our socks smell, how much we secretly resent each other, and how pathetic our rock star dreams are.


But I'm Broke Too, How Else Can I Help?

Share this campaign with your friends, enemy's, frenemys, whoever else on social media and the like, and then come to a gig next time we're around and well give you sweaty post gig hugs and other unwanted sweaty bodily contact (sweaty hand shakes, sweaty beard shakes, sweaty milkshakes etc) as a way of saying thanks!


Here's a few shots of the 'Steven Seagull' guitar ($1500):



Here's a before and after shot of the 'Golden Toast' ($3500):

story:
Hey Y'all, It's the Stone Tucky Rebel!!!                  Happy Independence Day!

The Devil told me that I need to go to Nashville, TN  and record the first part of The 7 Seals of the Stone. You may be asking,  "What the heck is that!?!" or "Why are you talking to the Devil?"  Well let me tell you...
You see, back in the day, music was not a way to be paid. Music was a vehicle to pass on knowledge. The best thing you could do to remember words until the end of time was to add a beat and make them rhyme. So naturally, the Devil would be after it, and he has since the beginning of time. Now the reason the Devil is talking to me? Unfortunately, he's my boss now. Oh yeah, I sold my soul to save Music, and the rest of the World. I tried to save our country, but the Devil said it was too late now. 
The best way to describe the 7 Seals... was if Star Wars and The Matrix walked into a Honky Tonk bar, this would be the first of seven stories. Why would they walk into a Honky Tonk bar? TO SAVE MUSIC, MAN! Then they go to a Rock concert, and finally finish off the night in a Hip Hop club. 
Oh, and the next day the 4th World War starts. This triggers a massive awakening of spirituality on the planet, and the world is saved only through music.  The next thing that happens is something that I saw in my dreams.  Aliens come down for their planned 6,000 year visit to check on their experiment...humans. When they find us in such a disastrous state, they decide to eliminate us all. However, after some tough musical negotiations by myself and some friendly extraterrestrials, they decide to let (some)humans live...on several conditions. I'll tell you about that later.
"What about the 7th Seal?" Well...it's called the Lost Mind of Nicola Tesla and y'all will be hearing, seeing, and feeling it soon. 
I need $1776(at least) to be able to rent Blackbird Studios for a day so that I can record the 1st 4 of the 7 Seals with live musicians. $1500 for the Studio and $25/hr for the engineer. However, my musicians are scared to death to say no to working for the Devil, so right now, they are working for free, so any extra help that you could give us would be great!

story:
Short Summary/Nuestra Historia

  • The Youth Symphonic Band of the National Institute of Music is one of the higest level ensembles, with 50 young students age 18-25. Each of them studying winds or percussion instruments as their major.My name is Gabriela Mora, I am Artistic Director and Conductor of the Costa Rican Youth Symphonic Band.The members of the Band and I,  want to bring important worldwide soloists to perform with us and give us Master Classes. We want to learn from the bests! La Banda Sinfónica Juvenil es uno de los ensambles más avanzados del Instituto Nacional de Música de Costa Rica.La BSJ está conformada por 50 jóvenes músicos cursando la carrera de música con énfasis en algún instrumento de viento o percusión.Mi nombre es Gabriela Mora, soy la Directora de la Banda Sinfonica Juvenil.Los miembros de la banda y yo hemos decidido lanzar esta campaña para traer importantes solistas internacionales a tocar junto a nosotros y a darnos una clase maestra. Queremos aprender de los mejores! 
  • Our Institute has very limited resources, but our passion for music and will to learn from them make us search for other options to make it happen. Nuestro Instituto cuenta con recursos muy limitados, pero nuestra pasión por la música y el aprendizaje que recibamos de ellos nos impulsa a buscar otras alternativas.
  • Our first guest is Toby Oft, First Trombone at the Boston Symphony Orchestra (BSO)  and faculty at the New England Conservatory and Boston University in USA. Nuestro primer invitado es Toby Oft, trombonista principal de la Orquesta Sinfónica de Boston, y docente en el Conservatorio de New England y la Universidad de Boston en Estados Unidos.


    What we Need & What you get/Lo que necesitamos y usted podria obtener.r

  • We need the funding to cover the expenses of our first guest in our country: transportation, room and board, and theater rental. Aun necesitamos los fondos necesarios para cubrir el costo del teatro para el concierto, con lo que ya tenemos aun necesitamos/ with what we raise until now we still need: $700 Theater Rental, $600 Transportation,room and board for our guest,
  • We can offer courtesy tickets to our concert with Toby and, for those interested in the masterclass, tickets as auditors. Podemos ofrecer entradas al concierto que daremos juntos y, para aquellos que quieran asistir a la clase maestra, entradas especiales como oyentes.
  • If you are a representative of a company, we can include your logo in our concert program of June 12. Si usted representa a alguna empresa, podemos poner el logo de la misma en los programas de mano de la Banda Sinfónica del 12 junio 2015, como patrocinador nuestro. 
  • You can get a seats reserved  for our concert in June 12, 2015 at the Eugene O´Neill Theater in San Jose.De la misma manera, podrá obtener asientos reservados para nuestro concierto el 12 de Junio en el Teatro Eugene O´Neill en San Jose.
  • Soon we will post our next perks: exclusive coffee mugs and tshirts with our campaign logo. Be the only one into having these with you either as a souvenir or for your daily routine! Próximamente estaremos añadiendo exclusivos agradecimientos a nuestros patrocinadores : tazas para café y camisetas con diseños exclusivos de nuestra campaña!
  • Even if we do not reach our goal, all funds will go to our school, to buy new music for our band and to make this kind of activities possible.Aún si no lograramos alcanzar la meta, no nos daremos por vencidos! Los fondos recaudados se usarán para seguir con este tipo de actividadesl
  • a banda.

     The Impact/El impacto

  • We need to see the real world and have contact with the best players there are. Since we cannot go to them, we decided to bring them to us! Toby is a worldwide renowned teacher and musician. We want to see him playing and teaching! With your donation you will be contributing to make a better generation of musicians in our country. We want to become the best professionals we can be! Necesitamos ver el mundo real y tener contacto con los mejores músicos que hay. Como no podemos ir a ellos, decidimos traerlos a nosotros. Toby es un importante trombonista y profesor de fama mundial, queremos verlo tocar su instrumento y enseñarnos! Con su donación usted contribuirá a crear una mejor generación de músicos en nuestro país. Queremos convertirnos en los mejores profesionales que podamos ser!
  • We are 50 young players, we cannot go to him to play with and learn from him, not even see him in action with BSO, so let´s bring Toby Oft to Costa Rica! Somos 50 jóvenes músicos, no podemos ir a ella para tocar juntos y aprender,o verlo tocar en la Sinfónica de Boston. así que, traigámoslo! .

     Risks & Challenges/Riesgos y Retos

  • We will make all possible efforts to make this happen. Since Toby is a very busy artist, we had to schedule him in advance, even without having all financial issues covered. That is why we are in need of your help. Haremos todos los esfuerzos posibles para que ésto suceda. Toby es un artista muy importante y ocupado, por lo que tuvimos que adelantarnos y firmar con el su venida, aún sin tener todos los asuntos financieros cubiertos. Por eso necesitamos SU AYUDA!!!!
  • We already sign with him to come to give us a master class and play with us, June 12 is our concert in Theater Eugene O'Neil in San Jose. That much we want him to come! Nuestro concierto sera el viernes 12 de Junio en el Teatro Eugene O'Neil en el Centro Cultural Costarricense Norteamericano, en San Jose, Cota Rica. Realmente queremos que venga!!!. 


    • Other Ways You Can Help/Otras formas de ayudar

    Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help. Muchas personas no podran contribuir pero eso no significa que no os puedan ayudar.

    • Please, if you cannot contribute with your financial donation, make some noise about our campaign in your social networks! Por favor si usted no nos puede ayudar con una donación, ayúdenos a expander esta campaña en su red social.
    • Please use facebook, twitter, or any other net to share this info. Por favor comparta esta campaña por facebook, twitter u otra red social.
    • Some of you may not have the money to help us, but we are sure that either you know someone who can, or you can help in many other ways. What about some prizes/products that we can offer to our sponsors as rewards for their contribution or, can you help with the room or board for our guest? Are you a restaurant, hotel manager? There are hundreds of ways you can help us!! Algunos de ustedes no podrán ayudarnos economicamente pero seguro que conocen a alguien que sí, o quizá usted nos puede ayudar de otra forma. Qué tal si nos ayuda con premios que podamos ofrecer a nuestros patrocinadores por su ayuda, o puede usted ayudarnos con el alojamiento o la alimentación de nuestro invitado? Administra usted un restaurante u hotel donde podamos hospedar u ofrecerle alimentacion? Póngase en contacto con nosotros, hay mil formas de ayudar!

Our first guest is Toby Oft, First Trombone at the Boston Symphony Orchestra (BSO)  and faculty at the New England Conservatory and Boston University in USA. Nuestro primer invitado es Toby Oft, trombonista principal de la Orquesta Sinfónica de Boston, y docente en el Conservatorio de New England y la Universidad de Boston en Estados Unidos.
What we Need & What you get/Lo que necesitamos y usted podria obtener.r




We need the funding to cover the expenses of our first guest in our country: transportation, room and board, and theater rental. Aun necesitamos los fondos necesarios para cubrir el costo del teatro para el concierto, con lo que ya tenemos aun necesitamos/ with what we raise until now we still need: $700 Theater Rental, $600 Transportation,room and board for our guest,

We can offer courtesy tickets to our concert with Toby and, for those interested in the masterclass, tickets as auditors. Podemos ofrecer entradas al concierto que daremos juntos y, para aquellos que quieran asistir a la clase maestra, entradas especiales como oyentes.
If you are a representative of a company, we can include your logo in our concert program of June 12. Si usted representa a alguna empresa, podemos poner el logo de la misma en los programas de mano de la Banda Sinfónica del 12 junio 2015, como patrocinador nuestro. 
You can get a seats reserved  for our concert in June 12, 2015 at the Eugene O´Neill Theater in San Jose.De la misma manera, podrá obtener asientos reservados para nuestro concierto el 12 de Junio en el Teatro Eugene O´Neill en San Jose.
Soon we will post our next perks: exclusive coffee mugs and tshirts with our campaign logo. Be the only one into having these with you either as a souvenir or for your daily routine! Próximamente estaremos añadiendo exclusivos agradecimientos a nuestros patrocinadores : tazas para café y camisetas con diseños exclusivos de nuestra campaña!
Even if we do not reach our goal, all funds will go to our school, to buy new music for our band and to make this kind of activities possible.Aún si no lograramos alcanzar la meta, no nos daremos por vencidos! Los fondos recaudados se usarán para seguir con este tipo de actividadesl
a banda.
     The Impact/El impacto
We need to see the real world and have contact with the best players there are. Since we cannot go to them, we decided to bring them to us! Toby is a worldwide renowned teacher and musician. We want to see him playing and teaching! With your donation you will be contributing to make a better generation of musicians in our country. We want to become the best professionals we can be! Necesitamos ver el mundo real y tener contacto con los mejores músicos que hay. Como no podemos ir a ellos, decidimos traerlos a nosotros. Toby es un importante trombonista y profesor de fama mundial, queremos verlo tocar su instrumento y enseñarnos! Con su donación usted contribuirá a crear una mejor generación de músicos en nuestro país. Queremos convertirnos en los mejores profesionales que podamos ser!
We are 50 young players, we cannot go to him to play with and learn from him, not even see him in action with BSO, so let´s bring Toby Oft to Costa Rica! Somos 50 jóvenes músicos, no podemos ir a ella para tocar juntos y aprender,o verlo tocar en la Sinfónica de Boston. así que, traigámoslo! .
     Risks & Challenges/Riesgos y Retos
We will make all possible efforts to make this happen. Since Toby is a very busy artist, we had to schedule him in advance, even without having all financial issues covered. That is why we are in need of your help. Haremos todos los esfuerzos posibles para que ésto suceda. Toby es un artista muy importante y ocupado, por lo que tuvimos que adelantarnos y firmar con el su venida, aún sin tener todos los asuntos financieros cubiertos. Por eso necesitamos SU AYUDA!!!!
We already sign with him to come to give us a master class and play with us, June 12 is our concert in Theater Eugene O'Neil in San Jose. That much we want him to come! Nuestro concierto sera el viernes 12 de Junio en el Teatro Eugene O'Neil en el Centro Cultural Costarricense Norteamericano, en San Jose, Cota Rica. Realmente queremos que venga!!!. 


Other Ways You Can Help/Otras formas de ayudarSome people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help. Muchas personas no podran contribuir pero eso no significa que no os puedan ayudar.
Please, if you cannot contribute with your financial donation, make some noise about our campaign in your social networks! Por favor si usted no nos puede ayudar con una donación, ayúdenos a expander esta campaña en su red social.
Please use facebook, twitter, or any other net to share this info. Por favor comparta esta campaña por facebook, twitter u otra red social.
Some of you may not have the money to help us, but we are sure that either you know someone who can, or you can help in many other ways. What about some prizes/products that we can offer to our sponsors as rewards for their contribution or, can you help with the room or board for our guest? Are you a restaurant, hotel manager? There are hundreds of ways you can help us!! Algunos de ustedes no podrán ayudarnos economicamente pero seguro que conocen a alguien que sí, o quizá usted nos puede ayudar de otra forma. Qué tal si nos ayuda con premios que podamos ofrecer a nuestros patrocinadores por su ayuda, o puede usted ayudarnos con el alojamiento o la alimentación de nuestro invitado? Administra usted un restaurante u hotel donde podamos hospedar u ofrecerle alimentacion? Póngase en contacto con nosotros, hay mil formas de ayudar!

story:
HI! We are Young Sullivan!

Our names are Brandon Young and Stephen Sullivan. We are a hard working, driven, and dedicated country music Duo out of the Heart of Dixie... Weaver, Alabama.


We have been pushing our brand and making a name for ourselves for the past 4 years. We have recently just this past year written and recorded enough songs to come out with an EP so we can spread the love of music to the far reaches of the globe. We have had some help along the way... but help is needed still.


We have already invested our funds into the final production. The Music is recorded, but it has not been mastered. And the costs associated with the production and studio have been more than we could have ever expected... and it has depleted a majority of our resources.

So... We are asking for your help!

You can be a part of reaching a dream that will propel us forward in ways just four short years ago seemed completely out of reach, simply by helping out wherever you can.

We Have a Plan...

We want to get our album into as many hands as possible so... we have a publicity team that is ready to take this on and get our music to the masses. All that's really left to do is get the promotional material (t-shirts, fliers, and other promotional items) and to actually press the CD's.

What We Need... What You Get!

Lets break it down for you...

We are looking to raise $2500.00. This is the bare minimum we need. If we don't make this goal, we will still go ahead with production of the CD's but will will have to hold off on distribution. 

In order to achieve this goal, we've designed a few "perks" that should be very appealing to you. :)

for instance... How would you like a nice Home-Cooked meal prepared by Brandon Young and Stephen Sullivan right in your own home? sound inciting! Oh yeah.

Check out the rest of the on the right of the screen -------------------------------------->

The goal funds will be used to help us purchase the CD's and all promotional material needed to really push this Album and give it exposure, and to producing the Best, Most high quality product we can deliver. We ALSO hope to have enough to make a Music Video of one of the songs on the album if there is enough!
Any funds that we receive over our original goal will go into making the release the best that we can, to get it the exposure that it deserves, and to making sure that we can give you the best experience possible.

The Impact you can make is unfathomable...

Every dollar that is raised is another dollar towards a dream that we have been working on for the past 4 years. There have been ups and downs. The has been heartache and job loss, sleeping in cars and spending the night on the road, broken strings, equipment purchases... you get the idea.

This is a chance for you to make as big a difference as we hope we will make with our music. We whole-heartedly believe in this and know we have the drive and the ability to get this out to everyone and accomplish great things! 


You will have had a hand in all of that!


Other Ways You Can Help


Just because you may be a starving musician like us, that doesn't mean you can't help. There are many other ways!

Please share this campaign with everyone you know. Tweet it on the Twittersphere! Facebook it to all your friends! If your a band friend with us, post it on your band page (cause we would do the same for you! That's a promise!)

Simply just being here for us in our time of need is helpful in so many ways!

Thank you in advance for your time, your hard earned dollars, your dedication and most of all, for your belief in us! It means the world to us that we have so many friends and family that are willing to invest into this band as much as we have!

THANK YOU!!!

-Brandon Young and Stephen Sullivan

Young Sullivan

Young Sullivan

story:
Silver Lining Songs (demos from the Recording Process)

Introduction

Hi! I'm Daniel Zeigler (My friends call me DZ).

This is my FIRST solo CD project, and just the beginning of many more to come. Music has always been a part of the fabric that I'm made of, and I'm finally at a place in my life where I can make it the primary and driving focus of my attention. 

The Project

I've written a really great grouping of songs, and connected with a Producer (Ren Renfree of 2-Bit Palomino) that really gets me musically. We're currently on a schedule of once per week getting together to flesh out the songs, and work on general music business stuff. 

I've just put together a great band called Red Moon. We're rehearsing like crazy and are getting ready to hit the road playing shows. We'll be local at first, and then we'll reach out regionally, nationally, and finally worldwide. This band is the touring part of my recording project. 

Become a Partner With Me

I'm really excited to invite you to become a member of the DZ team! Your partnership provides support for me during the recording process.  Lets face it, there are a lot of costs associated with recording a full length CD. Aside from production costs, you have to factor in manufacturing costs as well as promotional costs once the CD is finished. It can add up to quite a huge sum.

But, I'm not asking for handouts, or for you to bear the weight of this project. I am investing in myself in this as well, paying out quite a good part of the total cost from my own pocket. What your contribution will do is to help me make this the best CD that it can be... period.

Every level of partnership offers a reward of value. I want to make sure that you receive something memorable for helping me achieve my goals and dreams. Even at the lowest partnership level, you will receive a copy of the music when it is all finished. If you're the adventurous type, you can be the "Executive Producer" of the CD and have your name immortalized in the liner notes as such.  There's a partnership level for everyone.

"What If I Can't Contribute Money?"

There is another way that you can contribute. Simply share this IndiGoGo.com campaign with all of your friends, family and on your social media pages. Every little nudge helps, and I appreciate your willingness to help get the word out!

Time Frame

We are already in production, and have some of the songs finished or very close to finished. Including the 30 days of this event, we're expecting another 60 days beyond that to complete the recording process and get the CD's made. At the very latest, we're looking at late summer for this CD to be completed.  Upon completion, all of the "Perks" will be shipped out within days of receiving the CD's from the manufacturer.

Thank You

I can't wait for the day when I can fulfill your partnership level perks. This will mean that we will have been successful in our quest to make some GREAT music together! I feel very blessed to have team mates like you who are willing to help support the arts, and me in my quest.

Thank You,
Daniel Zeigler (DZ)

story:
The Rock Life

The radio show about the rock life. It's arresting, bugged out and damned funny. 

  • Industry renowned for over thirty years for a reason. Not all of them good.
  • Help fund the show that is not politically correct, but not overboard for the sake of being overboard. It's a "pirate radio show" that tells about the rock life and tells it like it is.
  • A compelling storyline about the difficult musical journeys in life, the current state of upheaval in the music industry, and the stories of lunacy, hell broken loose and frenzied exhilaration. You'll shake your head in disbelief, and you'll definitely laugh. You might even cry.

The Goal

My MusicStarWorldwide studio in Scottsdale Arizona takes money for the bandwidth, the website, and the finite equipment it takes to run a professional radio show. I don't have another job to fund it. The retail industry does not like me. I've tried.

  • It costs me $500.00 a month to keep the show on the air and it goes month to month.
  • Contribute whatever you can, and no matter how much or little, you'll get "Funder Acnowledgements" in the radio show videos. 

  • With your one-time contribution of $50.00, you'll get a musical slot in the show for whatever rock song you like, just tell me your story about it. Every song has a story.
  • You can contribute whatever you like, I do have A FEW copies of the critically acclaimed book I wrote "There's Nothing Louder Than Dead Air" left for those that contribute $50.00 or more. 

  • Each dollar funded goes towards the rental of my studio, skype phone recording capability, and postage for mailing of book.

The Impact

If you've listened to radio lately, you'll notice the complete lack of dynamic individuality. It's designed that way by the large corporations. It's intentional.

Risks & Challenges

We can make it big. Join on. You'll love it.

Other Ways You Can Help

Contribute what you can and you could help me spread the word through facebook or twitter or by embedding my show videos on your site, or even linking my show web address. Here's the Blade Radio Show logo and link.

I do thank you.

story:
Hello friends, family and fans,

As you know, I've been playing shows touring on the road and beyond since April of 2015. In Colorado I was blessed with "Clarice" a 1985 ford E350 tour bus that had been customized into a cool RV vehicle perfect for getting to my shows and living in. When I got back from doing shows in Germany for three months, the muffler cylinder blew when I started her up. I was relieved to know this was only a minor repair.  So I picked up some rideshare people and headed to my next destination. I was on my way to Orcas Island, Washington for some shows and holiday rest. In Federal Way, Washington, funny noises from the engine started to appear, so I headed to nearest off ramp to check it out. When I got to the end of the off ramp something blew and Clarice stalled right there in the middle of traffic. I got her towed to the mechanic and got a ride from an angel to Orcas and waited for the diagnosis. Worst fears realized, Clarice needs a new engine and muffler fixed. 

I know the total doesn't match the amount I'm asking for, but i'm choosing a realistic goal to raise and asking for miracles. My goal is to keep touring for the next 2 years, sharing my music all over the country and the world. I am also using Clarice as a mobile recording studio to provide my engineering and producing services for musicians in need to get there music out there. I'm am also providing a rideshare incentive to help share in gas expense and to help good souls  get to their destination.
If wish to know more about me, go to www.milomatthews.com or Facebook/Milo for an in depth look of what I am about.
I have also accepted the fact that if Clarice cannot be fixed, your funds would go to helping purchase a new vehicle which some say I should do already. I believe the universe gifted me Clarice to help fulfill my purpose in this life. That purpose is to share my music and life with the world, and to help others on the path to their dreams.  She is such a unique and special vehicle. No amount is too small and no dream is too big!!! Thank you very much for your time and your help. Many blessing to you all and lets get Clarice back on road to musical bliss.

story:
Our Story

I am Laura Lewis-Paul- Founder and Creative Director of the first female youth record label. I am a skilled Project and Programme Management Professional with 6 years experience of running high profile events and festivals. My area of expertise and passion is working with young people in a creative context. 

Saffron Records was established in May 2015 and launched in September that same year. Setting up Saffron Records has and is the most important and significant project I have been involved in to date. 


Our vision

We aim to give young women an alternative platform to education and employment by nurturing their creativity through musically focused apprenticeships.  We aim to provide young female musicians with high quality mentoring and artist development with established artists. 


Saffron has a long term ambition to create a safe, supportive and transformative space for young women to escape the chaos; to gather and inspire one another, provide their peers with the encouragement and companionships to give them the confidence to access the music industry with the recognition needed to succeed. 


What we do

The project focuses on 4 areas that fall under the umbrella of empowering women through creative and social change. 

- Creating a diverse work environment by offering Apprenticeships to 16-24 year olds

- Amplifying young women's voices by offering recording contracts while providing them with mentoring and artist development with established artists.

- Increasing  female representation in electronic and hip hop genres, by offering key stage 3-5 girls DJing, Music Production and MCing in schools.

- Building a community of musicians by running under 25's open mics nights with youth label Temple Records and mix nights for women alongside local association Bristol Women In Music.


Your support

We really need your support to spread our vision and message. By supporting this project you will really help us as a new initiative to create a safe, supportive environment for our young women to succeed in. 

It is vital to have your support as a community which cares about the welfare of our young women. You can help us to ensure that the next  generation of young women can achieve in their careers, without having to compromise themselves, their values or their bodies. 

This fundraising campaign is also about recognising and supporting the need for change and creating sustainability for us as a young Social Enterprise.  

We believe in a brighter future, but we can't get there without you.

Please consider supporting this project. Every single penny contributed will go towards increasing creative opportunities for women in music and supporting us as a new initiative.

Together, we can do this.


What we need & what you get

We aim to raise £3,000 to develop our artists mentoring and development program for our 3 recently signed artists. This will go towards:

- Individual artist development plans: 20 hours per artist for things like vocal training, creative writing, brand identity, stage presence and confidence building.

- Recording and releasing an E.P for our 3 signed artists

We have been seriously lucky to work with our friends across the city and extended networks nationally and internationally which have enabled us to offer some really unique perks for this campaign. 

These include:

- Weekend Love Saves The Day Tickets

- Signed One Direction Memorabilia 

- Artist Development Consultation


Plus many more- See Perks section. 


Why we do it

Empowering young women through music and industry opportunities means that we are able to establish a level playing ground for a more gender equal industry. 

By normalising and seeing women in historically male dominant roles we can encourage and inspire the next generation to get into these roles. 

The creative principles can get lost in this process and there is often a lack of imagination, meaning that the old age "sex sells" repeatedly gets used. 

Working with young women in the industry requires creativity, compassion and sensitivity. 

Involving women in decision making processes can provide a level of understanding  when representing young women in the media. We think women can really support the younger generation by offering companionship, guidance and solid role models through mentoring.  

Other Ways You Can Help

We recognise that some people are unable to support the project financially. If this is the case for you then fret not, you can still be massive help by shouting about our campaign and project. 

: You can share through Indigogo or social media.

: Share through social media, please tag us in all your sharing and use #supportsaffron

:Stay tuned through our 

- mailing list http://www.saffronrecords.co.uk/get-involved/

- Facebook https://www.facebook.com/Saffronrecords/?ref=hl

- Twitter https://twitter.com/SaffronRecords

- Instagram- https://www.instagram.com/saffronrecords/

Our Story I am Laura Lewis-Paul- Founder and Creative Director of the first female youth record label. I am a skilled Project and Programme Management Professional with 6 years experience of running high profile events and festivals. My area of expertise and passion is working with young people in a creative context. 
Saffron Records was established in May 2015 and launched in September that same year. Setting up Saffron Records has and is the most important and significant project I have been involved in to date. 



Our vision
We aim to give young women an alternative platform to education and employment by nurturing their creativity through musically focused apprenticeships.  We aim to provide young female musicians with high quality mentoring and artist development with established artists. 
Saffron has a long term ambition to create a safe, supportive and transformative space for young women to escape the chaos; to gather and inspire one another, provide their peers with the encouragement and companionships to give them the confidence to access the music industry with the recognition needed to succeed. 



What we do
The project focuses on 4 areas that fall under the umbrella of empowering women through creative and social change. 
- Creating a diverse work environment by offering Apprenticeships to 16-24 year olds
- Amplifying young women's voices by offering recording contracts while providing them with mentoring and artist development with established artists.
- Increasing  female representation in electronic and hip hop genres, by offering key stage 3-5 girls DJing, Music Production and MCing in schools.
- Building a community of musicians by running under 25's open mics nights with youth label Temple Records and mix nights for women alongside local association Bristol Women In Music.





Your support
We really need your support to spread our vision and message. By supporting this project you will really help us as a new initiative to create a safe, supportive environment for our young women to succeed in. 
It is vital to have your support as a community which cares about the welfare of our young women. You can help us to ensure that the next  generation of young women can achieve in their careers, without having to compromise themselves, their values or their bodies. 


This fundraising campaign is
also about recognising and supporting the need for change and creating
sustainability for us as a young Social Enterprise.  


We believe in
a brighter future, but we can't get there without you. 
Please
consider supporting this project. Every single penny contributed will go
towards increasing creative opportunities for women in music and supporting us as a new
initiative.
Together, we
can do this.



What we need & what you get
We aim to raise £3,000 to develop our artists mentoring and development program for our 3 recently signed artists. This will go towards:
- Individual artist development plans: 20 hours per artist for things like vocal training, creative writing, brand identity, stage presence and confidence building.
- Recording and releasing an E.P for our 3 signed artists
We have been seriously lucky to work with our friends across the city and extended networks nationally and internationally which have enabled us to offer some really unique perks for this campaign. 
These include:
- Weekend Love Saves The Day Tickets
- Signed One Direction Memorabilia 
- Artist Development Consultation

Plus many more- See Perks section. 

Why we do it
Empowering young women through music and industry opportunities means that we are able to establish a level playing ground for a more gender equal industry. 
By normalising and seeing women in historically male dominant roles we can encourage and inspire the next generation to get into these roles. 
The creative principles can get lost in this process and there is often a lack of imagination, meaning that the old age "sex sells" repeatedly gets used. 
Working with young women in the industry requires creativity, compassion and sensitivity. 
Involving women in decision making processes can provide a level of understanding  when representing young women in the media. We think women can really support the younger generation by offering companionship, guidance and solid role models through mentoring.  
  
Other Ways You Can Help

 We recognise that some people are unable to support the project financially. If this is the case for you then fret not, you can still be 
massive help by shouting about our campaign and project. 
: You can share through Indigogo or social media.
: Share through social media, please tag us in all your sharing and use #supportsaffron
:Stay tuned through our 
- mailing list http://www.saffronrecords.co.uk/get-involved/
- Facebook https://www.facebook.com/Saffronrecords/?ref=hl
- Twitter https://twitter.com/SaffronRecords
- Instagram- https://www.instagram.com/saffronrecords/

story:
Welcome! The True Love Rules are releasing their first ever vinyl 45, The Green Fields of Shannon Park, in celebration of the military housing community, Shannon Park (1951-2003) and we need YOU to help us make it happen. 

  Pre order The Green Fields of Shannon Park with b-side, Buy A Guitar (Before You Kill Someone), and receive a sweet 7 inch 45 rpm record (signed if you wish) with full colour sleeve and Stove Records label artwork, plus a digital download card! There are options with CD's, T shirts and House concerts too! Imagine that bunch in your house, you'd need more than Molly Maid the next day.       

  Recorded in Dartmouth, Nova Scotia at New Scotland Yard and Echo Chamber studios, Halifax.

 The songs feature guest musicians with an All Dartmouth team of Mike Farrington (The Mellotones), Clive MacNutt (Erin Costello), Steve Rolston (Rolly and the Navy Brats), Joel Plaskett (Joel Plaskett Emergency), Dave Marsh and the fabulous Mo Kenney! The songs are recorded, mastered and ready to go. All of your generous support goes to the manufacturing costs of this instant collectors item. 

We need $2300 CDN, to cover the costs of the vinyl manufacturing. The recording costs, engeneering and musicians fees, expert mastering and artwork are complete but now we need your support. The reality of vinyl manufacturing is it requires a steep set up cost, so whether it's a single or full album the initial costs are pretty much the same.The single will be ready mid April regardless of whether the target goal has been met. Pre-order, and rest easy that a record has your name and address on it. Help make it happen!
 Here are the options to support; the 45 single with digital download card; an option for the single with download card and our latest CD The Cause of Many Troubles!
 We'll also be offering a couple of other options for you to show your awesome support, they will include the 45 with extras like, CD bonus, custom made t-shirts, house concert, joining us onstage or a personal skype performance of one of the songs!
 And don't forget to share! Indigogo has cool share tools to use. Many thanks.

story:
This fundraising effort will help cover the costs of CD duplication, graphic design and minimal expenses for promotion of the charity show, and the decades-overdue release of The Dads' second album, "Redemption." We would like to send out a heartfelt thanks to Richmond, Virginia - The Dads' hometown - for supporting us throughout the years.

All net profits from admission fees for the show and CD sales after basic expenses will go directly to the Bryan and Kathryn Harvey Memorial Fund(please see video for more details), and a portion will go to the Benshoff family. The family members have sole discretion to which charities they would like to contribute.

story:
I need a PC that can run FLS with no problems.

Hey, skypirates.

Imagine a concert pianist playing on a broken piano. She can't perform to the best of her abilities. I'm no concert pianist, but I need a PC that won't lag, and can handle the amount of audio files I use. I will need to buy parts to build the best computer for production.

I'm setting up to $700 aside for the production machine. That will include all the components, and monitors, and external drives, and a keyboard and mouse. The rest (up to, and beyond the $1000 goal) will go to replacing corrupted/lost files, and thanking funders.

I'll be making thank you songs, and I can really begin work on the albums I've been planning, and possibly merch to thank donators. I'll also be spending more time with ctmsphr!.

If I don't make it to $1000 (which I'm not expecting to) the money will go as far as it can into building the PC. If it's short of that, I'll replace my laptop, and continue as I have been.

You will catapult me into new possibilities!

With a PC dedicated to production, I'll be able to work faster, on bigger projects, and at a higher quality. That means more music for you.

I ask for your money hesitantly. I'm well aware that it's hard-earned, and that it's not easily given. But, at the very least, you won't be spending it on coffee you'll enjoy for less than 20 minutes, and never again.

Risks & challenges...

I don't expect to make it easily. I've never had a large fanbase, and I'm happy because that means I'm more able to interact with you as friends. But, with your help, I can do better, make better.

If you can't afford this, but want to help...

Simple maths: 100 people donating 10 dollars gets me to my goal. For perspective, there are 840 people who clicked "follow" on soundcloud.

You can't afford this. I get it, you have to budget your cash wisely. Don't give me money you don't have. 

Instead, think about telling five people about this. Tell them to tell five people. Help spread the word. The more people that know, the better chance we have of succeeding.

story:
Photoville has invited EverydayClimateChange (@everydayclimatechange) Instagram feed to exhibit this year at its all-free admission photo festival this year in September!  During the festival, EverydayClimateChange founder, James Whitlow Delano, will join a panel discussion at Photoville to talk about climate change.  We would like you to partner with us as we present visual evidence of the challenges of climate change to a whole new audience.

EverydayClimateChange is a collection of photographers from 6 continents who share photographs made on 7 continents to present visual evidence that climate change doesn't just happen "over there" but that climate change is also happening "right here".  Photographers come from the north, the south; the east and the west; and are as diverse as the cultures in which we were all raised.  We document not only the effects of climate change but also potential solutions to mitigate the effects of global warming on our world.

With over 71,000 visitors last year, Photoville is New York City’s largest annual photo event.  They collaborated with 80 curatorial partners including Instagram, TIME, National Geographic, the Pulitzer Center, The New York Times and many others.  EverydayClimateChange is honored to be a part of this photo festival.

Come join us in spreading the word about climate change in  a new way to a whole new sets of eyes!  You can help us communicate that there is just one world, OUR WORLD and only we, all of us, can make it a better one.  We hope you will become a funding partner and we hope to see you in New York!

story:
Hi Everyone!
Thank you for visiting my campaign page. I'm getting ready to record a new cd, and I have the great opportunity to work with John Carter Cash as producer (son of Johnny and June). Chuck Turner will be co-producing, engineering, and mixing -it's a big job. These two gentleman are some of the best in the music world to work with- and I'm excited to record the new cd with them.

I need to raise a total of $20,000 to make this record. It's for the recording time, musicians, production fees, mixing, mastering, and the rest is for duplication of the cd's, artwork, and release and distribution fees. It all adds up…

I am offering special perks in return for your Angel Sponsorship. It is a wonderful deed in knowing you are personally helping an artist create and I will be so grateful for your help. We can work together to release and distribute this new record. With your contribution, I can record new material and get out on tour as soon as possible!

What better way to help an independent artist such as myself, to continue to work and make music for you...

EVERY penny donated to this project is going straight to the recording costs.

Please take the time to watch my campaign video and check out the perks. I hope you will join me as an Angel Sponsor in this journey of making a new record- and spread the word to fellow music lovers all over!

Rock it!
-Janet

story:
The project

NEW! You can now donate via PayPal in £, $ or €.

The Welsh Camerata is Wales' premier early music choir, directed by the renowned early music specialist Andrew Wilson-Dickson.  

We will perform a new reconstruction of J S Bach's 'lost' St Mark Passion on Good Friday, 25 March 2016. Tickets for the performance are available from the Royal Welsh College of Music and Drama box office.

Following the performance the score and parts will be published by   Canasg Music, the online choral publisher.


The Passion
The St Mark is one of four biblical Passions that Bach is known to have composed, of which only two survive in their complete form: St Matthew and St John. It is a ‘parody’ work: owing to time pressures, Bach compiled most of it from music he had already composed for other purposes, a common practice at a time when new music was composed on a weekly basis and was not expected to be kept for posterity.  It was written for Easter 1731 and first performed on Good Friday.                                                                  
Fortunately, we know what that music was, and it is music of quality; remarkably however it shines even brighter in the context of the Passion, as though Bach had known all along that this work was destined for higher purposes. All the existing music can quite easily be matched up with Picander's libretto (which survives in its entirety). But that leaves the recitatives, some arias and the turba choruses without a note.
The ambition

This is an enormously ambitious project, bringing this lost masterpiece back to life on the anniversary of its first performance, Good Friday.

With the help of contributions from you and other music lovers, we can help Bach’s lost Passion to take its rightful place in the canon of great sacred choral works.
We want to publish the complete reconstruction, so that other groups can perform the work in the future. The original score will be lodged in the archives of the RWCMD along with Andrew Wilson-Dickson’s working notes, and a recording will be made, providing the fullest possible resource for future generations of Bach enthusiasts.

The reconstruction
There have been a number of previous reconstructions, some of them drawing on the music of Bach's near contemporaries, others simply omitting some of the music. None of these present an ‘authentic’ experience of the original performance, and that is our aim, with music newly composed in the style of the great master filling in all the gaps. As both a composer and early music specialist, Andrew Wilson-Dickson is ideally suited to this task. He says, "I imagine myself a pupil of Bach, helping him out in a moment of stress, when the demands and managerial attitudes of the Leipzig Town Council were becoming impossible, added to the needs of a burgeoning family."
 
The performance
For this monumental performance, we have engaged the services of the Welsh Baroque Orchestra  and four renowned soloists, Sian Winstanley (soprano),  Catherine King (mezzo), Peter Wilman (tenor), and Stephen Hamnett (bass). The performance will take place in the magnificent Dora Stoutzker Hall at the Royal Welsh College of Music and Drama, Cardiff, Wales,  on Good Friday 2016 (25 March). Details on concert-diary.com. 


What We Need & What You Get

We aim to raise £4000 towards an estimated overall cost of  £9000.  The main costs will be venue hire (£1,000), orchestra and soloists (approximately £6,000) plus Director's fee, recording and publicity costs.

We hope to raise about £3250 directly through ticket sales. Although we have been able to attract small grants from the Welsh Arts Council in the past, we do not have any grant funding for this project. The current economic climate is  very difficult and anyway current funding priorities do not include Early Music. The choir members themselves are determined that the concert will go ahead and  their own personal contributions will help to cover any shortfall.
Our main ambition is to see the St Mark Passion, through this reconstruction, recognised and valued and therefore performed around the world. Our performance on the 25th March will, we hope, showcase this version of the Passion and encourage other choirs to add it to their repertoire. We feel that the best way to do this is to make a high quality downloadable performing edition available online at a very reasonable cost, through the choral music publishers Canasg Music. For the purposes of the crowd-funding campaign we are offering a few bound scores together with a limited number of a recordings of the live performance.

The Impact

The Welsh Camerata has an impressive track record of reviving lost works from past centuries.  Our specialism has led us to rediscover a number of forgotten masterpieces, performing them for the first time in Wales since their composition. 

At the same time we have encouraged the creation  and performance of new music. Most recently we commissioned the composition of an entirely new oratorio, 'Karuna', written by Andrew Wilson-Dickson, which we performed with soloists Emma Kirkby, Ian Yemm and Paul Carey Jones. 

                                                             

Our aim is to use the unique dual skills of our director, Andrew Wilson-Dickson as early music specialist and composer, combined with the abilities of the singers in a fabulous venue to champion this sublime work.

The performance will be a springboard to encourage other choirs to add this work to their repertoire.

Risks & Challenges

For some 'purists', unless a work is 100% authentic i.e. all Bach's work, they will not feel that it should be performed at all. While recognising that this will not be the original St Mark Passion of 1731, nonetheless we feel that it will give the opportunity for sublime music, which deserves to be heard in the intended setting, to become better known and appreciated.

This reconstruction is a skilful blend of Bach's own music with fresh and vivid music that Andrew Wilson-Dickson has composed, informed by his deep knowledge and understanding of music from this period. It is not a mere academic exercise, but a genuinely dramatic setting for the re-telling of the Easter story.

We have a loyal following, but our concerts are generally on a smaller scale in churches in and around Cardiff. Thus our reputation, while very good, is quite local. We hope that we can generate sufficient excitement around this project in the lead up to the performance, which will help to ensure both a good audience and also act as a springboard for wider recognition of the St Mark Passion a major choral work, which deserves to be heard regularly.

The Perks

To encourage music lovers and choristers everywhere to support the project, we are offering a range of perks (to suit all sizes of pocket!) 

You are of course very welcome to contribute any amount you like, whether or not you would want to claim a perk!


 

Other Ways You Can Help

We very much hope that you will want to contribute to this unique project by backing us and/or coming to hear the concert. Whether or not you contribute you can spread the word using Indiegogo's share tools - 

  • Facebook, 
  • Google Plus 
  • Twitter 
  • Add a widget to your blog or personal website.   
  • Send a direct email from Indiegogo
Even if you can't attend in person or can't spare any of your hard earned cash, please tell all your friends about the lost Bach Passion - rediscovered in Cardiff on Good Friday 2016.

Thus our reputation, while very good, is quite local. We hope that we can generate sufficient excitement around this project in the lead up to the performance, which will help to ensure both a good audience and also act as a springboard for wider recognition of the St Mark Passion a major choral work, which deserves to be heard regularly.

The Perks
To encourage music lovers and choristers everywhere to support the project, we are offering a range of perks (to suit all sizes of pocket!) 
You are of course very welcome to contribute any amount you like, whether or not you would want to claim a perk!





 

Other Ways You Can Help We very much hope that you will want to contribute to this unique project by backing us and/or coming to hear the concert. Whether or not you contribute you can spread the word using Indiegogo's share tools - 



Facebook, 


Google Plus 

Twitter 

Add a widget
	to your blog or personal website.   

Send a direct
	email from Indiegogo
Even if you can't attend in person or can't spare any of your hard earned cash, please tell all your friends about the lost Bach Passion - rediscovered in Cardiff on Good Friday 2016.

story:
Short Summary.

Hello Friends, Family and Fans!

I'm Stephen Borgovini, You might know me as SteveO original drummer for "Fun Lovin' Criminals" or as "C.C. Jones'".  Speaking of C.C. Jones, it's time for me to make my next album come to life. This is the 3rd album I've written for C.C. Jones. If you're not familiar with C.C., he's my alter-ego. He lets me take the things that happen in my own life and make them public - in a creative kinda way.

This album is different from the first two in the sense that, this time, C.C. has gone through a transformation, from darkness and negativity into light, love and gratitude. He has found the seed of spirituality and has taken measures to water that seed. Don't get me wrong, it's not all sunshine and rainbows! C.C. starts off in a very dark place and the album's songs include genres such as Rock, Pop, Blues, Jazz, and Country. Musically there's a song for everyone and lyrically it's a message that everyone can relate to. It's the type of message that can actually make the world a better place.....now, how about that?!

What We Need & What You Get

I'm looking for help to make this project come to life and spread this inspirational  message of positivity. If C.C. can open up to the idea of love and positivity over darkness, then anyone can!

What I need are funds for all steps of the recording process which include, pre production, tracking, editing, mixing, mastering and duplication.

I've decided to bring my "business" back to central New York, where I grew up. I will be recording and mixing on Genesee street at Big Blue North Recording Studio, a state-of-the-art studio in Utica, New York. Please check out this video to learn more about the process and Big Blue North.


The mastering  will be done here in Brooklyn and the duplication will be done online.


Speaking of duplication here are some of the Perks I'm offering for your generosity.

-Pre-order digital download of the album

-Pre-order CD of the album

-There's also a great option to catch up with all of C.C.'s trials and tribulations with a 3CD set or 3 Digital Downloads of the albums.

-There's music lessons where I can teach you technique on drums or guitar or I can  teach you your favorite C.C. song!

-You can get a call from me or C.C. - your choice! (C.C.'s more interesting!)

-Have you ever had a song written specifically for you?

The Impact

Since I was a child, I've been writing and performing. This particular endeavor is the most important I've ever attempted. Musically the songs are strong and lyrically it concludes with a message of truth, gratitude and love. I believe these concepts can make the world a better place and make us happier in our lives.

Thank you for following me  throughout my career and thank you in advance for  contributing to this campaign by either funding me or sharing it. To do either just follow the prompts on Indiegogo.

Thanks Again!

story:
... Now in London, she is very close to its realization. 

Hi, I'm a nomadic multi-national singer-songwriter who recently moved to London to record my first album with Jag (Universal Music, BBC, Jahnavi Harrison, Deva Premal & Jai Uttal), one of the UK’s leading producers & mix engineers specializing in alternative analogue music.  

Once upon a time I escaped the hectic city from an almost-burn-out and got washed upon the shores of a tranquil island...  Although I am quite a daring dreamer never could I have dreamt of the tremendous gifts that life offered to me with such ease, such fortune and abundance. Now the music called me back into the dense vibrational madness of the city to record my soul's odyssey.


This might be of interest to you. 

From contemporary jazzy soul music to gentle dance grooves 'Across the Bay & Beyond' is an intimate concept album that will lift you off the ground and carry you away. 

Please let me share this peace and other pieces with you - wherever you are in life. We were fortunate enough to record the first single 'Life is a River' but to complete the entire album we need everyone's help.


You will get a piece of the cake:

From digital downloads, album hardcopies, paradise posters and customized lyrics and songwriting lessons your support is very much appreciated and will be reciprocated. In case we don't reach the entire goal any funds raised will go into the recording of an EP [a CD with less songs than an album] and/or single releases .


Every contribution will go directly into the making of the album. 

In detail, the estimated overall costs are:

  • Mixing 13 songs, 13 days in total using a BBC analogue mixing desk, includes studio hire, engineer & producer - Cost £3,600 
  • Mastering at Metropolis Studios­ with Andy ‘Hippy’ Baldwin (Amy Winehouse, Blur, The Who) - Cost £800 
  • Production 3 days per song, 27 days in total. Production, programming & editing includes editing suite - Cost £2,700 
  • Recording vocals & all of the various instruments, 26 days including professional studio with engineer - Cost £7,150 
  • Musicians Shammi Pithia (Bansuri Flute), Rafael Marchante Angulo (guitar), Roy Dudds (drums, 'Fairground Attraction'), Tadas Mickevičius (Saxophone), Oktawia Petronella (Violin), Jaro Barnik (trumpet) and more - Estimated Cost £3600
  • Professional artwork design - Estimated Cost £650
  • Manufacturing 1000 CD’s digipak - Cost £1500
  • TOTAL £20,000


The Impact - Powerful & Peaceful

To benefit all music-loving souls in this day & age please help to make this album possible.

Indra's enchanting debut single 'Life is a River' is now available on itunes (Click here for a preview of the song) and will be on the 'Across the Bay & Beyond' album. In addition you can find selected demo versions of three of Indra's songs here (Listen now on Soundcloud) but to record the entire full-length album we totally depend on your help.

You Can Make a Difference

Recording this album is a true milestone. Be part of it from the start. 
Every contribution is a step closer to completing this surprisingly subtle and sophisticated music debut.
Please don't forget to share this awesome project with your social network tribe & your offline family, and kindly help us to get the music out into the world!

With the warmest wishes and many thanks,
Indra & Team


PS. You can find more info and more photos in the Profile and Image Gallery.

story:
In case you ended up here by mistake.

Masons Revolt is the dirty dirty backwoods rock of, um, the North. The deeeeep north. Well kind of the deep North. We're not talking Canada or anything; let's not get carried away here. Think stoner rock except more 4-wheelers and snowmobiles. Oh and sometimes there are dragons. Or bears. Don't worry about it. Anyway...


Why do these assholes think they're so goddamn important!?

We're not very comfortable with telling strangers that we think we're awesome. It makes us feel icky inside. However, a bunch of people seem to really enjoy what we're doing, so we figured we'd try and give everyone a second helping.

That's where you guys come in.

Again, this thing is basically asking you to give us some money, which is truly offensive to our blue collar sensibilities. Think of it more like a pre-order type of situation. That, at least, is what we're telling ourselves so we don't throw up.

http://bigbluenorth.com

We're really and truly going to bust our asses on this record. We're stepping into a one of a kind facility at Big Blue North to record this album. Hanging out at this place and doing our thing in a state of the art environment, with unmatched hospitality from Jeff & Pam, is what's going to make this album something you won't want to miss. 

Let's go!

There's so much Masons Revolt music that's not in your car/truck/boat right now! Think of all the fresh camping/boating/fishing/getting drunk you could do with a shiny new Masons Revolt disc! Aren't you guys excited! Guys?!

story:
Short Summary

The project "Music That Will change the world" is one of my dreams. I will explain it to you. I have started my music journey because I wanted to get my message out to the world and I chose music as my language. Bono once said, that music can change the world because it can change the way people think and that is what I am going for. Nowadays we have a lot of problems, not to mention the economic problems, which are pretty hard to solve, but people are dying inside. The further we go the less compassion and love we see in our daily lives and I really want to change that. We are going to travel to Alp mountains and shoot music videos, all these videos of course will be uploaded on our Youtube channel and all our experiences will be published on our social networks and blogs and we are hoping to get some air time on our local TV and radio stations also, if we get enough funds we will go for international TV and Radio stations.

More info about us and our goal:

  • I am a musician,actor,singersongwritter from Lithuania. I started my band called Justin 3 and wrote music. I wrote music about everything. Mostly of course about love. I would not run this campaign if I had the necessary funds. But I am from a very small country and I can't do that. And time is running. That is why I need Your help.
  • During this campaign I will get my message out to the world in a very creative and beautiful way. Music came from the nature and mountains is the best illustration of our beautiful nature world. And I truly hope that I will inspire people to do good, to love, to believe. And even if it will be a small achievement, but at least I will make world a better place for a small amount of people.
  • We are planning to travel around alps for a week and shoot 6 music videos, If we manage, we will shoot more.

What We Need & What You Get

What we need:

  • First of all we need funds for gas, to travel to Alps and of course we will need somewhere to live and something to eat. We are planning to spend some nights in a tent and capture the beauty of the night, but we will need to get some rest for us to make the music videos at the highest quality it is possible. Also, we will need funds for publishing our campaign, our experiences and to make it available for everyone around the world. 
  • We are offering some perks for contributions, we will release an album of these songs, recorded and performed in alps and we will definitely share it with all of contributors, at least in digital format or even if we will get more funding, in physical. Also official thank you notes and public mentions.
  • If we do not reach our goal we will try to fund the rest of the sum ourselves, but if the amount of collected funds will be very small, we will have to abort this mission.

The Impact

As I said before, I hope that this will change the world in a very personal way for everyone, some maybe even find their inner peace, someone will be inspired to pursue their dreams, some maybe will find love again and this all thing, this all emotional impact of course will change the way we all live. For this to happen we need your help. 

Risks & Challenges

There are few challenges:

  • The journey will be very tiring and we will have lots of work. This is not an easy task to travel to alps and to shoot music videos. Approximately 6 if we have time we will shoot more. 
  • We will need electric generators for our equipment to run smoothly. And they might fail, so we have a  back up plan, we have chargeable batteries that can recharge our cameras and recording equipment.
  • Weather might get ugly and we will need to wait, so we are going to add an extra day if we have this kind of problems.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can not contribute but You believe in our cause:

  • Please share this campaign with everyone You can, maybe your friends would like to contribute.
  • Please use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • Also if You have connections with TV, Radio stations, Newspapers, Journals please let them know about our project, maybe they will join our cause and will work on publicizing our music videos and our experience.

I hope you will support us on this mission and we will have the ability to share this beautiful creations that we are going to make.

story:
Help Randy Cormier release his 1st Solo CD

Randy is getting set to record six more songs in Nashville. He uses all Nashville studio musicians to ensure the new modern country-rock sound he is looking for is nailed. He has already recorded and has done vocals for five of the eleven songs going on the CD 'The Simple Life'. 

The Simple Life is the Title track and theme of the CD. It's a code that he has chosen to live by and teaching his children by traveling, playing shows and experiencing first hand all of the amazing landscape of this great country!

Randy is realizing a dream he has had his whole life and that is playing music all over the country. He has, in the last few months, played in Nashville, New Mexico, Austin TX, Ft Myers FL, Cape Coral FL and is getting set to return to New England which is home base. 

He plans on touring and playing solo and with his band Whiskey City in New England for the summer before heading off again in November of 2016 to tour the country with his family. With 'The Simple Life' in hand he will now have something to leave behind at all of his shows for people who want his music for their own.

He is hoping your contributions and help will get him over the goal and use any extra for promotional material and touring.

What I Need & What You Get

He is looking to $6000 to cover the cost of recording in Nashville, studio musicians, mixing, mastering, manufacturing and artwork. Five songs have already been paid for and we are doing six more. Then all have to mixed, mastered and manufactured.

He is including some very exciting perks such as a Personal Party, Song written for you, Posters, signed CD's, and even one person to become an official Co-Producer. 

Randy appreciates all that his family, friends and fans have done over the years and your continued support is a huge part of this project. This CD is the work of many years of playing music with great bands and on his own! Thank you!

Randy

story:
Soul Searching is back by popular demand and ready to keep raising the funds to complete a full length album! This project is halfway there and what we've done so far is really exciting!  Please check out the Soul Searching EP! 

We've come a long way, but now we need your help to cross that finish line!

Soul Searching 

In Soul Searching - The Full Length Album, Mark Miller stakes his claim on the music that is his birthright. Mark's father, Ron Miller, brought us songs like “For Once in My Life,” “Touch Me In The Morning,” “Heaven Help Us All” and a string of other amazing hits!  Soul Searching is more than an album, it is a journey though the music Mark grew up with on the streets of the South Side of Chicago and will be a heartfelt tribute to the music his father created.  

The creation of this album is something we have worked on for a long time -- arranging, writing, producing and performing with a group of artists Mark has known for years an is proud to call friends and family.  This album is something you would be proud to be part of!  Come join us! 

About Mark Arthur Miller

Mark grew up with his sister, mother, and grandparents.  He had a visceral connection to soul music he couldn’t explain until he heard Stevie Wonder’s 1968 single “For Once in My Life” one day and saw Ron Miller's name on the record label.  He would point at the 45 and tell his South Side friends: “That's my dad!”  Less than three hundred miles away in Detroit, his estranged father was creating a catalogue of Soul treasures.  In the 1970’s, the Miller teenagers re-connected with their dad and moved with him to Los Angeles when Motown relocated their headquarters.

Mark’s early career was focused on athletics and acting.  He co-founded both the Reflections Theatre Ensemble in Chicago and The Road Theater Company in Los Angeles where he acted in plays, on television, and in films.  But he always sang, and sang well -- so well that his father would often have Mark sing demos of his songs. In 1994 Mark began singing and performing in Los Angeles clubs, Ron Miller was almost always in the audience until his death in 2007.  

Mark experimented with musical styles over the years, but ultimately surrendered to the sounds he grew up with. 

“I love music, period,” says Mark.  “I started out singing jazz, and I love Sondheim and rock and pop. But I found myself turning every arrangement into Rhythm & Blues.  The truth is, that's my heart, and I'm ready to show it to the world.”

“It’s been awhile coming.  I grew up with this music, and loved it way before my father was even in my life in any meaningful way.  Our relationship was complicated.  He struggled with a gambling addiction, which took... everything.  And it took me some time to come around to this project, to really claim it on my own terms,” says the singer.

Where the Money Goes

Many people who have never been involved in making a record are surprised by the work and funds it takes to complete it. Thanks to your amazing support we've booked time in the studio and we're excited to start showing you some behind the scenes videos and pictures on what we're creating.  

The funding goal is based on what the first half of project cost and all that will need to be accomplished for the finished product to be in your hands.  Also, as in any project, there are extra costs that I will have to take care of.  This budget does not take into account PR costs which are so important in getting your music heard, so anything we raise over our goal will mainly go to that end.

  • Recording time in the studio
  • Editing/Mixing time in the studio
  • Photography and Artwork 
  • Mastering of the final recording
  • Printing of the final CD product
  • Paying the musicians and engineer (most important of all) They are some of the best in the biz!

The Perks

There are some great perks!  Obviously the more you give, the bigger the prize, but every last donation is one I will feel blessed to receive.  Check out the list of PERKS on your right and see how you would like to take part!

Other Ways You Can Help

The best compliment a musician can receive is  a recommendation of their music. A "Hey, you have to check this music out!" to a friend is every artist's dream.  Helping spread the word to people who would like what Soul Searching is about, would be an amazing contribution!  Let's get the word out and make some music!

Thank you all for your support! 

A Note From Peter

I’m very proud to be Musical Director, co-arranger, co-writer and co-producer on this project! Mark has an extremely specific, unique and profound connection to soul music. His story, the story of his show and the story of his album, is one that needs to be seen and heard. The second half of the album— the part yet to be recorded— features not only more revamped arrangements of soul classics (including some by Ron Miller), but also original music in the tradition of Mark’s father, written by Mark and myself. Have a listen on this indie gogo page to the first half of the record and you’ll get a sense of what we are doing. By pre-ordering/supporting, you are making the project happen— straight up! And that includes not just Mark and myself but also Maiya Sykes, Will Artope, Erich Gobel, Laura Mace, Frank Abraham, Jon Stuart, Adam Hawley, Gene Coye and many, many other great musicians who will be gainfully employed and utilized by your support. Thanks for checking it out!

A Note From Mark

Hi everyone!  Mark Arthur Miller here, and I would love you to join us in finishing the CD, SOUL SEARCHING!  The album is a tribute to Soul music, with all-new arrangements to classic Soul and Motown hits, songs from my Father’s songbook, and BRAND NEW SONGS written by myself and co-writer Peter Smith.  The CD would also be the completion of the soundtrack for the live stage show “SOUL SEARCHING”!  (Read the reviews: Broadway World & Music Connection)

Let's do this thing!
story_txt:
Soul Searching is back by popular demand and ready to keep raising the funds to complete a full length album! This project is halfway there and what we've done so far is really exciting!  Please check out the Soul Searching EP! We've come a long way, but now we need your help to cross that finish line!


Soul Searching 

In Soul Searching - The Full Length Album, Mark Miller stakes his claim on the music that is his birthright. Mark's father, Ron Miller, brought us songs like “For Once in My Life,” “Touch Me In The Morning,” “Heaven Help Us All” and a string of other amazing hits!  Soul Searching is more than an album, it is a journey though the music Mark grew up with on the streets of the South Side of Chicago and will be a heartfelt tribute to the music his father created.  
The creation of this album is something we have worked on for a long time -- arranging, writing, producing and performing with a group of artists Mark has known for years an is proud to call friends and family.  This album is something you would be proud to be part of!  Come join us! 

About Mark Arthur Miller
Mark grew up with his sister, mother, and grandparents.  He had a visceral connection to soul music he couldn’t explain until he heard Stevie Wonder’s 1968 single “For Once in My Life” one day and saw Ron Miller's name on the record label.  He would point at the 45 and tell his South Side friends: “That's my dad!”  Less than three hundred miles away in Detroit, his estranged father was creating a catalogue of Soul treasures.  In the 1970’s, the Miller teenagers re-connected with their dad and moved with him to Los Angeles when Motown relocated their headquarters.
Mark’s early career was focused on athletics and acting.  He co-founded both the Reflections Theatre Ensemble in Chicago and The Road Theater Company in Los Angeles where he acted in plays, on television, and in films.  But he always sang, and sang well -- so well that his father would often have Mark sing demos of his songs. In 1994 Mark began singing and performing in Los Angeles clubs, Ron Miller was almost always in the audience until his death in 2007.  
Mark experimented with musical styles over the years, but ultimately surrendered to the sounds he grew up with. 
“I love music, period,” says Mark.  “I started out singing jazz, and I love Sondheim and rock and pop. But I found myself turning every arrangement into Rhythm & Blues.  The truth is, that's my heart, and I'm ready to show it to the world.”“It’s been awhile coming.  I grew up with this music, and loved it way before my father was even in my life in any meaningful way.  Our relationship was complicated.  He struggled with a gambling addiction, which took... everything.  And it took me some time to come around to this project, to really claim it on my own terms,” says the singer.
