Many people who have never been involved in making a record are surprised by the work and funds it takes to complete it. Thanks to your amazing support we've booked time in the studio and we're excited to start showing you some behind the scenes videos and pictures on what we're creating.

A "Hey, you have to check this music out!" to a friend is every artist's dream.  Helping spread the word to people who would like what Soul Searching is about, would be an amazing contribution!  Let's get the word out and make some music!
Thank you all for your support!

story:
Our story

Istvan Sky - I am a singer and musician from Hungary, and have been singing since my childhood. I play very special instruments such as the Indian sarod, the Hungarian citera, the guitar and drums. I have a unique healing voice, it's a very interesting combination of tribal singing of ancient Asia and Hungarian folk tradition. I found my teachers in different places in the world, I learnt spiritual music for 15 years and I travel the world today sharing this with people. When I chant I am with the sky, I am with God, and I am in the beauty of the present.

Ester Tara - I am a singer-songwriter, started as a Hungarian folk singer at a very early age and since then I participated in different musical projects. I play the guitar, the Hungarian citera and drums. Singing was always something I was the most passionate about in my life. Day by day I am fascinated by the healing power of music and singing, and I live my life sharing this with people.

Pablo Arellano - I have been a composer since I was very young and I have played the piano for film music, TV, radio and other formats. Today I live in Mexico, and dedicate myself to my Youtube Channel creating healing music for the world. With this project I would like to tour the world doing the same.

The story of the Butterfly

Pablo and Istvan met in Mexico where Istvan was performing in a music festival. Then 3 years ago Istvan invited Pablo and Estas Tonne to play in his Surya Sangita Ashram in the beautiful Balaton National Park in Hungary near Lake Balaton, together they channeled the Butterfly Song, and people loved it. 

We thank everybody who followed our musical journey so far and the thousands of letters we receive every day. You are our main inspiration and motivation to this day.


Our Vision

We decided to continue to create music together, in the spirit of the 'Butterfly Song'. Today we want to raise money with a simple idea, with you pre-ordering our CD, and by this enabling us to share this beautiful music with thousands of people.

With this campaign we would like to raise money to complete the production of our CD, 'Spirit of Butterfly' (recording, mixing, mastering, distribution, advertising, promotion, PR), and a concert DVD, do two premier concerts, one in Europe and one in Mexico, and tour Europe. Our aim is to spread healing music all around the world.

The amount generated with your help will cover the cost of:

  • Recording, mixing, mastering, artwork, manufacturing and distributing the CD 'Spirit of Butterfly'. 
  • A professional video clip for the song 'Greeting  the Master'.
  • Recording, manufacturing and distributing a concert DVD.
  • Travelling fees between Mexico, India and Europe.
  • Inviting guest musicians to participate.
  • Basic PR & marketing and technical equipment.
  • Credit Card and Indiegogo’s fees.
  • Concert and workshop fees that you can find in Perks.
  • Two premier concerts, one in Mexico and one in Europe.
  • Summer tour in Europe.

Be Part of this Journey

Naturally, our main gift is the music we create, but besides this, we thought of a few very exciting gifts we could give you. You can see them on the right of the page under Perks.

We set 3 milestones for reaching our goal:

We warmly invite you to share the campaign with your friends on Facebook, in e-mail, or the best way, personally. If you know any sponsors or companies who would like to support us, please let us know. Please help us share this beautiful vision and make people happier all around the world.

Breakdown of the costs:


If you decide to support our beautiful project, you can check out our Perks on the right and choose the package you find the most inviting. 

If you can't help us with money at the moment, do not worry! We are inviting you to share this vision - share it with everyone you meet, everyone you love, everyone who needs a little bit of sunshine. And don't forget: if you give, you get it back 7 times. :)

story:
Andrea Belita*

Hi! I'm Andrea Belita* and I make music. I live in the San Francisco Bay area and I'm a soft pop chic from a small farm in Idaho. My music embodies the majesty of the outdoors, love in all its glory and tragedy, and my fish, Mr. E. (Come to think of it, I don't have a song about Mr. E. yet.) Life is complex with all of its twists and turns, highs, and lows. Much of what I experience shapes itself into a form that I understand and get healing from. That form is music. 

Why Donate to the EP?

My first single, called Painted, was released a week ago and I have another one called Friday Night, coming out soon! Check it out on Amazon, iTunes and Spotify. 
My songs speak to the complexity of people’s experiences and emotions. The relief of emerging from a difficult situation, to the heartbreak of failed relationships, to discovering who you are and what you want in life, the lyrics and melodies come from a deep place in my heart. They resonate in relatable ways to those who hear the songs. We have unique stories as individuals, but our similarities are universal. We all feel joy, sorrow, strength, pain, love, loneliness, and fear. The music you can help me create for this EP takes those emotions and puts them in words.
Donating to the EP will help me finish recording. I have finished two songs for the 7 song EP and need the additional funds to make it happen by Jan 1. Why Jan 1?? This new year symbolizes a new path for me. I made my first album 10 years ago, but now I'm getting into a professional studio with a producer. If you are not on the same path as your passion, let's help each other get there. 

What I Need & What You Get

I need a minimum of $12,000 to finish recording the EP in the studio. This takes care of:

  • Producer
  • Studio time
  • Mixing
  • Mastering
Perks
  • Acoustic studio version of Painted
  • Free EP
  • Handmade cards to give to people that say, 'You paint my life pretty.'
  • Homemade cookies
  • Exclusive copy of the first song I wrote called 'My Piano'
  • Feeling that you can go for your dreams, too
If per chance I didn't reach my entire goal, the funds donated will still go to the costs described above.

Potential Obstacles

There are always potential hurdles in undertaking a project. I'm in this to win it and win it with you. I'm using reputable studios and producers so that EP will inspire people to look beyond themselves and to embrace the complexity of relationships and life. 

Like you, I believe in working diligently. When I feel strongly toward something, I'm willing to go any mile to achieve it. Music is my passion. Let me inspire you!

Sharing is Caring!

There are share buttons to get the word out about my campaign. Remember---sharing is caring :) Lots of love, Andrea  xx

story:
I've got some songs! And some ideas!

   So, I had a bit of a weird year, this 2015. It was equal parts: absolutely amazing and life-/career-changing and met some of the most amazing people; and soul-crushing, 'give-it-all-up-why-bother' depressing. 
   So, what do we do when this gets thrown at us? We write!
And I have been. I've been writing a lot. I've got some songs that I'm kinda happy with and, like, a bunch of half-songs that I think I'll be ecstatic with when I get them done. 
   So, I need your help to make it happen.

I'm doing two different albums with this:
The first will be "Plan E", my second EP. I've been through plans A through D...
I'm recording that now and will be hopefully sending it off to be replicated soon.
The second will be my February Album Writing Month Album.
The challenge of FAWM is to write and record 14 songs in 28 (29 this year) days.
I'll be on tour in the UK for half of this, hence the weird, hurried nature of this campaign. 
I can't promise I'll get 14 songs written and done and ABSOLUTELY can't promise they'll be good! But I'm going to do my best. There WILL be at least 6 or 7 songs. Hopefully more!

PERKS!

I'm asking for $5,000. I figure this will cover most of the costs for what I'm looking to do and will pay for studio time and producer stuff to make it awesome. I'm not sure how much that will cost, but I have a feeling that it'll be a big ol' chunk.
There's also some musicians that will be playing on it and I'd really like to be able to pay them!
And then there's the actual CDs themselves. This will help pay to get them printed.

What you'll get!
I'm working on new merch stuff and this will all be available to you, as will all my old stuff: tshirts, buttons, stickers, etc.
At a certain level, you'll get a digital download of the CDs, early, before they're officially released.
A little higher and we'll have other perks, like my USB drives with exclusive content, including the new CDs.
Stay tuned. I'll be adding new stuff as we go!

If we don't make the goal, all the money raised will still go towards producing this CDs. I'll just figure out different ways to make it on the budget that we do get to work with. 

What this means...

   This is the section where they tell me I should write about the impact of this project.
   Look, I'm just a guy who has fallen in love with music, at a later stage than most folks! I absolutely love it. I love making music, I love listening and getting inspired by it, I love being able to say, confidently, that I am a musician. Maybe just an average one, but I'm happy with that, too. 
   My first EP, made with the help of amazing friends like you, through Indiegogo, was an amazing, gratifying, confidence-building, ego-stripping experience. It made me realize that this life-path, for lack of a better phrase, that I've chosen IS, in fact, the one I should be on. It brought me more joy than most things I've done. 
   YOU and folks like you helped me experience that and I can never express my gratitude. And I hope you enjoyed it, too!
   So I'm asking you to come on this ride with me again. I feel good with the songs I'm writing and I think... hope... you'll like them, too. 

Other Ways You Can Help

This is the part where they tell me I should tell you what you can do, even if you can't help financially. There's tonnes! You can share this to your friends and family on your social network stuff. You can come to a show, if I'm playing in your area.
Or, you can just give me a smile and/or a hug and tell me you're happy. That'll make my day. 

Thanks for listening and, if you've made it this far down the page, you are an amazing, caring person and I adore you!

story:
Sundae + Mr. Goessl: A musical love story <3

In 2013, Kate Voss asked Jason Goessl if he'd like to play music. Neither of them knew that his simple of answer of "yes" would change their lives forever. 

After a year of practicing, arranging and branding themselves as "Sundae + Mr. Goessl", Kate and Jason became a couple and released their debut album, Cheek to Cheek. They have since booked 3 national tours, recorded and produced a 2nd album and got married. As it turns out, the mutual love of music can form a pretty strong bond!

Sundae + Mr. Goessl are currently working on funding a 3rd album, Makes My Heart Sway. This album is particularly important for a few reasons: 

  • We are using this album as a platform to jump into mainstream media (ie. national radio, internet, television)
  • This will be our 2nd commercial release. We want to come back in with a BANG!
  • The title track of our album (Makes My Heart Sway) was written by Mr. Goessl as a love song to Sundae. It means a lot to both of us. 

What we are asking for is a chance to bring our duo and our music to the world. With your help, we will be able to get our music out to virtually every part of the country (and other countries too!), we will be able to participate in national/international touring in support of this album and you get to ride with us all along the way! A true mom and pop music story. 

What We Need & What You Get

We are trying to raise $10,000! That's a huge number! Here's what we need it for:

  • Mastering $900
  • Licensing $1600
  • Duplication $1500
  • Publicity/Marketing $4000
  • New Merchandise $2000
We are also REALLY excited to offer some unique and amazing perks such as:
  • The album! All done up and perfectly packaged. 
  • Sundae + Mr. Goessl playing cards with download!
  • Sundae + Mr. Goessl bandanas for the cowboys and cowgirls!
  • House concerts! 
  • Song requests! (Seriously, you choose a song and we arrange and record it for you!!)
  • Free passes to VIP shows!
  • A few lucky folks will get a MELODICA!!!!
  • Lots of other swag! (Cheek to Cheek flasks, download cards, personalized songs and dedications, T-shirts, stickers etc)
We are making this album no matter what. So, if we don't reach our goal--it's still coming out! We will do the best we can with what we have, just as we've always done. 

The Impact

Kate and Jason have both played music their entire lives. A craft that has been carefully honed for 30 years! We both feel hugely fortunate to have met one another and to be playing the type of music that we do. We make people happy. We want to continue that all across the globe and bring joy to people everywhere! YOU INCLUDED! 

  • For the older generation, it brings back wonderful memories. We've performed in retirement homes before and talked endlessly with people who had many beautiful flash backs to share. 
  • For the younger generation, we are reinvigorating a genre long-passed, bringing life and excitement to these old tunes. 
  • There's joy to be had with music. Playing it. Listening to it. Discovering it. Sharing it. When Sundae + Mr. Goessl tour and folks hear us for the first time, it is truly magical. For everyone. 
  • Connecting with people is our main goal. Without you, where would we be? And vice versa! We are all community and we should all support each other. The world is a good place when we connect with one another. And music is our vehicle for that!
With all of our successes so far, I know this album will be a hit. With 3 national tours under our belt and over 1000 copies of Cheek to Cheek sold with NO help from agencies, we feel that we are ready for this next big step. We've come a long way from rehearsals in the living room!

Risks & Challenges

Getting 500+ CDs in the hands of DJs at radio stations across the US is no small task. This takes a professional, established publicist and promotions expert! Someone seasoned in the business. This is a tough job with no guarantees. The music biz is fickle and ever-changing. BUT that won't stop us from doing what we do: touring, playing and delighting folks on the daily. Like we said--this album is coming out no matter WHAT!

Other Ways You Can Help

We love your support! If you cannot contribute $ to this campaign, here are other ways you can support us in the community:

  • Share! Share this campaign with people you know and people who like unique and local talent! Share our music with folks who you think would like us! http://www.sundaeandmrgoessl.com/
  • Like and follow us on social media! www.facebook.com/sundaeandmrgoessl
  • Watch our videos online! www.youtube.com/sundaeandmrgoessl
  • Come see a SHOW! Our shows are often FREE! And many of them are all ages, so you don't even need to get a babysitter!
story_txt:
Sundae + Mr. Goessl: A musical love story <3 In 2013, Kate Voss asked Jason Goessl if he'd like to play music. Neither of them knew that his simple of answer of "yes" would change their lives forever. 
After a year of practicing, arranging and branding themselves as "Sundae + Mr. Goessl", Kate and Jason became a couple and released their debut album, Cheek to Cheek. They have since booked 3 national tours, recorded and produced a 2nd album and got married. As it turns out, the mutual love of music can form a pretty strong bond!
Sundae + Mr. Goessl are currently working on funding a 3rd album, Makes My Heart Sway. This album is particularly important for a few reasons: 

We are using this album as a platform to jump into mainstream media (ie. national radio, internet, television) This will be our 2nd commercial release. We want to come back in with a BANG!
The title track of our album (Makes My Heart Sway) was written by Mr. Goessl as a love song to Sundae. It means a lot to both of us.   What we are asking for is a chance to bring our duo and our music to the world. With your help, we will be able to get our music out to virtually every part of the country (and other countries too!), we will be able to participate in national/international touring in support of this album and you get to ride with us all along the way! A true mom and pop music story.    What We Need & What You Get We are trying to raise $10,000! That's a huge number! Here's what we need it for:  Mastering $900
Licensing $1600
Duplication $1500
Publicity/Marketing $4000
New Merchandise $2000

The album! All done up and perfectly packaged. 
Sundae + Mr. Goessl playing cards with download!

House concerts!

story:
What's a Toebow?

Toebow (pronounced tō-bō) is a 5-piece rock band from Brooklyn, NY. Started as a guitar duo in 2012, the project has gradually expanded into the current line-up of players: Nate Ulsh, Martin Zimmermann, Maia Friedman, Jo-Anne Hyun and Charlie Kessenich. The music of Toebow draws from various influences ranging from Frank Zappa, Malian guitar riffs, the percussive styles of Krautrock and the quirky synth tones of Talking Heads. The Toebow sound incorporates vintage analogue synthesizers, 80's drum machines, male and female vocal harmonies, and a syncopated rhythm section, while maintaining our original identity as a melodic guitar duo. 

Our Mission

Toebow is excited to announce that the band is ready to record our first full-length album. We've booked recording time at the Isokon Studio in Woodstock, NY, the laboratory of engineer and producer D. James Goodwin. We chose Goodwin based on his reputation for an irreverent approach to recording and his unusual arsenal of equipment and instruments. His progressive approach to recording is exactly what we need to capture the sound of Toebow. Martin and Maia know the strength of Goodwin's recording style having recorded with him in their previous band Bobby (Partisan Records). 

We're thrilled to share our music with you, but in order to make the album a reality we are going to need your help. Making an album is an expensive process. 

We are asking for your generous financial support in assisting with some critical expenses: recording, mixing and eventually mastering our album. We sincerely appreciate any assistance in helping us make this album become a reality. From the entire Toebow gang, Thank You.

story:
I'm Back!

What's up everyone? For those of you who don't know me, my name is Jake, aka Zer0 Gravity, and I'm a rapper. If the name sounds familiar, that's because I've crowdfunded here before, raising over $1000  to help fund the first phase of my album.

Thanks guys!!

After successfully selecting the instrumentals and purchasing them, I moved into the recording stage. Since I have completed the recording, I'm ready to hop into the final stage of my crowdfunding. Thanks to you guys, I was able to fund every single beat using donations! Some of the beats were pretty expensive, but I was able to have a surplus of $100!

This one hurt particularly bad...

You're probably wondering, what does a 19-year-old college kid do with $2000 total? That's a great question. I spent the first half on the beats. About $900 to be exact. But that was just the beats.

The mixing/mastering costs $999, which is a lot of money. With the surplus of $100 from the last campaign, I'm asking for another $900 to afford the mixing and mastering of my album.

Why Does My Album Need Mixing and Mastering?

Because I sure can't do it. Trust me, I've tried.

The last album that I made was funded only by myself. I bought skeezy little beat packages that were basically luck of the draw and used the free month trial of Adobe Auditon to mix and master the vocals. And the vocals sounded like trash (my opinion!).

Try as I might, I don't think I'll ever master the Parametric Equalizer

This is because mixing your own vocals is an extremely difficult thing to do, and I don't know how to do it, so I don't want to do it again.

For an album I've worked so hard on, I don't want the vocals to sound too loud or unbalanced because that would ruin the whole project. That would be sad.

I know, I know. $999 for something I could technically do myself? Sounds like a lot. Well, then you probably haven't listened to my first album.

It was like someone cranked up the bass on my voice and I had no idea how to fix it

If you compare the way my voice sounds to a mainstream artist's voice, you will definitely hear why I need to get my album sent off to get professionally mixed and mastered. The proof is in the pudding, I promise you that.

Why Should You Help Me?

If that header sounds snarky I'm sorry. It's hard to convey tone over text.

If you don't know me, you're might be thinking of me as some kid who's just trying to throw an album on Soundcloud to get internet famous for a few days. I promise you that that is not the case.

I want to go on tour, make music videos, connect with people, and really make something out of this.

If I get famous you can come fly with me in my future private jet!

My dream is to be able to go on stage at a show, and afterward get to hang out with people who like my music. I have a whole life in my head, one where I do this music thing for a career. It's what I love to do and it's never failed me.

If I sound corny or anything, I'm not going to apologize! If I do, it's because I truly mean it. It's something I've wanted for such a long time and I really think that if I work at this enough I can get it.

 

Hey it's me!

I came into college with the idea that I would graduate and become a researcher. Then I realized that I wouldn't enjoy a life sitting at a lab bench without getting to utilize my creativity. And that's when I started really thinking about what I wanted with my life.

And that's when I started the first phase of this campaign.

If I could, I would just buy everything myself. But, financially speaking, I can't do that right now. That's why I need you guys.

But Wait, There's More!

There are some pretty sweet rewards that come with helping me out. My personal favorite is the one where I give you some of the lyrics that I've never used. Some of them are years old, so I promise you that some of them are terrible. And you will enjoy them.

Here's a short segment of one of them:

Rock just like the Casbah, but I know I can't do squats, because that might break my heart, like literally, straight up

Amazing

I will freestyle rap to you. Over the phone. Over Skype. In person. I don't care. I'm not great at thinking on my feet so that'll probably be comedic.

If you were around for my first phase, then you saw the big prize at the bottom. If you're wondering, yes, of course, my Timbs are still available! I'll sign them if you want me to, but I mean they're Timbs so you might not want that. You in the market for some Timbs?

Please, somebody buy my Timbs. They don't fit me they're size 12

 

Check out some of the other prizes too! They're pretty awesome!

Also, random fun fact, I've been waiting for a while now but a member of the band X Ambassadors should be getting into contact with me sometime soon. If that ever happens I'll post an update about it to let you know what it was all about!

Risks

Indiegogo suggests I make a section about the risks associated with my project. And there is a big one. If you play my album upon its final release, whatever you're playing it off of might catch fire. Especially if it's a Samsung Note. 

Semi-topical joke

I'm really sorry for that. I promise it was a joke.

Final Word

To anybody who made it this far, thank you so much! If you help me out with any amount, big or small, I will appreciate it so much.

Just knowing that there are people out there who are willing to help me out means the world to me. 

If you can't help me by giving money, or even if you do pledge, please share this on Facebook and Twitter and Google+ (no one uses it but why not) or any other social networking site. Exposure will help me out a whole lot, so I'd really appreciate that!

Thank you all so much for helping me make my dream come true. You're the best :)

New Song Tidbits!

Below are some previews to 3 of the tracks on my album. Enjoy!

The 3 tidbits, and all of my songs right now are unmastered. The tidbits are parts of songs that I need to get mixed and mastered for my album, which you can probably tell by listening to them.

Tidbit 1

This is probably going to be the opener on the track due to its energy. Also, I think the beat is amazing. The first day I heard it I went outside, listened to it on repeat, and ran around the track for a while.

 
Tidbit 2
This is a song I made to prove that I can rap fast because some people only think talent comes from that ability. I'm basically just trying to prove myself here. Call it petty, but it had to be done. I also think the lyrics are good too; it's not just a throwaway to prove a point.

 

Tidbit 3

This song is more of just me having fun on a beat. I talk about my aspirations and goals a little bit, my past, etc. I cover a lot of ground on this track, which you probably won't be able to tell from within this preview, but I promise you I do.

 

Old Music/Videos

These are some of my older songs and videos that I made a while back. Check them out if you'd like!

GONE

This is my freshman album. It's free to download and I have included some of the tracks below. Click on the link below to be taken to my Bandcamp page with my full album on it. Take a listen! It's also on all major streaming platforms if you'd rather listen there. Just search 'Zer0 Gravity' and I'll show up somewhere.

https://zer0gravityrap.bandcamp.com/releases

Summertime

This was the closer on my first album 'GONE'. It's a song I wrote to commemorate my youth as well as the friends that I had made throughout my childhood. It was so much fun to write.

 

Scopin' 2 Music Video (Viewer Discretion Is Advised)

This is a music video I made a few years ago for my song "Scopin' 2". It's a part of a storyline I concocted about being an assassin. This is just me having fun with rap, and I love making music videos too so I guess here's one of them!

 

Baseline Performed Live

Here's a video of my friends and I performing our song "Baseline" live. I love performing live.

 
 

Thanks Again!

You guys are great and I love you all. Hopefully this gets completed and I can get this album off of the ground!

If you have any questions, feel free to drop a comment or email me at zer0gravityrap@gmail.com

Thank you!

Sincerely,

Jake, aka Zer0 Gravity

story:
Our Mission

So far, we have booked a few local shows in our area, but touring is expensive. There are a lot of associated costs to do it well. We want to be able to bring our fans a comprehensive and powerful performance! The more places we can get to this year, the more we can offer our genuine brand of music to you. 

Being able to perform over 30 dates this year is the bands goal. Doing so will mean we have accomplished more than ever before, but we need your help! Our fans and supporters are everything to our success.

Brett, Chris and Warren thank you,

What We Need & What You Get

I will keep it simple

  • $2,000 to support touring costs
  • This money will used for the following:
    • travel costs - this includes fuel, rentals and hospitality
    • merchandise - its expensive to produce, but goes a long way to a bands success
    • content production - items like band photos and live video during performances
  • The give back to you are these:
    • sharing an amazing experience with this band. A strong intrinsic value
    • you will be given pieces of our experience. This will include live performances and access to the bands catalog of music and merchandise

The Impact

The result of a successful tour, could lead to massive opportunity potential for the band. Playing in a original band is tough work. It requires a ton of man hours, for often a very limited return. The only way bands can be successful, in any measure, is to expose their music. The best way to do this is still through live performance. 

Your help will  drive our careers as artists forward. 

Risks & Challenges

There are always risks and challenges when touring. The unexpected costs, like vehicles breaking down, bands not showing up, equipment malfunctioning. These are just a small summary of costs that come up during tour. Being prepared for them, and having the appropriate resources really  assists in mitigating these pitfalls.

We have a smart strategy in place to avoid many of these things from occurring. We have put in the man hours and preparation strategy necessary to make this tour successful. Money is the only inhibitor.

We appreciate all your support and help!

Other Ways You Can Help

Please visit our social media outlets.

www.congressionmusic.com

www.facebook.com/congression

www.youtube.com/user/congressionband

story:
Michael Priest: The Preamble (a stand-up comedy album in 3 parts)

+ Comedian from Austin, Texas. + Shut-in

I love comedy and have every day for 8 years, except like 4 months. I would like to make an album. If you're like me you find it hard to listen an hour or content so I'm breaking the album into 3 EPs for those so inclined. Will this be the best album every made? Yah. You will help me make something that, hopefully, doesn't suck and that you don't have to pretend to like?

 

With the album proceeds I will also be able to pay Marshall, my landlord.

 

What We Need & What You Get

To record and produce the album/EPs this Fall we need: 

  • an audio engineer
  • to rent a venue and equipment 
  • post-production engineering
  • pre-release marketing and press 

If I don't reach the total goal amount: I will make a shittier album with second rate help. 

 

Why you should care enough to help make this comedy album:

  • Trump doesn't want this album to be made.
  • I'm real good at making content and shit. 
  • Free Speech. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate please share and talk about me on all the social media. 

Check out my Twitter and Instagram for show dates and listen to my podcast with Kat Ramzinski: Fox and Foes 

 

(Thanks to Erin Holsonback for the photos!)

story:
While you’re enjoying the longest days, we are planning the Longest Night!

 

Longest Night Society is developing a semi-professional chamber orchestra in Yukon with a focus on new music composed and arranged by northerners. 

 

With your help, we can build the capacity and profile of the Problematic Orchestra, commission more new music and perform more concerts.  Now in its 3rd year, the Problematic Orchestra is well known for its iconic winter solstice concerts on December 20/21 at Yukon Arts Centre.  It offers a unique, fresh and slightly quirky take on orchestral music. 

 

We are looking for your support!  You are musically adventurous, you love orchestral music but are hungry for something new and different, you proudly support local musicians and composers and value our unique cultural community.  Together we will make beautiful music!

story:
Brass Tacks

Most of you guys know me as Ricky from Sleepaway Camp more than as a musician.  That's okay.  It is pretty cool to be a part of something that never grows old.  

I guess that is how I feel about my music.  I watched The Who with my son one Super Bowl Sunday in 2014 instead of the game (I am a terrible father).  Pete Townshend and Roger Daltrey seemed absolutely ageless while on stage.  Music has that effect on both performer and audience.  That is why I want to make, and then tour, this album!

If you donate you become part of the project.  Not a peripheral part but an integral part.  There will be perks on here and I will get to those, but I will truly owe you.

The Big Tamale

I have already spent about $5000 of my own money.  I figure I need another $4000 to get it done (I hope).  I am only asking you guys for $2000.  If I can get that it will give me time to work for the rest of it.  I was just certified as a USPTA tennis professional.  I need a little time to build my roster of students.

The Impact

As I mentioned before this album has a lot of interest.  I already know two major TV network producers and two legendary film producers who are waiting for its completion.  

Trent Berry (my producer and guitar God) has designed these songs in a way that is more marketable than anything I have done before.  I wasn't sure I would like that, but these songs are just as honest and true to me as anything I wrote all by myself.  

Risks & Challenges

Making records is difficult.  I have lost friends, pissed off family members, fired (some quit) band mates and generally lost my mind every single time I have done this.  Somehow I get it   done.  I have never set out to make a record that has not been completed.  If you donate, you have my word.

Other Ways You Can Help

I know what it is like to be broke.  I know what it is like right now.  If you can't afford it do not do it!  I don't want anyone to put themselves in a bad spot just because you were trying to help.  Spread the word.  Listen to the music with friends and family at a BBQ (my favorite).  Write a review on one of the sites it is on.  All of that is invaluable and very much appreciated.

story:
QUI SUIS-JE?

Je suis originaire de Haïfa en Israël. À l’age de 6 ans, j’ai émigré en France avec ma famille et à 30 ans j’ai émigré au Canada où je suis maintenant résident permanent.

La guitare a toujours fait partie de ma vie, j’ai commencé à l’âge de 8 ans avec la guitare classique espagnole puis ensuite je me suis intéressé à d'autres styles : jazz, rock, reggae, musique brésilienne, juive… J’ai beaucoup joué en France dans des groupes et projets variés, puis à 26 ans j’ai eu un profond besoin de revenir à mon premier amour : la guitare classique. 

Pendant 7 ans,  je me suis donc plongé corps et âme dans ce retour aux sources et après une maîtrise en guitare classique à l’Université de Montréal, j’ai décidé d'élaborer ma propre musique en mélangeant toutes mes influences. 

Entre 2012 et 2015, j’ai auto-produit 3 albums regroupant reprises et compositions, et effectué des concerts et tournées au Canada, aux USA et en Israel, en solo ou avec mon quartet. Ma participation au Festival de Jazz de Montréal en 2016 a été un bel encouragement pour poursuivre dans cette voie.

[ voir la vidéo du concert ]

 

UN ALBUM CONCEPT 

Le désir de créer un album encore plus personnel et intime a alors émergé. Un album concept contenant uniquement des compositions originales pensées autour d’une unité thématique est né : Oriental Blue.

J’ai alors imaginé une suite musicale autour de ce thème en sélectionnant parmi mes compositions des pièces à couleurs orientale et méditerranéenne et en en créant de nouvelles dans la même inspiration.

Visionnez la première vidéo (haut de page) pour en savoir plus, et... je vous conseille d'attendre la fin ;)

En 2017 on m’a proposé de participer à un concert à Paris. Comme il était compliqué de former un quartet sur place, j’ai décidé d’expérimenter le projet en duo. J’ai donc invité un ami de longue date, avec qui j'ai souvent joué à Paris, le saxophoniste Mathias Wallerand, avec l'intuition que cette musique allait parler à ses origines libano-arméniennes.

L’alchimie a été immédiate et Mathias est venu à son tour en octobre 2017 peaufiner cette musique avec moi et nous avons effectué une tournée au Québec et en Ontario, dans plusieurs lieux dont le Rex Jazz Club à Toronto.

 
En mars 2018, lors d’un bref séjour à Paris, nous en avons profité pour enregistrer le projet. Il restait ensuite toutes les étapes de post-production à réaliser (mixage, mastering, pochette, promotion…) et une tournée de lancement à organiser pour que ce projet prenne vie!
 

POURQUOI VOTRE SOUTIEN?

Nous connaissons tous l'évolution actuelle de l'industrie du disque liée à internet et au streaming. Les CDs ne se vendent plus en magasin, les revenus digitaux sont minuscules, les petits labels disparaissent et les gros labels guidés par le profit ne prennent plus de risques... Cette nouvelle réalité oblige les artistes indépendants à devenir à la fois compositeurs, créateurs, producteurs, managers, babysitters, j’en passe et des meilleures ;)

C'est pourquoi, il m'a fallu investir plus de 5000$ en enregistrement, mixage, mastering, infographie, duplication, promotion (rédaction, communication et diffusion) pour vous offrir un produit de haute qualité. 

Donc bonne nouvelle, aucun risque à l'horizon! L'album est déjà produit et vous êtes garantis de recevoir vos cadeaux en retour de votre soutien :)

La somme récoltée me permettra de couvrir mes dépenses et d'imaginer un rayonnement au delà des frontières canadiennes. En effet, j'ai l'ambition de faire voyager ce projet en Amérique du Nord, en Europe et au Moyen-Orient!

Soutenir ce projet vous donne l'occasion de faire partie de cette aventure et de posséder l'album physique car le CD ne se trouvera pas en magasin. Vous découvrirez ainsi le texte descriptif poétique original écrit spécialement pour le projet et la pochette conceptuelle au design insolite.

Je vous invite à découvrir toutes les offres que j'ai pensées pour vous comme témoignage de ma gratitude!

AUTRES FAÇONS D'AIDER

Pour aider, vous pouvez aussi parler de cette campagne, des concerts de lancement, vous abonner à mon infolettre ou tout simplement partager l’information à vos amis.

J’espère sincèrement que vous apprécierez ce projet qui me tient énormément à coeur et sur lequel je travaille ardemment depuis plusieurs années. Je suis très excité de vous le dévoiler!

Hâte d'avoir vos impressions et de vous rencontrer, je l'espère, à un des concerts de lancement :)

Samuel

story:
Hello friends and family of the rock musics! We are asking for some help to get on our feet to finish up our new record  and deliver some fiery new licks!

In return for your support and awesomeness we have put together some cool pre-order packages, available exclusively for this campaign! 

Don't forget to follow and share our Spotify and let us know what cities to come to...

https://open.spotify.com/follow/1/?uri=spotify:..."

We're ultra excited for you to hear our new direction and can't wait for this special release!

Thank you for supporting our indie asses and helping us spread the word... We will see you soon!

Love,

LNF

story:
Beneath The Night Sky

This CD began two years ago when a guitar of mine was broken that previously belonged to a deceased friend. I was quite upset about this however a few nights later, I laid down on the grass looking up to the stars. This gave me a sense of peace with everything that had recently happened and it was the catalyst for me to start composing Beneath The Night Sky. I have spent countless nights awake composing and fine tuning each song. I worked very hard throughout 2017 to pay for a Seaboard which was used throughout this CD. 

I was very lucky to have my good friend Perrin produce and engineer this CD. He is a classically trained violinist however produces electronic music. He was the perfect producer for the job as he was able to help me find the balance between classical music as well as post rock. 

We were scheduled to record this CD from January through to June however he relocated to the UK at the end of February. I was going to have my dear friend Jordan be the assistant producer for this album but he sadly passed away soon before we commenced recording. He did record my harp on one song and he played guitar on that same song. There were many hardships along the way with this project however we managed to record all of it by the end of February. Both Sleepy J and Tim Fischer have been featured as accompanying musicians on this CD.

Perrin has done an amazing job mixing this CD and it is about to get mastered. Soon afterwards I will be getting the CDs pressed and I will hold a launch concert. The funding will go towards the CDs being pressed and the launch concert.

 

Rewards

  • Digital Downloads
  • Physical CDs
  • Musical Instruments
  • Harp Lessons
  • Recording Sessions
  • Live concerts

story:
BREAK MY FEARS

Do you remember a time when you have been crippled by the weight of fear? I have. For the last 7 or so years I have had the awesome opportunity writing worship songs to the Lord. It’s actually one of the main ways that I spend time with the Lord. I open up the scriptures, read, meditate, and part of my response is through song. I remember moments of tremendous peace in difficult times, joy in heavy times, and gratitude when faced with inconvenient situations. But if I’m being completely honest, my hang up has been being faithful in sharing these songs. I actually have had a similar response to Moses:

But Moses said to the LORD, “Oh, my Lord, I am not eloquent, either in the past or since you have spoken to your servant, but I am slow of speech and of tongue.” - Exodus 4:10

I’ve made so many excuses over the years. Just ask my wife! Just like in the parable of the talents in Matthew 25:14-30, I am the servant that has buried his one talent and kept it to himself. But just like the Lord has called the servants to be faithful and invest what they have, the Lord has called me to be faithful in sharing my music. I am excited and honestly frightened to announce my very first campaign to release a 5-Song EP in 2019! After much time of prayer we are calling it “BREAK MY FEARS”. Those three words are the very journey I’ve been on and it’s what I have been singing and praying over the last year. As the Lord leads & guides, I believe that the Lord will provide for exactly what He wants. We are praying boldly that the Lord would provide for a total 5-song EP, but we also know that “A man's heart plans his course, but the LORD directs his steps” (Proverbs 16:9). Ultimately we are open to all that the Lord is going to do! Would you be willing to consider joining me on this next step of the journey?

PRODUCER

I am excited to announce that I am partnering with Phil Shawel who is a producer based out of Illinois. Phil has worked with many great artists including Vertical Worship, Willow Creek Music, Central Live, Cherry Hills Worship & more!

story:
An Introduction...

We are The Autumnatic, a band from Grand Rapids, MI.

We've been working on our debut album and we are hoping you will consider being part of our team! Since The Autumnatic came together over two years ago, we have grown not only as musicians and songwriters, but we have been able to share our music with thousands of people! In order to take our collection of songs to as many people as possible, we need to produce an album that showcases what we have worked so hard to create. That of course isn’t something that happens for free, and the industry contacts, friends, and shows will only take us so far. That is why we need your help financially. 

What We Need

We're aiming for a goal of $10,000 to help us cover:

  • Engineering 
  • Mixing
  • Mastering
  • Pressing (creation of the physical album)
  • Digital Distribution
  • Advertising and Promotion of the album
  • Merchandise

We realize this number might seem like a lot to some, but as you can see, there is a lot more to putting out an album than meets the eye. While we have covered some of what is on this list by playing shows, everything on this list begins to add up quickly! Our proposed goal will cover all costs associated with the creation of this album. If we exceed this goal, this will allow additional promotion of the album, design and printing of merchandise, and necessary instrument maintenance and upgrades.

What You Can Get

  • Early Access to the Album
  • Private House Concerts
  • Handwritten lyric sheets
  • An Invitation to our Private Album Listening Party
  • Check the Rewards section to see a full list!

As we make progress on this project, you'll also receive updates, videos of us abusing Scott, and sneak peaks of the songs as they come along! 

The Impact

We're so excited to share our debut album with you! Over the past year we have written quite a collection of songs, and we've narrowed it down to what we feel are the strongest.

Drawing diverse influence across all genres, we've found ourselves being described as: Pop-Rock Baptized in Blues & R&B. It’s honest, energetic and most of all...FUN! We've been getting a terrific reaction to these songs everywhere we've played them live, and we want to share them in a fresh new way, and reach even more people with them!! 

We feel so lucky to have met so many people and made so many awesome fans in our time as a band, and we want to be able to share our hard work with you in the form of lovingly and expertly captured songs.

Risks & Challenges

There are always risks and challenges whenever it comes to a project like this. One of the big ones is promoting the album. In this "digital age" we live in, music is accessible on every device imaginable, at any time, in any place. That has its advantages and disadvantages.

We want to reach the largest audience possible and the biggest challenges we're facing are what we need your help on the most. Your donation goes towards more than just the creation of the album. It will also help us do things such as...

  • Sponsor advertisements
  • Hire a PR team to plug our music into blogs, radio stations and streaming playlists (think Spotify: New Release Friday, and New Music Radar)

 

We get it, sometimes you just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean YOU can't help in a HUGE way:

  • It would mean so much to us if you guys shared this with all of your friends and families!
  • Share this campaign on social media using the IndieGoGo sharing tools!
  • Talk to that one co-worker who always has their headphones in...they probably listen to a bunch of music!!

We know we're asking for a lot, and we don't take this lightly. This band, and our fans, have made some of our wildest dreams come true, and this album means the world to us. We can't wait to share over two years worth of hard work with you.

We Love You. 

Thank You. 

We'll See You Soon.

-Aladin, Caleb, Nick Arthur, Scott
story_txt:
An Introduction...
We are The Autumnatic, a band from Grand Rapids, MI.
We've been working on our debut album and we are hoping you will consider being part of our team! Since The Autumnatic came together over two years ago, we have grown not only as musicians and songwriters, but we have been able to share our music with thousands of people! In order to take our collection of songs to as many people as possible, we need to produce an album that showcases what we have worked so hard to create. That of course isn’t something that happens for free, and the industry contacts, friends, and shows will only take us so far. That is why we need your help financially. 

What We Need
We're aiming for a goal of $10,000 to help us cover:

Engineering 
Mixing
Mastering
Pressing (creation of the physical album)
Digital Distribution
Advertising and Promotion of the album
Merchandise

We realize this number might seem like a lot to some, but as you can see, there is a lot more to putting out an album than meets the eye. While we have covered some of what is on this list by playing shows, everything on this list begins to add up quickly! Our proposed goal will cover all costs associated with the creation of this album. If we exceed this goal, this will allow additional promotion of the album, design and printing of merchandise, and necessary instrument maintenance and upgrades.
What You Can Get

Early Access to the Album
Private House Concerts
Handwritten lyric sheets
An Invitation to our Private Album Listening Party
Check the Rewards section to see a full list!

As we make progress on this project, you'll also receive updates, videos of us abusing Scott, and sneak peaks of the songs as they come along! 

The Impact
We're so excited to share our debut album with you! Over the past year we have written quite a collection of songs, and we've narrowed it down to what we feel are the strongest.
Drawing diverse influence across all genres, we've found ourselves being described as: Pop-Rock Baptized in Blues & R&B. It’s honest, energetic and most of all...FUN! We've been getting a terrific reaction to these songs everywhere we've played them live, and we want to share them in a fresh new way, and reach even more people with them!! 
We feel so lucky to have met so many people and made so many awesome fans in our time as a band, and we want to be able to share our hard work with you in the form of lovingly and expertly captured songs.

Risks & Challenges
There are always risks and challenges whenever it comes to a project like this. One of the big ones is promoting the album. In this "digital age" we live in, music is accessible on every device imaginable, at any time, in any place. That has its advantages and disadvantages.
We want to reach the largest audience possible and the biggest challenges we're facing are what we need your help on the most. Your donation goes towards more than just the creation of the album. It will also help us do things such as...

Sponsor advertisements
Hire a PR team to plug our music into blogs, radio stations and streaming playlists (think Spotify: New Release Friday, and New Music Radar)


 
We get it, sometimes you just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean YOU can't help in a HUGE way:

It would mean so much to us if you guys shared this with all of your friends and families!
Share this campaign on social media using the IndieGoGo sharing tools!
Talk to that one co-worker who always has their headphones in...they probably listen to a bunch of music!!

We know we're asking for a lot, and we don't take this lightly. This band, and our fans, have made some of our wildest dreams come true, and this album means the world to us. We can't wait to share over two years worth of hard work with you.We Love You. Thank You. We'll See You Soon.-Aladin, Caleb, Nick Arthur, Scott

story:
About Me

Hey, I'm Ryan Smith, 29 years old,  founder & owner of i99Radio.com which I started June 1st 2014! I started this radio station, to let the world know about the different types & diverse alternative rock music there! I also wanted to keep it commercial free, and available to the world while playing local Philadelphia music, mixing it in with smaller indie rock bands around the world, and including main stream rock bands as well. 

The past 4 years have been the best years of my life. Because of this, I've been able to meet so many incredible bands, make new friends, interview artist I never dreamed I would have been able to, and more so recently, been photographing shows in photo pits by obtaining photo passes. 

Right now, I'm ready to take on my next journey, and to launch an i99Radio app that is available worldwide for everyone to use! I hope you can help me with this process by donating to my Indiegogo campaign. 

The Cost

I've been in talks with two local app developer teams in the Philadelphia area. They have both quoted me approximately $4,500 to get this app perfect & include all the features we want. I set the goal for $5,500, with some stretch goals because I'm sure there will be some extra costs along the way & leaves some breathing room for any potential problems. 

Features in the app

The finished app will have the following included: 

  • Total listening: including background listening & listening while exploring on the app!
  • Daily Contests: we will have different contests daily for free signed band merch, tickets to shows around the world, i99Radio merch & more!
  • Complete Interaction: Our new app will include a chatbox where you can interact live with other listeners & the DJ’s / admins!
  • Set Alarm: Have a daily alarm set so you can wake up to i99Radio every morning!
  • Check the last 10 songs that played on i99Radio
  • Voice in: Send a recording (upto 30 seconds) to us chatting with the DJ or requesting a song, right from the app! No additional things needed! 
  • Vote Up/ Vote Down: Your opinions are important to us. We’re finally implementing a voting system where you can let us know which song you like or dislike. Furthermore, you will be able to see all the songs you have liked in your user profile, so you can remember that cool song you just discovered later on!
  • New Music Discovery: Every week there will be a new update on the i99Radio New Music Discovery page - where you will discover a new band, and have access to download their latest song / album or EP for FREE. We're currently working with many artists around the world to include them in this feature. 
  • Switch mode: Go from dark to light mode with one tap (like Twitter, Youtube & Twitch) so you can use what your eyes prefer! 

Rewards: 

We have many rewards we are giving out, including signed CD Booklets from Imagine Dragons, The 1975, Twenty One Pilots, Wolf Alice, Bishop Briggs, Vance Joy & Much more! 

We also have many signed photos we're giving away, including Paramore, Panic! At the Disco, Imagine Dragons, Twenty One Pilots & more! 

Can't contribute that much? No problem! Donate $3 to have your name on our website, or $5 to get the app ad free for a year! ($29 value when we launch it!) 

Some Autographed / Signed CD Booklets we are giving away: 

The Record Company – All Of This Life

Dawes – Passwords

The Mighty Mighty Bosstones – While We're At It

Chvrches – Love Is Dead

Bullet For My Valentine – Gravity

Jim James – Uniform Distortion

The Glitch Mob – See Without Eyes

Bishop Briggs – Church Of Scars

Dashboard Confessional – Crooked Shadows

Brian Fallon – Sleepwalkers

Wolf Alice – Visions Of A Life

K.Flay – Every Where Is Some Where

Cold War Kids – LA Divine

Glass Animals – How To Be A Human Being

Courtney Barnett – Tell Me How You Really Feel Deluxe Edition

5 Seconds Of Summer – Youngblood

Imagine Dragons – Evolve (2 available)

Imagine Dragons – Smoke + Mirrors  (3 available)

Twenty One Pilots – Trench

James Bay – Electric

Lord Huron – Vide Noir

Alex Clare – Tail Of Lions

Jimmy Eat World – Integrity Blues

Vance Joy – Nation Of Two

The 1975 – I Like It When You Sleep, for You Are So Beautiful Yet So Unaware of It

Thirty Seconds To Mars - America 

 

*** REPRINT*** Autographed photos: 

Twenty One Pilots

Imagine Dragons

The Killers

Foo Fighters

Brendon Urie

Pearl Jam

The 1975

Kongos

Green Day

Linkin Park

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand not everyone can help. But one thing that is free is sharing the link to this to your friends, family & using the social media icons listed on this page! And let everyone you know who is into alternative rock music know about i99Radio.com & our IndieGoGo fund campaign!

Questions? Email hello@i99radio.com!

story:
Summary

Aloha! My name is Jesand Amodo aka JehzanExclusive. I'm a 26 year old female rapper, educator, & entrepreneur from Hawaii. I've been taking music seriously for about 2 years now and have since grown into a promising local presence. But I want to try something different. Last year, I visited the Philippines for the first time in my life. I was so touched by the people and culture and I'm so eager to go back! This time, I'd like to visit Davao, Philippines because that's where my father is from and it just so happens that my good friend Jan Robancho is also from there, and currently residing there. The purpose of my trip will focus on performing and promoting my music, networking, and studying the culture. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

Basically, I need help with travel & lodging expenses. By donating, YOU get all kinds of exclusive content from me and my companies (CDs, shout outs, media services, & more)!

On top of that, you get to be part of the planning process of my first ever "mini" tour!

You will get to witness me booking shows, and all the different logistics that will go into this project. 

I'M ALSO WORKING ON MY NEWEST EP "ISLAND WAVES & CITY HAZE" (VOL. 3)

Scheduled to drop Fall 2018.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Don't worry if you are unable to contribute $$, Simply SHARING my campaign and spreading the word about my music & brand is a BIG HELP!

story:
Short Summary

My name is Dillon Vado, I'm a drummer/vibraphonist composer and educator in the San Francisco Bay Area. I started my newest band, Never Weather, in January of this year and we have been playing live shows all over the Bay Area since. 

The music I wrote for this band is very special and the way these particular people bring it all to life was nothing short of magical from our very first show. After going deeper into the pieces in various live settings, I feel that this group is ready to record an album, and the music deserves the high quality attention that can only be generated from a professional recording studio. 

This is why we need your help, recording is expensive and frankly without a little bit of outside help, this type of thing would simply never happen. Releasing a real album will help us to 

  • Get radio/internet plays and expand our audience
  • Demonstrate what the group is capable of for future opportunities and grants
  • Allow us to apply to festivals and find our way to larger, listening audiences who would really enjoy hearing our music
  • Personally document my own skills as a composer and band leader in a professional way

What We Need & What You Get

We need $5,000 to help with the recording, mixing/mastering, printing, and ultimately releasing of this album. In return for your contributions we have several exciting rewards to kick back as a thank you for contributing, including...

  • Digital download of the Album
  • Hard copy of the CD (autographed)
  • Exclusive Never Weather shirts in YOUR size
  • Annotated Scores of the pieces we record 
  • Invitation to sit in on the recording session and watch the magic!
  • Producer's Circle: Special mention in the actual CD
  • Never Weather concert in YOUR home!

The Impact

Our music aims to explore complex emotional themes through instrumental music. I've heard from audience members after shows that they "had an out of body experience that was truly transcendent" and "the music was captivating and really led me somewhere"

Music like this is unfortunately rare, and we really believe in the power of it to spread inquisitive listening, and ultimately understanding and love.

I have recorded several albums with professional musicians as a sideman including but not limited to Alan Hall's Ratatet, Erik Jekabson's Electric Squeezebox Orchestra, and String-tet, The CJC Blue Ensemble, Marcos Silva and Jackie Gage. I understand the demands of a studio session, and feel confident in my ability to lead my band through this with a successful outcome that is both expertly crafted and artistically minded. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you don't feel comfortable contributing financially, believe me, I get it! One of the ways that we can help each other out when doing things like this is simply to spread the word. Consider sharing our Indie Go Go fundraiser on social media or via email, especially with specific friends you think would enjoy the music. Also please sign up for my mailing list through my website, and like my page on facebook, Dillon Vado Music to keep in the loop with what I'm up to. 

Thanks so much!

-Dillon Vado

story:
About Cincinnati Soundbox

Since 2015, Cincinnati Soundbox has been bringing concerts of music by living composers to the Cincinnati community. We focus on raising the profile of new music in this city by presenting the music of Cincinnati composers alongside the music of composers from other cities around the world. We strive to achieve diversity in our programming, and each concert will feature a variety of musical aesthetics. This season will present premieres and performances of recent pieces by composers with ties to Cincinnati, as well as international composers from Peru, Argentina, Poland, and China, and US-based composers from New York, Boston, and Nashville. 

This campaign will help enable us to provide free concerts and to cover operational expenses, including performer fees, venue costs, instrumental rentals, etc. 

By contributing to this fundraiser, you can help sponsor the creation of new works and be a part of bringing even more new music to Cincinnati!

Click here to find our more about Cincinnati Soundbox!

 

What is the funding for?

To cover our operating costs for Season 4, we are looking for $1800. The money will go towards covering the following expenses: 

  • Performer honorariums
  • Venue fees
  • Rental and equipment costs

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute financially, you can still help! Here are some ways you can still be involved in this project: 

  • Share our campaign on your social media pages and encourage others to get involved.
  • Follow us on Facebook and Twitter.
  • Come to our concerts and help spread the word!

story:
NORTHEAST

"It's hard to tell which is heavier, the concrete sky or this tiny town. You wonder why I say I'm like the weather; as unforgiving as the January ground..." - Northeast

I’ve enjoyed some incredible adventures across a diverse range of musical landscapes in my 20+ years as a career musician. From the grange halls where I grew up learning traditional fiddle tunes to international cultural diplomacy tours and Broadway stages, I’ve been humbled and inspired by it all. Northeast is my 7th studio album, and the third with my alt-country band Daisycutter, roots music veterans all. From my farm girl roots to the cities, towns, and wide-open spaces I’ve experienced touring nationally and beyond, this album explores the stories of the Northeast, from rural to Rust Belt. This campaign will make possible not only the recording and production of the album, but enable promotional support upon its release. We are timing the campaign to end on the first day of Winter, ushering in the season of reflection and rebirth here in the Northeast.

THE ALBUM

We are taciturn upstate New Yorkers. Sharing our feelings can be an uphill battle at times for us. We're not all that comfortable in situations that can't be assuaged with a socket wrench or a casserole. We're pretty much adrift in this brave new world that thrives on the constant sharing of bits of ourselves.

We're making a new album.

We expected to be excited about this whole undertaking, and wow, are we ever inspired by the music coming out of it. But it's a little too intense to feel quite so... sparkly... Winter's long shadow is peeking around the corner. It's an honest time of year, an unyielding one, an unforgiving one. These songs are the hardy fruit borne of those creative seeds that survived the frost. We're more proud of, more invested in, and feel these songs represent us more honestly than ever. We want more than anything to release them into the light of spring. It means everything to us to be able to share our music with others who want to listen. Hopefully these songs will mean as much to you as they do to us.

If you'd like to help us bring this album to completion, read on! We have various (hopefully interesting!) ways you can choose to be involved. And your support means everything to us. We might be awkward introverts, but we know it takes a village.

Thank you, truly.

-Sara

This album is dedicated to our dear departed band mate, friend, and brother-in-music, Andy Goessling. Thank you, Andy, for casting such a long, wonderful shadow these last ten years. We will miss you more than we'll ever be able to say. (Partially because we're taciturn Northerners, and not good with words anyway.)

THE CAMPAIGN

Asking for support for this project is just as challenging as emoting for us quiet, Northern-types. But as full time working musicians, we need your help to get these songs out into the world (and also let the world know they’re out there!)

We are aiming for $15,000. Half of that will cover the cost of recording: the studio time, musicians, mixing/mastering, artwork, and production of physical copies of the album and merchandise. The other half will enable us to hire a publicist to help us get the word out to press and radio. In a digitally-driven, DIY world, that promotional support is essential to helping us cut through the competition and build momentum for our music.

In late September, we went into the studio and laid down the basic tracks for five songs - half the record! We are fortunate: as professional musicians, we have access to home recording equipment and a producer with the skills and experience to make the most of them, enabling us significant savings in studio time. But acoustic instruments are still notoriously challenging to record, and we don’t want to cut corners on getting the best sounds possible, so we are working with the wonderful Justin Guip at Milan Hill Studio in Red Hook, NY to get some amazing sounds down on our basic tracks.

Every bit helps! But if we don’t quite reach our entire goal, the funds we have will go towards the production of the album and fulfillment of the perks, with whatever funds are left earmarked for publicity and promotion of its release. Our priority is fulfilling our promises to our supporters first and foremost!

THE PERKS

- Northeast signed CD

- Northeast digital download

- Northeast signed CD, download, plus handwritten recipe cards of some of Sara’s favorite family recipes (no casseroles, oddly enough)

- Daisycutter t-shirts, coffee mugs, plus other cool merch

- Fiddle lessons with Sara (Skype or in-person)

- Backyard chicken keeping consultation with Sara (Skype or in-person)

- Sara records fiddle on YOUR songs!

- House Concerts
+ MORE!

CHALLENGES

Making an album is a challenging undertaking. We have half the material arranged, with basic tracking already completed. The other half will take time and creative and technical energy! Round 2 of basic tracking, as well as overdubs and adding the musical icing is scheduled for this winter, as we’re planning a spring 2019 release. The biggest challenge is the unknown: life, scheduling snafus, and snowstorms! There’s no predicting what obstacles might pop up, but as professional musicians, we’re also professional problem-solvers, with hundreds of hours of recording experience.

OTHER WAYS TO HELP

Help comes in many forms! Apart from contributing to the campaign, you can help us tremendously by sharing this campaign with other like-minded folks who might be interested in what we’re doing! Help us make some noise by using the Indiegogo share tools here!

You can also keep in touch the old-fashioned way by joining our email list (daisycutter.net) to see when we’ll be in your neck of the woods – we’d love to connect!

Northeast is my 7th studio album, and the third with my alt-country band Daisycutter, roots music veterans all. From my farm girl roots to the cities, towns, and wide-open spaces I’ve experienced touring nationally and beyond, this album explores the stories of the Northeast, from rural to Rust Belt. This campaign will make possible not only the recording and production of the album, but enable promotional support upon its release. We are timing the campaign to end on the first day of Winter, ushering in the season of reflection and rebirth here in the Northeast.
THE ALBUM 
We are taciturn upstate New Yorkers. Sharing our feelings can be an uphill battle at times for us. We're not all that comfortable in situations that can't be assuaged with a socket wrench or a casserole. We're pretty much adrift in this brave new world that thrives on the constant sharing of bits of ourselves.
We're making a new album.
We expected to be excited about this whole undertaking, and wow, are we ever inspired by the music coming out of it. But it's a little too intense to feel quite so... sparkly... Winter's long shadow is peeking around the corner. It's an honest time of year, an unyielding one, an unforgiving one. These songs are the hardy fruit borne of those creative seeds that survived the frost. We're more proud of, more invested in, and feel these songs represent us more honestly than ever. We want more than anything to release them into the light of spring. It means everything to us to be able to share our music with others who want to listen. Hopefully these songs will mean as much to you as they do to us.
If you'd like to help us bring this album to completion, read on! We have various (hopefully interesting!) ways you can choose to be involved. And your support means everything to us. We might be awkward introverts, but we know it takes a village.
Thank you, truly.-Sara
This album is dedicated to our dear departed band mate, friend, and brother-in-music, Andy Goessling. Thank you, Andy, for casting such a long, wonderful shadow these last ten years. We will miss you more than we'll ever be able to say. (Partially because we're taciturn Northerners, and not good with words anyway.)
THE CAMPAIGN
Asking for support for this project is just as challenging as emoting for us quiet, Northern-types. But as full time working musicians, we need your help to get these songs out into the world (and also let the world know they’re out there!)
We are aiming for $15,000. Half of that will cover the cost of recording: the studio time, musicians, mixing/mastering, artwork, and production of physical copies of the album and merchandise. The other half will enable us to hire a publicist to help us get the word out to press and radio. In a digitally-driven, DIY world, that promotional support is essential to helping us cut through the competition and build momentum for our music.
In late September, we went into the studio and laid down the basic tracks for five songs - half the record! We are fortunate: as professional musicians, we have access to home recording equipment and a producer with the skills and experience to make the most of them, enabling us significant savings in studio time. But acoustic instruments are still notoriously challenging to record, and we don’t want to cut corners on getting the best sounds possible, so we are working with the wonderful Justin Guip at Milan Hill Studio in Red Hook, NY to get some amazing sounds down on our basic tracks.
Every bit helps! But if we don’t quite reach our entire goal, the funds we have will go towards the production of the album and fulfillment of the perks, with whatever funds are left earmarked for publicity and promotion of its release. Our priority is fulfilling our promises to our supporters first and foremost!
THE PERKS
- Northeast signed CD
- Northeast digital download
- Northeast signed CD, download, plus handwritten recipe cards of some of Sara’s favorite family recipes (no casseroles, oddly enough)
- Daisycutter t-shirts, coffee mugs, plus other cool merch
- Fiddle lessons with Sara (Skype or in-person)
- Backyard chicken keeping consultation with Sara (Skype or in-person)
- Sara records fiddle on YOUR songs!
- House Concerts+ MORE!
CHALLENGES
Making an album is a challenging undertaking. We have half the material arranged, with basic tracking already completed. The other half will take time and creative and technical energy! Round 2 of basic tracking, as well as overdubs and adding the musical icing is scheduled for this winter, as we’re planning a spring 2019 release. The biggest challenge is the unknown: life, scheduling snafus, and snowstorms! There’s no predicting what obstacles might pop up, but as professional musicians, we’re also professional problem-solvers, with hundreds of hours of recording experience.
OTHER WAYS TO HELP
Help comes in many forms! Apart from contributing to the campaign, you can help us tremendously by sharing this campaign with other like-minded folks who might be interested in what we’re doing! Help us make some noise by using the Indiegogo share tools here!
You can also keep in touch the old-fashioned way by joining our email list (daisycutter.net) to see when we’ll be in your neck of the woods – we’d love to connect!
